loans.name: Cristina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cristina lo conforman cinco mujeres trabajadora y esforzadas ellas son Miriam Cristina, Johana Liseth , María Cristina, Yamileth  y Martha Ligia. La coordinadora del grupo es Miriam Cristina  quien es comerciante de tiste, pozol y tamales rellenos desde hace 15 años. Ella inicio su negocio con unos pocos tamales  y poco a poco fue creciendo su negocio.

Ella tiene 5 hijos  de los cuales solo uno es menor de edad.

Las otras integrantes Johana Liseth  se dedica a la venta de comida como chanco con yuca, pollo y carne asada desde hace 7 años, María Cristina  desde hace 8 años vende ropa, Yamileth de 38 años tiene una mini pulpería desde hace 5 años y Martha Ligia tiene una pulpería desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
The Cristina group is made up of five hard-working women: Miriam Cristina, Johana Liseth, María Cristina, Yamileth and Martha Ligia.  The group's coordinator is Miriam Cristina who sells tiste and pozol (both types of drink) and stuffed tamales.  She has been in this business for 15 years.  She started out selling just a few tamales and gradually grew the business.  She has five children, four of whom are grown up.

The other members of the group are Johana Liseth, who has been selling meals such as pork with cassava, chicken and roast meat for seven years; María Cristina, who has been selling clothes for eight years; 38 year-old Yamileth, who has owned a small grocery store for five years, and Martha Ligia who has owned a grocery store for ten years.

loans.use: to buy corn, cacao, etc.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 42 years old, married and blessed with two children.  For over eight years, he has been earning a living from his retail shop. Apart from operating the retail shop, he is a dairy farmer.  With extra income from his farm, he is able to meet his family’s needs including educating his children.  He hopes to transform his retail shop into wholesale in the future.  With the loan of 20,000 Kes, he will buy maize flour and crates of soda.

loans.use: To buy maize flour and crates of soda.

loans.name: Viviano

texts.es: Viviano de 38 años, reside en el caserío de Llanco; ahí formó su familia junto a  su esposa y sus 2 hijas a las que quiere con mucho amor y cariño en su casa propia. Desde muy niño sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra, le gustaba ver como crecían y maduraban; su experiencia de 20 años en la agricultura le ayudó a conseguir muchas cosas como su casa en la que hoy vive muy feliz. Ahora se dedica a la siembra de papa y arveja en un terreno que alquila en el pueblo de Jachapata, donde pasa la mayor parte del día ya que tiene que cuidar su cosecha de las plaga de insectos que en este tiempo están asolando su siembra. Viviano se propuso una meta para este año, juntar capital para poder comprar su propio terreno en Llanco y estar más tiempo con su familia; ya le falta muy poco. Por otro lado en la última cosecha de arveja, obtuvo un rendimiento de 40 sacos de producción que le brindaron buenas ganancias y que le están permitiendo ahorrar para el futuro. Él agradece el apoyo de su banco comunal, ya que le enseñaron a seguir adelante a pesar de las dificultades. “Trabajo constantemente para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a mis hijos”, menciona con orgullo; “La mayor parte de mi ganancia lo invierto en ellos”, finaliza. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los ángeles de Llanco” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Viviano de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 8 sacos de semilla de papa de la variedad “andina”, que cuesta un promedio de S/. 40 soles cada saco. Asimismo 6 sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre su sembrío y de esa manera obtenga un buen fruto.
texts.en:
Viviano is 38 years old, and he lives in Llanco, a rural community.  That is where he lives in his own house with his family, his wife and his two daughters that he loves a lot.

When he was a very young boy his parents taught him how to work the land.  He liked seeing how the plants grew and matured.  His 20 years of experience helped him to obtain many things like the house in which he now very happily lives.

He now grows potatoes and peas on land that he rents in the village of Jachapata.  He spends most of his day there.  He needs to take care of his crops so that do not have insect infestations, which at this time continue to plaque his crops.   

Viviano has set a goal for this year.  It is to get together money to be able to buy his own land in Llanco and to spend more time with his family.  He now needs very little.  The last pea harvest yielded 40 sacks, which provided him with good earnings and is allowing him to save for the future.

He is grateful for the support of his communal bank because they taught him how to get ahead in spite of the difficulties.  “I work constantly in order to be able to provide my children with a better quality of life,” he says proudly.  He finishes by saying, “I invest most of my earnings in them.”

He belongs to the Los Ángeles de Llanco Communal Bank.  This is his eighth loan with MFP.  He hopes to have their collaboration in order to meet his objectives.  He pledges, once more, to make his payments as he has done with his previous loans.  It pleases him to be part of his communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.

Viviano will use the requested money to buy eight sacks of Andean potato seeds, which cost an average of S/. 40 per sack.  He will also buy six sacks of organic fertilizer to spread amongst his plants.  That way he will obtain good results.

loans.use: to buy eight sacks of potato seeds and six sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Elma has a vulcanizing shop that repairs vehicles & motors, with her husband working as the repairman. She has had this business for 11 years. Elma has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for the utilities needed for the shop.

Elma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy tools & pay utilities costs

loans.name: Donne Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "Donne" ubicado en el estado D. México. Esta conformado por 11 integrantes entre ellas se encuentra la señora Maria D. 38 años D. edad, ella es madre soltera tiene dos hijos uno 12 y otro D. 1 año D. edad; la señora nos platica que lleva un poco mas D. un año trabajando en su tienda D. abarrotes, inicio porque ya no le alcanzaba el dinero para los gastos D. su familia; inicio el negocio con muy poca mercancia y muchas iluciones pero poco a poco comenzo a tener mas clientes y ahora tiene que invertir en mayor mercancia para abastecer la demanda D. sus clientes, su deseo es establecer y mejorar su negocio. Con el prestamo que obtenga lo invertirá para comprar refrescos, enlatados, articulos para el hogar. La señora Maria le pone mucho empeño en su trabajo, ya que su mayor motivacion son sus hijos y su familia siempre la ha apoyado desea brindarle a sus hijos una carrera para que tengan una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The group is called “Donne” and is located in the State of México.  It has 11 members;  among them is María, 38.  She is a single mother of two children, a 12-year-old and a 1-year-old.  She tells us that she’s been working for a little more than a year in her grocery store.  She started it because she did not have enough money to cover family expenses.  She started the business with very little stock merchandise but with great hopes.  Gradually she started having more customers and now she has to invest in more merchandise to meet customer demand.  Her wish is to better establish her store.

She will use the loan she gets to buy soft drinks, canned goods and items for the home.  María puts a lot of effort into her work; her greatest motivators are her children.  Her family has always supported her efforts and she wants to proviD. her children with careers so that they’ll have better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods and items for the home.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina, 51, lives in the Philippines and is married with five children. She has a retail shop that sells fish-like sardines and mackerel, a business she has had for three years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Avelina is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Avelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase shirts, skirts and shorts for adults and children.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 48, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo, a driver; and mother to their child. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Susan operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Susan earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 870 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Susan hopes to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Felix Norberto

texts.es:
Félix, vive con su familia, una hija de 5 años de edad, él se dedica a la albañilería, lo aprendió hace 10 años, porque su padre se lo enseño, su horario es de lunes a viernes de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Félix está realizando el trabajo en un dormitorio de su vivienda, para esto necesita el préstamo, que le facilite la compra de materiales de construcción, como cemento, arena, ladrillo, mejorando así las instalaciones de la casa.
Tiene el propósito de realizar cada día su trabajo de mejor manera, apoyar a su hija en todo lo que sea posible y ofrecerle una vida digna.
texts.en:
Félix lives with his family, a 5-year-old daughter.  He works in the building trade which he learned ten years ago because his father taught him.  He works from 6.00am to 3.00pm, Monday to Friday.

Félix is working on a bedroom in his home.  He needs this loan to buy building supplies such as cement, sand and bricks so that he can improve his home.

Félix plans to carry out his work better and better every day, to support his daughter as well as he can and to offer her a decent life.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and bricks

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32-years-old, married and has three children.

Houssam has owned a shop since 2007, selling women's, men's and kid’s shoes. He has more than three years experience and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His shop is located in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passing by. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $1800 loan in order to make a sliding door, showcases and digital ads. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make a sliding door, showcases and digital ads.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a married man with one child who attends school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and rent bills.

For the past 10 years, he has operated a vegetable stall business, selling at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business. During the dry hot season, the availability of green vegetables is lower compared to rainy seasons. He dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000 loan, he wants to renovate his vegetable stall, and buy green vegetables and tomatoes. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To renovate his vegetable stall, and buy green vegetables and tomatoes.

loans.name: Turmunh

texts.en:
Turmunh is 48 years old and lives with his wife and children in a ger in Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. His wife has a private business and his two children are high school students. 

Turmunh started his business in 2006 by making Mongolian traditional shoes and biscuits at his home. He has many years of work and business experience. He is planning to expand his business activity. Turmunh is a diligent and hard working man who says "with the bank loan, I want to expand my business and increase my business income. Also I will need to pay the college tuition fees of my children soon." 

He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy raw materials for biscuits and shoes.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for biscuits and shoes

loans.name: Cindy

texts.en:
Cindy is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Cindy has a shop that sells fish like sardines & salmon. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fish to sell.

Cindy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cindy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Maysour

texts.en: Maysour is a 32-year-old married man living with his wife and three children who are still attending school.  His wife, who has worked as a female hairdresser since 2005 receiving clients at her home, helps him with the household expenses. As for Maysour, he has been working as a taxi driver since 2002 transporting customers wherever they want. Today, he’s asking to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his car's engine and increase its safety features. In the future, he plans to purchase another car and hire an employee to work on his behalf.

loans.use: to renew his car's engine and increase its safety features

loans.name: Nhip

texts.en:
Nhip, 37, has been engaged in selling fruit and vegetables for over 14 years. She lives with three children (two sons and one daughter) and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a driver.

Nhip sells a variety of fruit and vegetables such as green pumpkins, bitter melons, cucumbers and bananas. Her business is able to generate sufficient income to cover her family's everyday expenses. 

Nhip would like to request a loan to improve her business by buying a larger quantity and variety of fruit and vegetables to sell. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity and variety of fruit and vegetables to stock her store.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 71 years old and lives in Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 7 children. 
Loreta has a shop that sells products such as toothpaste, soap, canned goods and biscuits. She has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 50000 to purchase additional products such as toothpaste, soap, canned goods and biscuits.
Loreta has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Loreta hopes to save money in case of a future emergency.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as toothpaste, soap, canned goods and biscuits.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She is a 47-year-old married woman with six children. 

Zenaida primarily grows rice crops to sell. She requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

Zenaida works hard to improve her business. She hopes for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rabina

texts.en:
Rabina is 36 years old . She is married and has 2 children, aged 19 and 17. In 2000, she established her grocery store business. She works 7 days a week and 10 hours a day to support her family.

She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy groceries for her business. In the future, Rabina plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, a small grocery store, called a 'pasal', is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase their profitability. While a typical 'pasal' might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys inventory for her grocery store.

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es:
Giovana nació en la ciudad del Cusco pero vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo (La ciudad es un sitio arqueológico incaico, capital del Distrito de Ollantaytambo (Provincia de Urubamba), situado al sur del Perú, a unos 90 km al noroeste de la ciudad del Cuzco.). 

Giovana tiene 40 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos y un hijo en espera, ella se dedica a la venta de artesanía, ella tiene un puesto de venta en la calle principal de la estación de trenes en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. Ya son 14 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Giovana tiene la oportunidad de ampliar el local del negocio ósea quiere construir un segundo piso por ese motivo requiere el préstamo para comprar  materiales como calaminas, palos, cemento y otras cosas más. 

Giovana es integrante del grupo “Siempre Adelante” lo conforman 12 socios que viven en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Giovana was born in the city of Cusco, but she lives in the city of Ollantaytambo.  The city is an Inca archeological site and it is the capital of the district of Ollantaytambo, which is in the Urubamba Province.  It is located in the south of Peru, about 90 km. northeast of the city of Cusco.

Giovana is 40 years old, married, and has four children and one on the way.  She sells handicrafts for a living and she has a stand on the main street by the train station in the city of Ollantaytambo.  She has had her business for 14 years now and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  Giovana has the opportunity to expand her location, which is to say she wants to build a second floor and she needs this loan to buy materials such as corrugated iron, posts, cement, and other things.

Giovana is a member of the Siempre Adelante Group, which is made up of 12 members who live and work in the city of Ollantaytambo.

loans.use: to buy materials such as corrugated iron, posts, cement, and other things

loans.name: Divina Misericordia - El  Tambo Group

texts.es:
La señora BERTHA de 54 años de edad de estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos menores de edad. Es socias de la  alcancía comunal “Divina Misericordia - El Tambo”.
Actualmente tiene una Tienda de Distribuidoras de Extintores que atiende conjuntamente con su esposo y  la vez  Vende de Productos Medicinales Naturales que ofrece de vivienda en vivienda. El préstamo solicito para invertir en la remodelación e implementación de la tienda de Ventas de Extintores, dándose la oportunidad para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Desea en el futuro comprar su auto para el servicio de traslado de su mercaderías, ella está ubicada la tercera persona lado izquierda sentada en una silla viste con una un chompa color crema puesta con un lentes.
texts.en:
Bertha, age 54, is married and has four minor children.  She is a member of the Divina Misericordia – El Tambo communal bank.

She currently has a store distributing fire extinguishers.  She and her husband tend to the store together.  At the same time she sells natural medicinal products door to door.

The requested loan is for the remodeling and implementation of the store selling fire extinguishers.  This gives her the opportunity to improve her income.

In the future she hopes to buy a car for transporting her merchandise.  

In the photo she is the third person on the left side in a chair.  She is wearing a cream colored sweater, and she is wearing glasses.

loans.use: to buy fire extinguishers.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is divorced and has two children. She sells cloth and bags near Kwarhinkrom, which she has done for five years. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children, as well as pay their school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more cloth and bags. She hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and bags.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mumtaz  is 39 years old, hardworking woman. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Mumtaz ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. Mumtaz  has requested for a loan amount 40000 PKR. She intends to use this loan  to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase another knapsack sprayer for rental

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Mrs. Antonia C. has a business in which she sells roasted chicken, meals and refreshments. This business is located in the Villa Nuevo Potosi neighborhood, on a hillside to the East of the city of La Paz. She has three married daughters who help her with taking care of her lodgings. She is 53 years of age, and has more than 15 years of experience in developing her business. Her sales and the preparation of meals take place daily, and if there is a surplus, it is used by relatives and the family. She has been a client of Impro since April of 2000. Her history with our institution qualifies her as a number one client, which is to say she has an excellent record of paying her obligations. The amount asked for is intended for the wholesale purchase of items such as potatos, rice and salsas, with the objective of lowering operating costs. Her work and previous dealings with Impro gives her access to this credit since she has experience in her business which provides income to pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Dwight Davis, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La Sra. Antonia, tiene un negocio donde vende pollo broster, comida y refrescos, el cual se halla ubicado en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí (Ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz). Tiene tres hijas que están casadas y le ayudan en la atención de la pensión. Tiene 53 años y tiene experiencia en el desarrollo de su trabajo de más de 15 años. Sus ventas y elaboración de comida son al día y si existe excedente es para el consumo familiar. Es cliente de Impro, desde abril del año 2000. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento excelente en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de insumos (papa, arroz, refrescos, salsas) al por mayor con el objetivo de abaratar costos operativos. Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs Hong is 50 years old. Her husband died of cancer. She is supporting three children by herself. Her first son stopped attending school. He now works as a daily laborer but he suffers from asthma, so he can't work hard. Mrs. Hong must pay medical treatment for her first son. Her second and third are now going to school in grades 9 and 10. Mrs. Hong only has 2, 5 square meters. Hong is selling cashew nuts, rice, and pepper. These are important, because they will help increase her income by $1/person/month. Avg. income is low at $8/person/month. She asks to borrow a loan of $50 for her selling business.

loans.use: selling cashew nuts

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Thirty-four year old N. Charles is married and a father of one child. As a motorcycle driver, he has not been able to raise enough money to provide for his family because of his ill health and his inability to repair and replace old motor cycle parts.

With a first loan of $100, he plans to buy new tires, repair his motorcycle, and buy a new seat for his motorcycle. He believes he will invest and repay the loan successfully in 15 months because a motorcycle is a necessary means of transport in this locality. With the profit, he will provide for his families, buy medications, and save some for future investment.

He plans to pay the loan in 15 months.

loans.use: Purchase tires, new seat, repairs

loans.name: Gulhuseyn

texts.en: Three years ago Gulhuseyn started his own business. He is 26 years old and single and lives in Yenikand village, in the Salyan region. Gulhuseyn needs a loan of $1200  to purchase pesticides and fertilizer for his orchard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Iupeli

texts.en: Iupeli has had her eye on utilizing her sewing skills and knowledge as a form of business venture for her and her family. With this loan she is looking into beginning a new business, namely garment-making, and she hopes to attract customers not just from her village but also from neighbouring villages, or even families that live close by or far from where she lives. It is quite expensive to buy readymade clothes these days, and Iupeli is would now begin to save for buying new clothes as she starts to make garments of her own, not just for use but also for sale. She is looking forward to the business idea and would like to further use the assistance of SPBD (the lender) in the future.

loans.use: To start a sewing business by buying supplies and equipment

loans.name: Nisolat

texts.en: Nisolat S. lives in Mastchokh; she is married and has 5 children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004. Loan sums are permanently increased, which shows her business stability and income increase. She describes herself as a serious and experienced client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. She is engaged in the commercial services and trade. She works the food products selling (cheese, condensate milk, flour products, sweets and etc). Nisolat S. works in bazaar. She has the wide-side assortment and the permanent clients. She is experienced in the business. Working in bazaar she meets the hard competitors that is why she wants to wide the existing assortment by the new products purchase. Now she requires a loan in 2000 STJ for business support and the existing assortment expansion.

loans.use: Food products.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala M. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 33 years old and is single. She rented a beauty salon in Beylagan, and has been in this business since 2004.

Kamala applied for a loan of $400 from Normicro Beylagan Branch to develop her beauty salon. She wants to bring modern equipment to her salon so she can offer the best services to her customers. She wants to bring more customers to her salon through marketing and increase her income.

loans.use: To expand beauty salon

loans.name: Groupe Aminou & Frere

texts.fr:
AMINOU & BROS. is owned by five persons specializing in the sale of fuel. Given the disastrous condition of the roads, tanker trucks cannot supply the area. So these individuals came together to supply the area's inhabitants by going into town for fuel. This business has been owned by this group for over five years. Using this loan, they wish to install a storage tank in order to meet the very fast-growing demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

AMINOU & FRERES est tenu par 5 personnes spécialisé dans la vente de carburant. Etant donné l’état désastreux des routes les camions citernes ne peuvent pas alimenter la localité. Alors ces particuliers se sont joints pour alimenter habitants de la localité en allant se ravitailler en ville. Ce commerce est tenu par ce groupe depuis plus de 05 ans. Par ces fonds, ils désirent se faire installer une citerne afin de satisfaire la demande très croissante de la population.

loans.use: To buy and install a storage tank

loans.name: Sulfa

texts.en:
Mr. Sulfa L. and his wife, Khortichas Tres, have been married for twelve years. They have five children; four sons and one daughter. Three of their children are in school and the other two are still young and stay at home. The house is along the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Sulfa has been selling goats since late last year. He buys goats from nearby provinces and sells them in Phnom Penh. He used to do this business two years ago. Now, he is starting it again, because the goats now command a good price. His wife stays at home takes care of their children.

Mr. Sulfa is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of US$800 to purchase goats for resale.

loans.use: To purchase goats for resale

loans.name: Aba Kate

texts.en:
A. Aba Kate travels to a distant town to buy food supplies in bulk. She is married and has 3 children. Business is very good but the cost of transportation is her major problem.

She is asking for $725 as additional capital for transportation costs.

loans.use: As additional capital for transportation costs

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
Fabian vende ropa de mujer y enseres para el hogar. Su esposa le ayuda en este negocio, el cual es su única fuente de Ingresos que tienen para mantener a la familia. Ellos viven en la casa de los abuelos de Fabian, en la zona de sopocachi de la ciudad de La paz.

Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro; el monto solicitado será destinado para compra de mercadería (ropa de mujer, y algunos enseres para el hogar). Debido a la rentabilidad de su negocio, la determinación de este micro empresario y su experiencia  en el comercio, el cliente es apto  para acceder a este crédito. Fabian es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2004 y sus antecedentes e historial de pagos es considerado muy bueno.

loans.use: compra de más mercadería para su negocio de venta de ropa de mujer y enseres para el hogar.

loans.name: Fidayaddin

texts.en: Fidayaddin is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Fuzuli region of the occupied territory of Azerbaijan.  He was born in 1974. Fidayaddin is married, with 2 children. He settled in Baku city, Yasamal region. He has been in this business for 10 years. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy the necessary things for improving his hairdressing salon.

loans.use: To buy the necessary things for improving his hairdressing salon

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Saroeurn K. sells second-hand clothes in Kampong Os Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  Aside from this business activity, she is a tailor. Since her businesses are going well, Mrs. Saroeurn K. would like to expand them by asking for a loan to buy more second-hand clothes to increase her inventory. Mrs. Saroeurn K. is a 51-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is working in a NGO, while the other is attending school.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr: Dame E. Georgette est née le 22 Décembre 1980 au GABON. Togolaise de nationalité, elle est célibataire sans enfant . Elle réside au BENIN depuis 1993 et à une forte expérience dans la distribution vente. Actuellement, elle a loué une boutique et s'est spécialisée dans la vente des produits de la Société Béninoise de Brasserie (SOBEBRA), des liqueurs, des tissus, du repas prêt à manger et divers produits de consommation courante. Son chiffre d'affaire journalier n'est pas négligeable. Le volume de son activité a augmenté et aujourd'hui elle a des difficultés de trésorerie. Elle vient donc solliciter ce prêt pour satisfaire ses nombreux clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Georgette E. was born on December 22, 1980 in Gabon. She is a citizen of Togo, single and has no children. She has lived in BENIN since 1993 and has a strong experience in the retail business. She is currently renting a shop and specializes in the sale of goods from the Société Béninoise de Brasserie (SOBEBRA), liquor, fabric, ready to eat meals and various every day goods. Her daily sales figure are not insignificant. Her business volume has increased and today she has a cash flow problem. She is requesting this loan to meet her clients demand.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 15 bottles of liquor, 2 boxes of couscous and 5 cases of beer

loans.name: Husna

texts.en:
Husna is 22 years old and she is single. She has been a clothes and shoes seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Husna is now looking for a loan to buy more shoes and clothes for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothes for the  expansion of her business

loans.name: In

texts.en: In H., 46 years old, makes a living by selling rice cakes in the village, earning approximately US$1 per day. Meanwhile, her husband is a teacher and makes only about US$2 a day. This couple lives in Kampong Cham and has three children. Two of their children work as tailors in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. In H. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to open a tailor shop for her children.

loans.use: To open a tailor shop for her children.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther T. is 34 years old and married with four children. Esther has a shop where she sells baby things, like flasks, feeding bottles, and clothes. Her customers are mostly pregnant women and breast-feeding mothers.

The demands for her goods are high and she needs a loan in the amount of N71,000 to purchase more baby things to sell. She hopes to also support her husband and children with the profit she makes from her sales. She says thank you to all the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby things to sell.

loans.name: Emma Albertina

texts.es:
Emma pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Grandes Retos”, del distrito de Independencia, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Emma tiene 46 años de edad y es casada. Las dificultades más grandes que tuvo fue en que un tiempo su esposo no trabajaba y ella tenía que ver por sus cuatro hijos. Hace 20 años se dedica a comercializar animales menores. Comenta que al empezar sólo contaba con S/.10 y que poco a poco ha ido creciendo, tan es así, que ahora tiene invertido en todo su negocio alrededor de S/.4,000. Los días de compra casi siempre es semanal, menciona que tienen mayores venta cuando requieren sus productos en fiestas especiales como día de la madre, día del padre, fiestas patrias y navidad. Trae sus productos del callejón de Huaylas, busca los productos de más bajos precio, de tal manera que puede venderlos a mayor precio en la ciudad de Huaraz, específicamente en la esquina de Juan de la Cruz Romero con la Av. Antonio Rayomdi. Como vendedora ambulante, su principal dificultad es que a veces los animales mueren y eso hace que disminuya la inversión. 

Con este préstamo de S/.1,700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de pavos para las fiestas navideñas.
 
A Emma le gustaría capacitarse para mejorar en su vida familiar y en su negocio.
texts.en:
Emma is 46-years-old and is married. She went through a hard time when her husband was unemployed and she alone had to make ends meet for their four children. About 20 years ago she decided to get into business raising small livestock such as rabbits, hens, and turkeys. She tells us that when she began she only had the equivalent of $3 USD to invest in her business but she been able to invest more money, little by little, up $1,280 USD today. She takes her animals to market nearly every week and tells us that her sales are higher during holidays such as Mother’s Day, Father’s Day, national holidays and Christmas. She checks prices on Huaylas street, so that she can sell her animals for the best price in the city of Huaraz. Her greatest difficulty is that at times one of her animals dies and then, naturally, she cannot sell it on and she loses her investment. With this loan of $550, which Emma will repay in four installments, she will purchase turkeys in advance of Christmas holidays. This loan will help Emma improve her business and the life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Molloy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of turkeys

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina  se dedica a la venta de equipos pequeños audio visuales como ser MP3, MP4  y otros.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Alto la Florida de la de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive en alquiler ya que no cuenta con una vivienda propia.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería (MP3, MP4,FLASH MEMORY Y OTROS)
Es una persona luchadora ya que es madre soltera y su pequeña hija esta en el nivel inicial de Zinder (pre-school).
texts.en:
Marina sells small audio visual equipment such as MP3 and MP4 players. Her home is located in the Alto la Florida zone of the city of La Paz. She lives in a rental home because she does not have her own home. The loan will be used to buy merchandise for her to sell (MP3, MP4, Flash Memory, etc.) She is a person who is a fighter--she is a single mother to her small daughter who is starting pre-school.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy MP3, MP4, flash memory and other electronics to sell

loans.name: Marufjon

texts.en:
Marufjon K. lives in Kystakuz. He is married and has 3 children. Marufjon has been a client of our micro-finance programme only since 2008, but he has shown himself already as a serious man. He is a taxi driver by trade and for the last five years, he has been working with his own car. Besides that, Marufjon is engaged in the family business of raising livestock. He and his wife take care of animals and then they sell them. It is a good business since it brings in general family income.

Marufjon is asking KIVA to support the livestock business that he had started 2 years ago. He is asking for 2300 STJ for 8 months to start building a cow stable for summer time. He thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: to start building the cow stable for summer time

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra inició el negocio   Porque cuando vivía su esposo a veces no le iba muy bien en su trabajo y ella quiso ayudarlo con los gastos de la casa y después, cuando el falleció, gracias al negocio pudo subsistir y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Comenzó el negocio  en Marzo de 1985 todavía vivía su esposo, el trabajaba como empleado y ella atendía la tienda y como su casa quedaba en una calle muy transitada, acondicionaron el patio de su casa y puso un local de madera pequeño. Empezó con un local pequeñito, pero gracias a su crédito anterior con Kiva pudo ampliar y acondicionar mejor su local y ahora cuenta con mayor espacio

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $8,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas  para comprar más abarrotes que le permita tener mejor surtida su tienda y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes
texts.en:
Alejandra started her business because when she lived with her husband sometimes things did not go well at his work and she wanted to help him with the household expenses and later when he died she was able to survive and take care of her children thanks to the business. She opened her business in March 1985 when her husband was still alive. He was employed elsewhere and she took care of the store and since her home was on a very busy street, they installed air conditioning to the patio and set up a small wood store. She started with a tiny store but thanks to previous loans from Kiva she was able to expand and better air condition her store and today has a larger space. She needs a loan of MXN $8,000 which she will repay in 12 installments to buy more groceries which will allow her to be better stocked and give her customers better service.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 34 year old Happiness M. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, ages 10 and 13 years old. She is also responsible for supporting one dependent, adopted because his parents abandoned him. Happiness has been running a food shop since 2008. She sells cooking oil, rice, soda and salt and works at her business for 12 hours a day, 6 days a week. Happiness currently earns about 250USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase wheat flour, rice, sugar and soaps. In the future, she plans to open a second business. Happiness thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, rice, sugar and soap

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Ami Lô est mariée avec 10 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Thiaré Dendel depuis 8 ans et demi. Ami veut  acheter des moutons et des engrais pour renforcer son activité d’embouche ovine et de vente d’engrais Ses revenus lui permettent de prendre en charge sa famille Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ami Lô, is married and raising 10 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Thiaré Dendel for 8 and a half years. Ami wants to buy sheep and fertilizer to bolster her little business fattening sheep and selling fertilizer. Her income will permit her to support her family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raising sheep and selling fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make molds and iron gates

loans.name: Sithvanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Sithvanny R., 42, and her husband, Mr. Chinda Duch, 44, were married in 1993 and have one daughter who is in the local school. Besides her daughter, she also has one niece who is a silk weaver and one elderly mother who live with her. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sithvanny has been a silk weaver for 22 years. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a mason for 16 years. He works in Phnom Penh.  She is requesting her first loan of US$500 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to buy construction materials to build a stone pillar for her house.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for business and to buy construction materials to build a stone pillar for her house.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Z. D. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cruz D. Motupe”, vive en Patay Bajo San Pedro Mz D Lt2  Distrito D. Independencia – Provincia D. Huaraz Departamento D. Ancash.  Está casada y tiene 57 años.  Es madre D. 04 hijos, 1 depenD. D. ella.
Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00  incrementó su mercadería para su negocio D. venta D. ajíes y tubérculos, compró 50kg D. ajíes. Tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.
En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio en un puesto alquilado del mercado informal  D. Pedregal D. la ciudad D. Huaraz, donD. ofrece sus productos a todos los moradores D. la ciudad y público en general.
Con este crédito D. S/. 1700.00  comprará D. 150 Kg. D. ajíes panca.
Actualmente es una mujer independiente y segura ya que gracias a los ingresos que genera su negocio pueD. educar a su hija que estudia ingeniería civil.
Claudia manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por haberle enseñado la cultura del ahorro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claudia Z. D. R. belongs to the Village Bank “Cruz D. Motupe”, and lives in Patay Bajo San Pedro Mz D Lt2 Independence District– Huaraz Province, Department of Ancash. She is married and is 57 years old. She is a mother 4 children, with one who is dependent on her. With the first loan of 300.00 soles they increased merchandise for their business selling peppers and tubers, they bought 50 kg. of peppers. She has worked with the Village Bank for 2 years. Currently, she continues to work with the same business out of a rented space in the Pedregal informal market in the city of Huaraz, where they offer products to all city residents and the general public. With this loan of 1700.00 soles, she will buy 150 kg. of Panca peppers. Right now she is an independent women with security thanks to the income generated from her business, she is able to educate her daughter who is studying civil engineering. Claudia would like to thank Manuela Ramos for having taught her the culture of savings.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase Panca peppers.

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en: Wassim, a 29-year-old man living in Makseh, Bekaa Valley, has owned a car repair shop since 2008. Today, Wassim would like to borrow $1,200 to buy a new machine to be able to better service his clients.

loans.use: To buy a new machine for the business.

loans.name: Setimaya

texts.en:
Setimaya L. works with her husband growing vegetables on a small plot of land in their village, Dolchoky, Nepal.

Setimaya is applying for a loan of Rs. 10, 000 to purchase new vegetable seedlings for her farm.

Usually this time of year in Nepal, typically referred to as ‘monsoon season’, there is a lot of rain and it is the best time for planting and growing crops. Unfortunately there has been very little rain so far and Setimaya is concerned that her produce will not sell as well as last year. Setimaya says that already some of her vegetables have been spoiled because they haven’t gotten enough water.

Setimaya has four daughters and one son. She hopes that from the income made by selling vegetables, she can provide her children with a good quality education.

loans.use: purchasing vegetable seedlings

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
K. Nguyễn Thị (1816071346) is a 51-year-old woman living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, K. owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling incense products to local businesses and community members. K. has been engaged in this business for over 11 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, K. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. K. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. K. is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. K. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a 51-year-old woman. She is married with five children who are currently in school. She is a food vendor and sells banku. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is eaten with hot pepper or soup. She has many customers since banku is enjoyed by many Ghanaian as breakfast, lunch or supper. She wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise her income to support her children's education. She dreams of making more profit with the assistance of the loan .

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for banku

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is a 38 year married with five children aged between 02 and 18 years. Four of her children Immaculate is a 38 year married with five children aged between 02 and 18 years. Four of her children go to school. She resides and rents a one roomed house where she is staying with five people. Immaculate doesn’t take care of any additional family members There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area.   She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping in Kibuye Market and goes for shopping thrice a week. Immaculate sells fruits and vegetables like  Avocado Sugar canes, Tomatoes, Oranges and Mangoes and on average she sells to 15 customers a day.  Immaculate sells to all categories of people and works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include monthly market dues rent medication. She has been in this business for the last two years Immaculate has been with MCDT for five years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to  buy more Sugar canes oranges mangoes baskets of Avocado Immaculate is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger ,and also owning  a permanent  business premise and home.
 

.

loans.use: to buy baskets of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil was born in 1987. He is single and lives in Ramallah, a city of Palestine.

Khalil owns a beauty salon in his neighborhood. He is requesting a loan of $1,500 which will help him buy marketing products and supplies needed to keep on offering high quality services.

Be part of Khalil’s success. He appreciates your help and thanks you for your trust and support.

loans.use: To buy marketing products and supplies

loans.name: Good Never Done Group

texts.en:
Above are Delvin A. S. and Kadiatu C., who named their group Good Never Done. Previous loans from SMT/Kiva have made meaningful contributions towards the development and well being of these entrepreneurs, enabling them to expand their businesses, make better sales and earn greater profits. Consequently, their standards of living have improved. Having fully repaid their previous loan, they are now requesting a new loan of Le 800,000 each to further strengthen their businesses.

Delvin A. S. (on the left in the photo), the leader of this group, was born in Magburaka, Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have four children, one in Junior Secondary School I, two in primary schools, and the fourth not yet of school-going age. Delvin and his wife have sold cosmetics and jewelry in the town’s main market for over ten years now. With previous SMT/Kiva loans, Delvin’s business has grown to the point that he has been able to build himself a small shop at the market.

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a direct-seller of cosmetics products within the village of San Fabian Echague. She is thankful because she has two children: Jefferson - 4 years old and Janice - 3 years old.

Marilyn would like to purchase additional products due to the many orders given to her by her customers. Accordingly, she would like to apply for a loan of PHP 5,000. She hopes that this loan she is requesting will be granted.

Marilyn is hoping and praying that she will be able to improve their way of living through the income she generates from her business.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta T. is from the village of Tag-ibo,  Iligan  City. She is 58 years old. Violeta is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Violeta owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products like the grilled fish or locally known as "tinap anan" and sometimes she peddles snacks in the local community. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Violeta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Violeta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie M. is from the village of Eastern Poblacion Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 21 years old. Virgie is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Virgie owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish in the local community. Virgie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Virgie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgie is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to repair her fishing boat. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Virgie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Arevshat

texts.en:
Arevshat M. lives in Sevan with his wife and a son.

Arevshat is a cook and he worked in different restaurants in his specialty for about ten years. In 2007 he decided to open his own catering trade in a rented place, the rent of which is 150,000 AMD per month. With the profit from his business Arevshat provides for his family’s and for his business’s needs. His wife and son help him in this business.

Up to now, Arevshat has served his clients in a big common restaurant room. Now he needs a $2,000 loan to convert a part of his restaurant room into several separate rooms which will increase the client flow to his restaurant.

loans.use: To convert a part of his restaurant into several separate rooms

loans.name: Chout

texts.en: Chout I., 43, is a determined and hardworking woman who resides in the best territory of Phnom Penh, a city of Cambodia. Presently Chout I. owns a small store next to her house where she sells different types of items to her neighbors or passers-by for a profit. She sells items such as medicine, cleaning tools, gasoline, and cooking ingredients. She is married to Sokhom, age 47, a garment factory worker. This couple was married a long time ago and has six children. Two of the children are married and the other four are single. Chout I. needs a loan to improve her enterprise to be more efficient. She will use her loan to accumulate more items to sell.

loans.use: To accumulate more items to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 57 years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to eight children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

Elizabeth is a trader. She trades in rice and groundnuts. She procures bags of rice and groundnuts from nearby communities. Elizabeth supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. She has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rice and groundnuts

loans.name: Pedro Efrain

texts.es:
Pedro C. de 21 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, tiene solo en su casa como servicios básicos solo agua y luz, su esposa trabaja de guardia privado con ella tiene 1 hija de 4 meses. 

Pedro empezó hace 1 año atrás el negocio de la papelería, ya que le daba tiempo para estar con su esposa.

Ahora el trabaja con la ayuda de su esposa y su mama de las 06h30 hasta las 21h00 todos los días, el vende cuadernos, hojas, lapices y otros suministros de bazar, una de las complicaciones que tiene es que no tiene un local propio para la papelería.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, fomix, plumas, hojas entre otros suministros para agrandar el negocio. En el futuro quiere poner sucursales de su negocio.
texts.en:
Pedro C. is 21 years old. He lives in a suburban area in el Fortín de Guayaquil. In his home he only has basic services like water and light. His wife works as a private security guard. They have a 4 month old daughter. Pedro opened his stationery shop business one year ago, since it gave him time to be with his wife. Now he works with his wife and his mother from 6:30am until 9pm every day. He sells notebooks, loose leaf paper, pencils and other supplies in a market. One of the problems Pedro faces is that he does not have his own shop for the stationery business. With the loan he will purchase notebooks, foam molds, pens, and loose leaf paper among other supplies to grow his business. In the future he would like to have additional branches of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, pencils, paper

loans.name: Habel

texts.en:
Habel is a 30-year-old gentleman who is married to Lucy Wanjiru. They have a one-year-old baby. He has been operating in a "boda-boda" business (a bicycle with a padded rear seat for transporting passengers or light goods) in Naivasha since 2007.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to purchase a locally made, customized engine for his bicycle which will help him transport people and goods for longer distances without getting tired, hence increasing his income.

He plans to buy a motorcycle for his business, instead of a bicycle, which is more manual. This will increase his income because it will be faster to take people to their destinations and come back for more.

loans.use: To buy an engine for his bicycle

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna E. is from the village of Caluya, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental.  She is 40 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for seven years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used for house renovation. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Myrna. She plans to use the additional capital from PMPC to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house renovation

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
En el Mercado Ivan Montenegro en Managua, la señora Socorro B. se dedica a la venta de lácteos como queso y cuajada elaborados por ella misma y ofrecidos en su establecimiento desde hace 15 años donde por medio de esta actividad obtiene los recursos para el sustento de su familia.

Actualmente ella está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de leche para elaborar los lácteos como son el queso y la cuajada con el fin de continuar comercializándolos en su local y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Socorro makes milk products, such as cheeses and milk curd, which she sells in the Ivan Montenegro market in Managua. She has been doing this for the past 15 years. This is the way she earns an income with which to support her family. Now she is requesting a loan in order to buy milk to make more products so that she can continue to sell and be able to satisfy her customers' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Milk for cheese making

loans.name: Sarwari Begum's Group

texts.en:
Sarwari Begum is the wife of A. H. and lives in the city of Vehari in Pakistan. She is the mother of eight children – five daughters and three sons. Her five daughters are enrolled in a local school while her two sons work in a factory for a monthly wage. Her husband runs a cold drinks corner in the food market.
Sarwari is a very nice woman. She owns and operates a sewing business. She sews clothes for women in her community and charges them different rates – for example, for designer clothes she charges 150 PKR and for simple stitching she charges 100 PKR. Her income allows her to share the financial burden with her husband.
Sarwari has successfully repaid her first loan to Asasah, a microfinance institutition in Pakistan and Kiva partner. Now she is requesting another loan to expand her husband’s cold drinks corner by buying cold drinks in bulk.

loans.use: To buy cold drinks in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah L., 34 years old, is a rice farmer. She has a farm which she hopes will provide her family with their daily needs. Deborah has five children. She wishes to sustain her livelihood more, so as to be able to improve her family’s economic condition.

Deborah started her business in 1994. She wants to obtain a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. which she will use to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like fertilizer

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Sokhna S. est  âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 25 juin 2002 et a reçu 15 fois de crédit. Elle fait de l’embouche ovine, une activité pour laquelle elle est très expérimentée pour l’avoir pratiquée depuis plus de 5 ans. Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter 10 paires de moutons et de l’aliment de bétail pour engraisser les bêtes pendant au moins 4 mois et les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa zone. Participe beaucoup à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille par l’achat de la nourriture et de vêtements pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Sokhna S. is 39 years old, married and the caring mother of 9 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank and has made 15 loans since June 25, 2002. Sokhna has developed extensive experience raising her sheep over the past five years. With this latest loan she would like to buy 10 head of sheep and feed to fatten her animals over the next four months. She will then sell her sheep at the local markets in her area. Sokhna works hard, buying food and clothing for her children and bettering her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote her business of raising sheep.

loans.name: Gawlo

texts.fr: Gawlo D. est une femme de 70 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 10 enfants dont les 6 sont toujours sous sa charge et 4 qui fréquentent l’école. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BAYOUF-PALAL depuis le 15 mars 1998 (12 ans). Elle est vendeuse de bois de chauffe et son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son activité. Elle est très expérimentée dans son domaine d’activité et les bénéfices qu’elle a réalisés lui ont permis d’acheter parcelle de terrain qu’elle voudrait valoriser en construisant une maison en dur. Son objectif à court terme est d’aider ses enfants à réaliser un avenir radieux en leur assurant une bonne couverture scolaire.
texts.en:
Gawlo D., 70, is a widow and the mother of 10 children, among whom she is still responsible for six; four of those attend school. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of BAYOUF-PALAL since March 15, 1998 (i.e., for 12 years). She sells firewood and her new loan will allow her to bolster this little business. Gawlo D. has a lot of experience in her field and the profit she has made has allowed her to buy a plot of land which she would like to put to good use by building a permanent house on it. Her short-term objective is to help her children to achieve a bright tomorrow by ensuring their continued schooling.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster and develop her income-generating business

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia L. is from the town of Banga. She is 62 years old, married and has 8 adult children. She started her farming business five years ago. Since her husband is also a farmer, both of them till their land to plant rice crops. She then sells their harvest in their community. Like any other entrepreneur, she wants to be successful someday. She also dreams that the day will come that she would be able to financially help her other farmer friends.

Florencia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florencia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm inputs. This will be the first loan taken out by Florencia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm inputs

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma M. is from the village of Lower Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 52 years old, widow and has three adult children. Wilma owns and operates a general store. Wilma has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2007, Wilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Wilma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy goods and products to sell.

location.town: Sindangan-Lower Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del N

loans.name: Monica Francisco

texts.pt:
MONICA FRANCISCO L. nasceu e cresceu em Maputo num dos bairros periféricos onde fez o seu ensino primário frequentando actualmente o ensino superior.
Na sua infância além de estudar, ajudava o seu pai na sua loja facto que lhe fez ganhar experiencia nesta área de negócio, onde depois abriu um salão de beleza e depois no ano 2000 passou a fazer negócio de sapatos usados.
Através de amigas e clientes da Hluvuku, ficou a saber da existência desta instituição e como queria fazer crescer o seu negócio, foi solicitar um empréstimo no valor de 15.000,00mt com o qual pretende comprar fardo de sapatos de homens, mulheres e crianças para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto assim como sua receita melhorando também a sua vida e da sua família.
O seu sonho futuro e de concluir o ensino superior e se tornar numa grande empresaria. Para tal pretende solicitar mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
Monica Francisco was born and raised in suburbs of Maputo where she went to elementary school. She is currently in college. During her childhood, apart from studying she helped her father in his store which has made her gain experience in the business. Later she opened a beauty salon and in 2000 she started an used shoes business. She became familiar with Hluvuku through friends who were partners. She wanted to expand her business and requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 meticais. She intends to buy men's, women's and children's shoes in bulk in order to increase her inventory and with that her income, her life and her family's life. Her dream is to finish college and to become a great businesswoman. She intends to request more loans to fulfill her dreams.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of men's, women's and children's shoes in bulk

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan vive en casa de sus tíos en la zona el Rosario de la ciudad de la Paz; es soltero, no tiene hijos  y estudia contabilidad en el Instituto bancario, la actividad que realiza es la venta de artesanías en un puesto que tiene en el mercado Lanza  pero también  elabora carteras de tela de aguayo (tela de muchos colores).

El crédito que solicita será utilizado para la compra de más tela de aguayo y materias primas para sus artesanias.

Con Impro, es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito y por primera vez a través de Kiva, esta satisfecho con la tasa de interés, y el análisis de sus ingresos y gastos muestra que  puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Juan lives in the home of his aunt and uncle in the Rosario zone of the city of La Paz. He is single, has no children and studies accounting at the banking institute. He makes a living selling artisan crafts at a post he has in the Lanza market, and he also makes handbags out of multicolored cloth. He plans to use the loan he is requesting to purchase more multicolored cloth and other supplies for his crafts. This is his second loan with Impro and first via Kiva, and he is satisfied with the interest rate. An analysis of his income and expenses shows that he can be approved for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase multicolored cloth and other supplies to make artisan handbags

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna Isabel de 47 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Empezó  por la necesidad de adquirir ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia. Por lo que no ha sido fácil obtener nuevos clientes, pero Reyna siempre se las ingenia para atraerlos. Ahora trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde todos los días. Pues ella tiene 3 hijos menores edad a su cargo y por los que cuidar. Ella se siente muy alegre con este financiamiento pues es su primer crédito y espera tener éxito quiere comprar con el préstamo pantalones, vestidos, trajes y pantalones. En el futuro quiere tener una tienda propia en donde pueda ofertar una gran variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel, age 47, sells used clothes. She started because she needed income and to get her family ahead. It has not been easy to get new customers. But, Reyna always thinks of a way to attract them. She now works from seven in the morning until six in the evening everyday. She has three minor children under her care. She is very happy about this loan. It is her first loan, and she hopes to have success. She wants to use the loan to buy dresses, suits, and pants. In the future she wants to have her own store where she can sell a great variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Wilson's Group

texts.en:
Wilson C., from the village of San Roque, is the 37-year-old group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Wilson C.'s Group.

Wilson, who is married and has two school-aged children, owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Wilson joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase new items to expand product offering, she is now requesting a new loan, her fifth, of 17000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Wilson plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alma's Group

texts.en:
Alma D., age 26, is from the village of Salimpuno. She is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Alma is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Alma plants, harvests, and sells assorted crops. Alma has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Alma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer for the farm. Alma is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to invest in cassava plantation. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Alma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For cassava plantation.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en: Edina Y. is currently in the business of selling groundnuts (peanuts), simsim (sesame seed) and cowpeas and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of cowpeas to sell. Edina is 27 years old and widowed with five children. Only two of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more bags of cowpeas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To raise cattle

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “PACHA ILLAIRY ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
