El socio es el Sr. Leoncio;   él tiene  40 años de edad, es casado  y tiene 4 hijos,  El socio es natural de Ocongate,  Él socio trabajabaen agricultura, el socio es agricultor y también es obrero  (maestro de obras), el socio cuando no está tras la siembra y cosecha y abono de sus terrenos está trabajando en construcciones, el socio desea el préstamo para uso personal, el necesita comprar  víveres para su hogar. El socio indica que pagará el préstamo con la venta de sus ovejitas pero ahora le hace falta el dinero de manera inmediata.  El socio solicita el préstamo para compra víveres para su hogar.

El  socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Leoncio belongs to the “PACHA ILLAIRY” community bank.  The bank is located in the district of Ocongate, in the province of Quispicanchis, in the department of Cusco.

Leoncio is 40 years old.  He is married and has 4 children.  He was born in Ocongate.  He works as a farmer and is also a master builder.  When he is not sowing, harvesting and fertilizing his land he is working in construction.  He would like the loan for personal use.  He needs to buy food for his household.  He states that he will pay the loan back from the sale of his lambs but he needs the money immediately.

Leoncio is grateful for the loan and appreciates it.  He pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy food for his household

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 32-year-old married man with two children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to acquire a number of assets that can generate money for the family sustainably. He owns a retail shop and a secretarial centre and for five years in such businesses, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and pay his workers. Nevertheless, he wants to have secretarial services in at least 10 urban centers. Emmanuel needs the loan to buy merchandise to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Blanca Rosa Y. T. tiene 25 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Blanca se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y por medio del trabajo dar el estudio a los hijos.

Le gusta pasear con la familia y ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Blanca Rosa Y. T. is 25 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children.  She lives in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  She has two children.

The 'Luz y Progreso' (Light and Progress) solidarity group is located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office, in Chillanes canton.  This group is engaged in farming and other professional tasks.  The group has 17 members.

Blanca is a farmer and she grows corn, beans, peas and 'chocho' (a type of bean native to the region).  She buys her products in Chillanes and sells them in Chillanes market and district.

Blanca is requesting this loan to buy corn, bean, pea and 'chocho' seeds.  The support of this loan will help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to continue working and, through her work, to provide her children with an education.

Blanca likes going for walks with her family and watching television.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with four children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For over twenty years, she has operated a retail shop selling to her neighbours and passersby. Saumu faces a major challenge in competition from other vendors. She hopes to expand in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase wheat flour and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour and maize flour for sale

loans.name: Cesar Alfonso

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MINKA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Cesar; El socio tiene 65 años de edad, el socio es casado y tiene 3 hijos, el socio compra y vende vidrios, el socio tiene una pequeña vidriería, el socio invierte su dinero en la compra de vidrios al por mayor y poco a poco el va utilizando según las medidas. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de vidrios al por mayor.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Minka communal bank. The bank is located in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.

Cesar is 65 years old, married, and has three children. He buys and sells glass and has a small glass store. He invests his money in the purchase of wholesale glass and uses it little by little over time. He is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of wholesale glass.

Cesar is happy for the loan granted and he promises to make his loan payments in the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of wholesale glass

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
La señora Mariela S. E. tiene 21 años de edad y vive en una casa de propiedad de sus padres en la ciudad de Tarija. Mariela es madre soltera de 2 hijos, por circunstancias de la vida se quedo sola ahora ella tiene que trabajar para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos.  Mariela se dedica desde hace mas de 3 años a la elaboración de salteñas la cual vende en el mercado campesino, teniendo muy buena clientela Mariela quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante con sus hijos , pero ella nos cuenta que tiene la oportunidad de comprar mercadería a un precio módico. Es por eso que el crédito será destinado para la compra del material necesario para realizar su actividad para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.        
                                                                                                                                                                                                
Mariela nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite sera para mejorar las condiciones de la casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Mariela S. E. is 21 years old and lives in a home belonging to her parents in the city of Tarija.  Mariela is the single mother of two children.  Her life’s circumstances have caused her to be alone and she has to work in order to get ahead with her children.

For the past three years, Mariela has been making and selling salteñas (a type of baked meat pie) in the country market.  Having steady customers, Mariela would like to increase her income in order to get ahead with her children.

She tells us that she has the opportunity to buy merchandise at a modest price, so she is asking for this loan.  She will use the money to buy the necessary material and be able to increase her income.

She also tells us that she wants to improve her living conditions and so the next loan she will request will be to make improvements to the home where she lives.

loans.use: Supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel, tiene 21 años, es conviviente y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Chepén, perteneciente a la Región La Libertad, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque. 

 Se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte en mototaxi (vehículo que consiste en una moto con una cabina para transportar personas).  Gabriel es muy conocido en su localidad y cuenta con clientes fidelizados, asimismo tiene un trato amable con cada uno de ellos.  Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le permite colaborar con el sostenimiento de su familia.

Gabriel necesita realizar un mantenimiento a su mototaxi, ya que con el paso de los años algunas partes se han ido deteriorando.  Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Gabriel, 21, has a live-in spouse and lives with his family in Chepén district which belongs to La Libertad region and is located four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque department.

He provides mototaxi transportation services (a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin to transport passengers).  Gabriel is very well known in his area and has an established base of regular customers; he treats each one of them kindly.  Income from this activity allows him to contribute to his family’s support.

Gabriel needs to do some maintenance on his mototaxi because as the years have gone by some of its parts have deteriorated.  He has, therefore, thought it advisable to request a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen V., 43, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. V. is a farmer, earning an income of approximately $3.50 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver, earning an income of about $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $55 on food and $65 on the other necessary expenses. 

V. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Ana; La socia tiene 47 años de edad, la socia es casada,  y tiene 2 hijos; la socia administra un hospedaje llamado Mamaqueta, este hospedaje es de su madre y ella lo administra, el hospedaje se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Abancay en el distrito de Cachora a unas horas del complejo arqueológico de Choquequirao; en plena ceja de selva; la socia y su mamá son las encargadas y dueñas de este hospedaje, ellas aprovechan esta época de lluvias para remodelar todo el hospedaje y comenzar la temporada en el mes de abril. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la remodelación de hospedaje.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN” community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Ana is 47 years old, married, and has 2 children.  Her business is a guest house called 'Mamaqueta'.  It belongs to her mother and she runs it.  The guest house is located in Abancay province, in Cachora district, some hours from the archaeological complex of Choquequirao, in the middle of the jungle.  Ana and her mom are in charge of this guest house and they own it.  They are taking advantage of the rainy season to remodel their guest house so that they can start the season in April.  

Ana is requesting this loan to invest in remodeling her guest house.  She is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To invest in remodeling her guest house

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo. Reside junto a su familia en el sector Chacupe Bajo del distrito de La Victoria, una zona rural que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Josefina se dedica a la venta de verduras en un puesto ubicado en el mercado “Los Patos” de su distrito. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años, por ello cuenta con clientela fidelizada debido a su buen trato y la calidad y frescura de las verduras. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad sirven para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Josefina desea comprar un lote de verduras para surtir su puesto de verduras, aprovechando la oportunidad del buen precio esto ayudara a incrementar sus ventas y ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Josefina es una mujer bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Josefina is 38 years old, she is married and she has one child. She lives with her family in Chacupe Bajo, a sector of La Victoria district, a rural area located twenty minutes away from the town of Chiclayo.

Josefina engages in selling vegetables in a stall located in the “Los Patos” market of her district. She has been running this activity for 5 years, and she can count on loyal customers thanks to her kind manners and to the quality and freshness of her vegetables. She uses the incomes coming from this activity to help her husband supporting their family’s economy.

Josefina wants to buy some more products to supply her vegetables stall, taking advantage of the current good prices. This will help her increase her sales and her incomes. This is why she has thought it useful to ask Edpyme Alterntativa for her first loan of 1000 PEN that will help her reach her goal.

Josefina is a rather calm and responsible woman. Her main goal is to keep on improving as an entrepreneur in order to offer a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her stall.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce, who was born in 1957, is a single mother of one. She sells cereals to earn a living. She started the business in 2009 and has witnessed a lot of improvement since joining Faulu Kenya. Her business is located in the slums, with most buyers being low-income earners; however, she still manages to make a profit. Joyce also rents out semi-permanent houses for extra income. She hopes to build permanent rental houses in the future. Joyce will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy rice and beans.

loans.use: to buy rice and beans

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes G., from the village of Farmington, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte, is 60 years old, married, and has five grown children. To make a living, Lourdes has been making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community for over a year, earning approximately 1000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale, she is now requesting her fourth loan for 10000 PHP for the same purpose. Lourdes plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta is 18 years of age and married with one child. She a business planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has a year of experience in this business. Ruta needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Ruta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Ruta's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Originally from Cuba, Eugenio began working for a friend cleaning a small kindergarten at night. After seeing the success of this small venture, he decided to build his own cleaning service. For the last three years he has struggled to build contracts with various business offices. Recently he signed a large contract with a medical office and hopes to sign another large client soon. Eugenio relishes owning his own business and having the means to support his growing family. 

With this loan from ACCION USA, Eugenio will be purchasing two new floor buffers. As his contracts have grown, he wants to be able to clean floors in the most efficient way. These will also allow him more time to focus on building new client relations. In the future, Eugenio wants to continue to build his reputation as a cleaning service. More importantly, he wants to improve his family’s quality of life through his continued successes.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment.

loans.name: Slyvan

texts.en:
Slyvan is 52 years old.  He has 7 children, who are between the ages of 2 and 28 years old.  His wife sells foodstuffs in the market.

Slyvan has a hardware shop.  His stock includes spare bicycle and motorcycle parts.  He has done this business for 15 years and everything is going well.  This business has enabled him to pay school fees for his children and to make some savings.  He is requesting a loan to buy more spare parts in order to increase his profits.  He plans to save the additional profits and buy a motorcycle in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Guadalupe,  tiene 45 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre fruto de la misma han tenido 5 hijos dos de ellos ya son mayores  de edad, uno de ellos estudia en universidad y los  menores en colegio, su marido es radiotécnico.

Tiene una pequeña granja en la casa de sus padres que es donde ella vive junto a su familia, allí ella se dedica a la cría de pollos, nos cuenta que compra de 100 a 200 pollos por temporada, los mismos que los compra cuando  están pequeños en una incubadora en Calceta, los mantiene por espacio de dos a tres meses y luego cuando están listos los entrega en tiendas o los vende por libras cerca de su casa a los vecinos y allegados. Trabaja todos los días  unas dos  horas al día en todas sus actividades.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para que estos tengan un gran desarrollo. Está en el Banco Comunal hace siete años y le gustan los créditos porque con ellos puede financiar su negocio cuando no tiene dinero.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The “Quiroga” communal bank meets every two weeks in Quiroga Parish in the city of Calceta, a place where its residents are for the most part farmers and raise livestock and sell their production.

We met Guadalupe, 45, here.  She has   spouse and five children, two of them already adults.  One of them is going to university and the younger ones are in high school.  Her husband is a radio technician.

She has a small farm at her parents’ house which is where she and her family live.  She raises chickens there.  She tells us that she buys 100 to 200 chicks per season.  She buys them when they are small from an incubator in Calceta and keeps them for a period of time of two to three months and then when they are ready she delivers them to stores or sells them by the pound near her house to neighbors and close friends.  She works every day about two hours daily on her various chores.

She will use this loan to buy chicks, feed and medicine for them so that they will develop well.  She’s been in the communal bank for seven years and she likes the loans because she can finance her business with them when she doesn’t have any money.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy chickens, chicken feed and chicken medicines.

loans.name: Girumwete Group

texts.fr:
Annonciate est une commerçante âgée de 29ans qui habite au centre ville de Gitega. Elle  fait le commerce de produits alimentaires (riz et haricot) depuis 5ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle est mariée à Jean-Bosco, un aide-soignant. Ils ont ensemble  3 enfants dont 1 étudie en 4e année des études primaires. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 5e année primaires.
Son crédit de 100,000frans burundais va contribuer à augmenter son capital et agrandir le volume des achats de riz et haricots pour revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 
Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« GIRUMWETE».
texts.en:
Annonciate is a 29-year-old merchant who lives in downtown Gitega. She is a member of the solidarity group GIRUMWETE. She started selling foodstuffs (rice and beans) five years ago, and she is also a farmer. She is married to Jean-Bosco, a caregiver. The couple have three children, one of whom is in the fourth grade of primary school. Annonciate herself attended school up to the fifth grade. 

Her loan of 100,000 Burundian francs will help her to increase her working capital and to bolster her purchases of rice and beans for resale in order to earn substantial profits.

loans.use: to bolster her purchases of rice and beans for resale

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
La señora ClotilD. tiene 46 años D. edad, está casada con el señor Pedro D. 47 años quien trabaja en la policia nacional, tienen 4 hijos D. 21,19,18 y 15 años D. edad, uno D. sus hijos es policia y una hija trabaja como empleada en una boutique, hace poco tiempo ambos la ayudan con los gastos familiares y los otros dos hijos estudian, todos ellos viven en la misma casa ubicada en la ciudad D. Itá.
La señora ClotilD. posee un salón D. belleza hace mas D. 8 años, allí realiza servicios D. corte, peinados, lavado D. cabeza, tintes, manicuro, pedicuro y todo tipo D. servicios D. peluquería a sus clientes. Gracias a los años que lleva en este negocio ha formado ya una gran clientela.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra D. tintes, gel, agua oxigenada, shampoo, enjuage y otros productos que va a utilizar en la peluqueria.
texts.en: ClotilD. is 46 years old and married to Pedro, 47, who works for the national police. They have four children, ages 21, 19, 18 and 15. One of their sons is a policeman, and a daughter works at a boutique. Both have helped with family expenses for a little while, and the other two children are in school. They all live in the same house in the city of Itá, Paraguay. ClotilD. has had a beauty salon for more than eight years, providing haircuts, stylings, hair washing, dyeing, manicures, pedicures and other salon services to her customers. Thanks to the years she has put into the business she has a well-formed and large customer base. She is requesting the loan to purchase dyes, gels, peroxiD., shampoo, mouthwash and other products to use at her salon.

loans.use: to buy dyes, gels, peroxide, shampoo, mouthwash and other products.

loans.name: Raffy

texts.en:
Raffy is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children.
Raffy provides motorela or habal-habal (motorcycle transport) services. He has run this business for five years. He has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for service utilities. Raffy has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2003. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for service utilites.

loans.name: Jose Erasmo

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, es casado, se dedica al comercio de ganado desde hace diez años, este negocio surgió por su propia iniciativa, comercializa el ganado los días martes y sábado 7:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m. en el tiangue de la ciudad.
El esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ganado para la venta, esta compra le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y obtener mas ganancias.
Su mayor sueño es sacar adelante a su familia y darle la educación adecuada a sus hijos ofreciendoles un desarrollo economico para el futuro.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his wife and their three children. He is married and he has been involved in livestock farming for the past ten years. He started out this business under his own initiative. He sells his livestock on Tuesdays and Mondays from 7:00 am to 3:00 pm in the city's market.

He requests a loan to purchase livestock to resell. This purchase will help him strengthen his business and to obtain more earnings.

His greatest dream is to move forward with his family and to provide an adequate education to his children, to offer them a better financial future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Kien

texts.en:
Kien is a 42-year-old married woman with three children. They live in Ho Chi Minh.

For the past twenty years Kien and her husband have been operating a food stall selling noodles. She would like to take a loan of 15,000,000 VND to buy a greater variety and quantity of food to sell from her stall. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and increase the turnover in her business.

Kien hopes that through her loan she will be able to improve her family's living conditions and set aside savings for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Reina Esperanza

texts.es:
Reina, actualmente vive con sus dos hijos de 32 y 28 años, también sus nietos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, desde hace 18 años, el negocio lo tiene instalado en el mercado municipal, trabaja de lunes a domingo.
Ella comprara a través de un préstamo maíz, cal y leña, estos materiales son para la producción de tortillas, le ayudara tanto a los clientes como a ella, pues por el aumento en la producción sus ventas serán mayores, la aspiración de Reina es que este negocio tenga vida y que pueda con sus ganancias contribuir a la superación de su familia.
texts.en:
Reina currently lives with her two children aged 32 and 28, and her grandchildren. For 18 years she has had a business selling tortillas from her stall at the municipal market, and she works Monday through to Sunday. 

With this loan Reina will buy corn, lime and firewood which are materials used in the production of tortillas. The resulting increase in production will lead to increased sales, and will benefit her clients as well as herself. 

Reina's aspiration is for her business to come to life, and she will be able use her earnings to contribute to the success of her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn, lime and firewood for the production of tortillas

loans.name: Kafouata

texts.fr: Kafouata  est une femme de 35 ans, elle est mariée à un gestionnaire et a  quatre enfants. Elle est une revendeuse depuis 1997. Kafouata achète et revend ses pagnes à sa clientèle, elle exerce son commerce de façon ambulante et s’approvisionne à lomé et quelques fois au bénin. Elle est seule impliquée dans son activité. elle sollicite son 2ème crédit de WAGES pour acheter des pagnes de marque Hitarget et Deluxe.
texts.en: Kafouata is 35 years old, married to an administrator and has 4 children. She has been a saleswoman since 1997 and has a one-woman business selling "pagnes" (traditional sarong-like clothing). Her business is itinerant and she gets her supplies in Lomé, and occasionally in Benin. She is requesting a second loan from WAGES so that she can buy some Hitarget and Deluxe pagnes.

loans.use: to restock on pagnes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a widowed woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

For the past three years, she has owned a preparatory school, teaching children from the neighboring community. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Mary dreams of expanding her school to accommodate children of upper classes (grades). 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to renovate the school and add chairs and tables for the increasing number of pupils. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To renovate the school and add chairs and tables for the increasing number of pupils.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her grocery store business. She started this business to support her family financially.

She is married and a mother of two sons and a daughter. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Her husband is a painter by profession. He paints on buildings, walls and houses, etc.

With the loan, she will buy groceries such as spices, sugar, lentils in bulk quantity to be able to fulfill the client’s demand on time and increase her sales and income.

She is an experienced businesswoman and has been operating her business for past 10 years. She is confident that an investment will increase her profits.

Note: One of the members has an embroidery business - that is why they are holding embroider cloth.

loans.use: to buy groceries for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Nyange Huruma Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Nyange Huruma Group in Western Kenya! Consolata is the facilitator of the Nyange Huruma group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Consolata takes care of nine children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Consolata had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 14 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Consolata was only able to harvest 1 bag of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Consolata and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Consolata will educate her children and invest in business.

In 2012, the members of the Nyange Huruma group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
Consolata is pictured with her group members in the photograph, with their Field Officer (Annah Malemo) on the left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 27-year-old married mother of two children, a five-year-old, who is currently enrolled in school, and a six-month-old. Josephine’s husband works as a driver, while she has been selling charcoal and eggs door-to-door for the past six months, her primary customers being neighbors and local residents.

Transportation costs are Josephine's greatest business challenge, while school fees are her highest monthly expense. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water.

Josephine is requesting a Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more charcoal and eggs for her business. Having joined Yehu because of their great customer service, she aspires to open a cereal business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and eggs for her business.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan is 50 years old and married with one son. She and her husband earn money by selling food to the local community from their food stall. 

Phan would like to borrow a loan to buy more furniture for her stall and to buy a greater quantity and quality of food to sell from her stall. She hopes that through the loan she can generate a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more furniture and food for her food stall

loans.name: Fe Group

texts.en: Fe is 40 years old and lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with one child. Fe works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for nine years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase ten boxes of fish to sell. Fe has been a member of PMPC for four years. Fe is the leader of a three person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase ten boxes of fish

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto tiene 31 años de edad vive en unión libre no tiene hijos, vive con la esposa en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, maíz hace tres años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para invertir en la agricultura, comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos agrícolas.
El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar las semillas sin ningún tipo de problema por el dinero.

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentemente es la competencia y las plagas. El sueño de Carlos es tener terreno propio.
En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte..
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto is 31 years old and lives in a common-law relationship with no children.  He lives with his partner in Ventanas Canton, province of Los Ríos.

He is a member of San Juan Communal Bank, located in the San Francisco area of the parish of San Juan, where the people work in agricultural jobs.  Carlos has been working in agriculture growing rice and corn for three years.  He buys and sells in Ventanas.

He is requesting the loan to invest in agriculture, to buy seeds, fertilizer, and agricultural fertilizer.  The loan will be a great help to him so he can buy seeds without any money problems.

Competition and pests are the challenges he faces most frequently.  Carlos's dream is to have his own piece of land.  In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 53, is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

For the past seven years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing and expanding her business to cover a large market area in the future.

With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Donelia Patricia

texts.es: La señora Donelia a sus 36 años es madre de cuatro hijos de 13, 10, 8 y 3 años de edad por los cuales trabaja día a día para sacar adelante y ver en un futuro como profesionales y con una mejor calidad de vida. Hace un año la señora Donelia inicio con la venta de productos cosméticos por catálogo con el fin de generar ingresos para el sustento familiar. La señora Donelia presenta dificultades por la competencia y el pago atrasado de sus clientes de los productos, por lo que requiere para reactivar su negocio de la compra de nueva mercancía que le permita recuperarse y seguir brindando a sus cuatro hijos una buena calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Donelia, 36, is the mother of four children who are 13, 10, 8 and 3 years old.  She works day to day for them to move them ahead and see them become professionals in the future with a better quality of life.  

A year ago Donelia started selling cosmetics via catalogue in order to generate income for family support.  Donelia faces difficulties caused by competition and delays in customer payments so she needs to reactivate her business buying new merchandise that will allow her to recuperate and continue providing her four children with wellbeing and good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy assorted lotions and body creams.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito de 42años de edad, convive con Antonieta hace más de 25 años. Con ella tiene a sus 8 hijos, pero solo vive con 4, el menor apenas tiene 3 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa de San Pablo de Shaoriato, distrito de Pichanaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Benito es un esposo y padre ejemplar. Todo su esfuerzo tiene como motor su familia. 
Desde pequeño aprendió las labores del campo, es así que inició con sus propios sembríos en parcelas de terrenos que su comunidad y sus padres le otorgaron. Ahora cuenta con 3 parcelas.
De esa manera ha podido surtir y equilibrar su producción. Él cultiva café y kión.
“El kión es rentable como el café, cada kilo lo vendo a 2 soles y 50 céntimos, en diciembre llega a costar 3 soles con 50 céntimos, por que es escaso”, menciona. 
La siembra de kión es rentable, para los comuneros de la zona, por los suelos y condiciones climáticas. Benito produce 1500 kilos cada año y vende rápidamente para las empresas de condimentos y a otros compradores que se lo llevan como colorante. Benito quiere ampliar sus sembríos y aumentar su producción. Con eso quiere darle mejores condiciones al resto de sus hijos que aún son menores de edad. Ésta sería la primera vez que Benito obtendría un crédito de MFP, por tal razón da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente emocionado por ser parte del banco comunal “Los Norionkis de San Pablo”.
Con el dinero que piensa obtener, pagará a los jornaleros a quienes contratará para la limpieza y cosecha de sus productos.
texts.en:
Benito is 42, and has been living with his partner Antonieta for more than 25 years. They have eight children, but only live with four; the youngest is only three years old. They live in their own house in the native community of San Pablo de Shaoriato, in Pichanaki district, in Chanchamayo province.

Benito is an exemplary husband and father. His family is what drives all his efforts. He learned to do farm work from the time he was small. So it is that he started his own plantings in parcels of land that his community and his parents granted him. Now he has three parcels. In that way he has been able to supply and balance his production.

He grows coffee and kión (ginger). "Kion is profitable like coffee. I sell each kilo for 2 soles and 50 centimos. In December is will be worth three soles and 50 centimos, because it is scarce," he says. Planting kión is profitable for the villagers in the area, because of the soils and climatic conditions.

Benito produces 1,500 kilos each year, and it sells quickly to the condiment companies, and to other buyers who take it as a coloring agent. Benito wants to expand his plantings and increase his output. With that, he wants to provide better living conditions for the rest of his children who are still minors. 

This would be the first time that Benito has obtained a loan from MFP, so he gives his word that he will make his instalment payments on time. He is excited to be a part of the "Los Norionkis de San Pablo" communal bank. With the money that he intends to get, he will pay day laborers that he will hire for clearing work, and to harvest his crops.

loans.use: To hire day laborers.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice has good history with KADET LTD, and has been paying back her loans well and in good time. Her business is doing great and brings in a good income. 

This her sixth loan from KADET LTD. She will use the whole amount to pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to become a prominent business woman in her area.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her two children who are in high school.

loans.name: Magaly De Los Angeles

texts.es: Magaly es una Sra. de 51 años de edad, Lic. en Contabilidad, viuda madre de dos hijos que están en la universidad quienes estudian la carrera de medicina, gracias a los esfuerzos de doña Magaly estos jóvenes mantienen sus estudios y siguen adelante, uno de ellos se encuentra en etapa de culminar su carrera profesional lo cual es un gran logro para su madre, Magaly tiene el negocio de pulpería y cuenta también con una pensión que recibe por viudez. Acude a solicitar apoyo de crédito para invertirle a su negocio con productos como granos básicos, lácteos, café, jabones entre otros que le garanticen incrementar los ingresos para responder  a los gastos familiares.

loans.use: Doña Magaly solicita el crédito para invertir en su negocio que le permita incrementar las ventas para poder continuar con los gastos del hogar.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en: Muborak was born in 1962 year. She is married. Her husband is a welder. Muborak and her husband bring-up 3 children. They are very responsible parents. Muborak is a higher educated person. She works in a local school as a teacher. Muborak has a great experience in this field. Her son is a student and he studies at the university well. Muborak is asking for a loan to pay for the university tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for the university tuition

loans.name: Ayémiahé

texts.en:
Ayémiahé D. has been a widow for five years. Her deceased husband left her with three children that she supports in addition to her parents. To feed her family, she started a business selling common chickens. She is especially courageous and worries about making sure her children are educated. So she works tirelessly going from village to village to look for chickens to sell back in town. But since family expenses have grown more and more onerous, Ms. D. just cannot go any further. And so she is asking for help to improve her business. Her skill and honesty has resulted in more business than she can handle. She is therefore requesting a loan of $850 to enlarge her chicken coop and to serve as capital to do trade in chickens. The profits gained from this activity will allow her to provide for her orphaned children. She will also be able to save more money to improve her financial situation.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame D. Ayémiahé est veuve depuis 5 ans. Son mari défunt a laissé à sa charge trois (03) enfants qu’elle supporte en plus de ses parents. Pour pouvoir nourrir sa famille, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des poulets ordinaires. Particulièrement courageuse et soucieuse d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants, elle travaille sans relâche en allant de village en village pour rechercher des poulets qu’elle vient revendre en ville. Mais les charges de la famille devenant de plus en plus lourdes, Madame D. n’en peut plus et demande un appui pour pouvoir améliorer son commerce. Son habileté et son honnêteté font que la demande est plus forte que l’offre. Elle sollicite alors un crédit de $850 qui va servir à agrandir son poulailler et disposer de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente des poulets ordinaires. Les bénéfices tirés de cette activité lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins des orphelins. Aussi arrivera t-elle à mieux épargner afin d’accroître son économie.

loans.use: To enlarge the chicken coop, and to do trade in chickens.

loans.name: Namkik

texts.en: Namik S. owns a small market in the small town of Khachmaz, located on the Northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Namik is looking for funding so that he can increase the quantity and variety of his inventory in order to remain competitive and increase his customer base.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of his inventory.

loans.name: Maria Rogelina

texts.en:
My name is Maria R., and I have dedicated myself to selling popular goods at my convenience store for the past four years. My daughter helps me tend to the customers. My goal is to add to my inventory in order to increase my sales. With the earnings I'll be able to provide for my family and hire someone to help me at the store, since my daughter will be attending a university and will no longer be able to help me at the store.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Maria R. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, tengo la ayuda de mi hija para la venta y atencion a mis clientes, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y contratar una muchacha que me ayude a atender mi negocio ya que mi hija esta p'or ingresar a la universidad y no podra ayudarme mas en la antencion de mi negocio,.

loans.use: Purchase condensed milk, sugar, salt, bread, eggs, lard, oil, churros, beverages, juice, soups, toothpaste, toilet paper, chocolate, soap, margarine, butter, etc.

loans.name: Altagracia Antonia

texts.en:
Altagracia has lived in the town two years now, but has lived nearby for over 35 years. The family consists of 6 members, which includes her husband and 4 children, who all live together.

Pero...don't worry, there's no problem if you have "falta de sueño" (lack of sleep) as she helps her husband with rather unusual ease! Very talkative and articulate, she explains how she's going to buy different types of clothing as she expands her business. She has common markets where she buys her clothing. These markets are all some 20 kms. away from where her business activity takes place. Based on the information she gave us, continuing her clothing sales will benefit Altagracia and her family.

loans.use: To buy men's clothing (mostly pants), and some women's also.

location.town: Jesus Primero community of Los Alcarrizo

loans.name: Vaqif

texts.en: Vaqif H. is a barber in his home town of Devechi which is located on the northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Vaqif has been working as a barber for the last six years and is now looking for funding in the amount of $1,000 so that he can purchase new equipment for his business.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment for his business.

loans.name: Goziboy

texts.en: G. Goziboy has been engaged in the trade of rice for over 3 years. He has three children and they all go to school. His wife is a housewife, so he supports all of them. His business is located in the Ovchikalacha district of Khujand in the food market. His business place is crowded every day and he says that he has a lot of clients. The turnover of his capital is good. But presently he needs extra capital to increase his volume of rice, as now is the season for harvesting rice and the wholesale price for this product is lower than at other times. He wants to make reserves for future trade.

loans.use: Purchase of rice

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is 39 years of age but this is her 6th loan with SPBD. She has six children who are all schooling in the village secondary school. She is a very hard working mother and through her hard work, she has managed to bring her family to where they are now. Through her loans with SPBD she has managed to renovate her home and build a new bathroom for her family. Rosa is very thankful for the support  SPBD has given her that has improved her family's lifestyle and looks forward to improving it further with her newest loan.

loans.use: Rosa would like to restock her shop.

loans.name: Januário

texts.pt:
Januário M., resident of the Polana Caniço district, Mozambique ID card # 110312801V, has 6 children. A worker at the Universidade Tecnica de Moçambique, he entered into the program on May 23, 2007, borrowing 6000 MT. He is now in his second round, and would like another 6000 MT to purchase various goods. He will repay the loan in 6 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Steve Fogel, Kiva volunteer

Januário M., Residente no bairro da Polana Caniço portador do BI nº 110312801V tem 6 filhos trabalhador da Universidade Tecnica de Moçambique entrou no programa a 23/05/07 tomando o valor de 6000 esta agora no 2º ciclo vai tomar o valor de 6000 novamente para comprar alguns Bens e vai pagar em 6 meses.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bedclothes, curtains and other goods for her business

loans.name: Abdurahimov

texts.ru:
Z. Abdurahimov is a young man of 26 years, married and has one child. His wife is a housewife and he is in the animal husbandry. He loves to breed cattle and currently has one cow and twenty goats. His wife spins yarn from goat fur and makes some profit from it. Z. also works in the construction team during the summer and autumn months. He has turned to MicroInvest for a loan to buy more cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдурахимов Зокирджон молодой человек в возросте 26 лет , женат имеет 1 ребенка жена домохозяйка.Сам занимается только уходом и откормом скота.Очень любит домашний скот , на данный момент имеет 1 корову и 20 коз.Жена занимается производством козьей пряжи, с чего тоже имеет доход.Зокирджон также в сезонное время (летом и весной )работает на стройке в бригаде.В Микроинвест обратился чтоб взяв кредит купить еще скот.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Adelayda

texts.es:
In the Somotiillo area of Chinandega city, Mrs. Adelaida R. owns her own convenience store in the home where she lives, taking care of her faithful customers every day by offering her variety of products.

It is important to note that this woman has the responsibility of supporting her young school-aged son so she seeks ways to provide for his needs so that in the not so distant future he can become a great professional. As with all businesses she needs investment, specifically capital to purchase merchandise, and for that reason she is seeking support from Ceprodel to obtain a loan and in this manner supply what she needs in order to succeed in her business and support her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Adelaida R. posee su propia pulpería en su casa de habitación donde atiende a su fiel clientela todos los días ofreciendo su variedad de productos.

Es de importancia destacar que esta dama tiene la obligación de mantener a su pequeño hijo en edad escolar por lo que busca la manera de cómo suplir sus necesidades para que en un futuro no muy lejano llegue a ser un gran profesional. Como todo negocio necesita de inversión, el negocio de pulpería de la señora Adelaida necesita la compra de la mercadería, es por tal razón que ella busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y de esta manera suplir tal necesidad para continuara adelante con el mantenimiento de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en:
Ebenezer A. owns a provision store. He is not yet married but is focused on developing himself. Business is going very well, so Mr. A. wishes to increase sales to improve his income. But he is running out of stock.

He is asking for a loan to buy more goods for resale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for resale.

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Women's Group

texts.en:
Winnie N. is the leader and member of the Kamu kamu women’s group in Lugazi, which she joined last year. She is 32 years old and is married with 4 children, but she also cares for an orphan belonging to her late brother. Her husband is a teacher in Lugazi and, together, their dream is to see their children receive the best education possible so that they can have a bright future.

She has a business whereby she buys smoked dry fish and mukene from the Senyi landing site and later sells such fish to her customers in Kinyoro and at the daily markets around Lugazi and Jinja. She is seeking a loan to expand her business by purchasing additional fish.

loans.use: To expand the business by purchasing additional smoked and dried fish.

loans.name: Kakadé Lucie

texts.fr:
Native of Lokossa in the Mono department in south-west Benin, Mrs. Kakadé Lucie G. is 57 years old. She is married to Mr. Gabriel DEGBOGBAHOUN, a retired soldier, and is mother to five children. She does catering at the Suru-Léré School of General Education. In March 2004 she requested and was granted a first loan of 30,000 CFA Francs ($75) so that she could offer her clientele, made up mostly of pupils from the Suru-Léré school,  a varied and sufficiently well-balanced daily menu.  This experience proved very beneficial as, within a year, her working capital went from 50,000 CFA Francs ($125) to 85,000 CFA Francs ($210).  Other loans followed this first one. The only detriment to her career as a female entrepreneur has been her health, which was a little fragile in 2006, the year when she received a loan of 70,000 CFA Francs ($175). Her health has since improved and her business has returned to normal. She is therefore requesting her seventh loan to better position herself. 
 Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.
Native de LOKOSSA dans le département du Mono au sud est du Bénin, dame G. Kakadé Lucie est âgée de 57ans. Mariée  à monsieur DEGBOGBAHOUN Gabriel, militaire à la retraite, elle est mère de cinq enfants. Elle fait de la restauration au Collège d’ Enseignement Général de Suru-Léré. Afin d’offrir à sa clientèle constituée pour la majorité des élèves de ce collège un menu journalier varié et suffisamment équilibré, elle a demandé et obtenu en mars 2004 un premier crédit de 30000F CFA. L’expérience lui fut très bénéfique car dans l’espace d’un an, son fonds de roulement est passé de 50000F CFA à 85000F CFA. D’autres prêts s’en sont suivis. La seule fausse note dans son parcours de femme entreprenante a été son état de santé qui s’était un peu fragilisé en 2006, année au cours de laquelle elle a reçu un prêt de 70000F CFA.  Son état de santé s'est amélioré depuis et ses activités sont redevenues normales. Elle vient donc solliciter son septième prêt pour mieux se positionner.

loans.use: To buy three 50-kg sacks of rice and two sacks of beans.

loans.name: Kingniké

texts.fr: Dame A. Kingniké est née vers 1965 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral au sud du Bénin. Originaire de la région de l'Ouémé au sud-est du Bénin, elle est mariée à NOUVOESSI Zamba agent de la Société Béninoise de Manutention Portuaire (SOBEMAP). Elle est mère de 3 enfants. Elle vend de l'acajou et s'approvisionne à KILIBO, DASSA et ABOMEY. Elle vend dans les pays de la sous région comme le NIGERIA, le TOGO, ABIDJAN et également dans les marchés locaux de Cotonou. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 25 ans environ et réalise un chiffre d'affaire mensuel moyen de 250 000 francs. Parallèlement à cette activité, elle vend aussi du repas prêt à manger et est à son quatrième crédit à ALIDé. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire davantage ses clients.
texts.en:
Ms. Kingniké A. was born around 1965 in Cotonou, in the county of Littoral in the south of Bénin. Originally from the Ouémé region in the southeast of Bénin, she is married to Zamba NOUVOESSI, an officer of the SOBEMAP [long-shoring society of Benin], and is the mother of three children. She sells cashews and gets her supplies in KILIBO, DASSA, and ABOMEY. She makes sales in the countries of the sub-regions, such as NIGERIA, TOGO, ABIDJAN and also in local marketplaces in Cotonou. She has been in this business for about 25 years and produces monthly sales figures of about 250,000 francs. Concurrent to this business, she also sells ready-to-eat meals and is on her fourth loan with Alidé. She is requesting this loan to bolster her business and to satisfy her customers more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of cashew nuts, 100 empty bottles, 2 sacks of cassava flour, and 100 kg of corn.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 42 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 20, 17, and 12 years old. She has been a charcoal, firewood and bites (chapati) seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Rehema is now requesting a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding  to her current stock

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
A. Dilorom lives in the Nausky region of Tajikistan. She has been a MicroInvest client since 2007 and wants to assure us she is a very reliable client who trusts the MicroInvest loan process. She started the business practically from scratch, trading in small wares, but thanks to previous loans she improved the business terms and opened a trade outlet in the local bazaar.

Now Mrs. A. Dilorom trades in assorted children's wear. She has been in business for 5 years and is full of enthusiasm and willingness to work. She dreams about the good and assured future for her children. Thanks to her politeness and sensitivity, she has many repeat customers. She works with suppliers who work with clients of different income levels because the prices for her good are lower than the bazaar prices. Mrs. A. Dilorom asks KIVA for a business development loan of 4000 STJ to import new models and to broaden her assortment of goods.

loans.use: to import new models and broaden the existing assortment

loans.name: Efe

texts.en:
Efe O. is a hairstylist and also sells baby care products. She is 33 years old with three children and lives in Benin City in Edo State, Nigeria.

Efe needs a loan in the amount of N52,000 to buy more baby care products to sell. Efe is a hardworking woman and she hopes to retain her customers. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more baby care products to sell.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline sells ice and dried fish. The demand for her ice and dried fish are high. She sells from Mondays to Sundays. Roseline is 40 years old and married with six children. Roseline is a LAPO client. She lives in Issashi, Lagos state, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of N70, 000 to purchase more ice and dried fish to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase ice and dried fish

loans.name: Gerónima Sofía

texts.es:
La señora Gerónima es socia del Banco Comunal “Dante Nava” del distrito, provincia y departamento D. Puno. Tiene 73 años D. edad, es casada  y madre D. 3 hijos. 
Con su primer préstamo D. S/. 300 compró casacas nuevas para venderlo en su puesto D. trabajo. Tiene casi 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que vive con 2 nietos.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprarán árboles D. navidad que venderá en la campaña naviD.ña. 
Geronima desea continuar trabajando para tener su carreta D. salchipapas.
texts.en:
Ms. Gerónima F. is a member of the Dante Nava microfinance institute in the district, province and department of Puno. She is a 73-year-old married mother with 3 children. With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased new jackets to sell them at her stand. For almost five years, she has been working with the microfinance institute. She tells us that she lives with 2 grandchildren.

With this 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase Christmas trees to be sold this holiday season.

Gerónima wishes to continue working so that she can one day have her own street food cart to sell salchipapas—Peruvian street food maD. of pan-fried sausages and French fries.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Christmas trees

loans.name: Gulchira

texts.en:
Gulchira M. is 46 years old. She is married with children of school age. Gulchira sells fabric for sewing traditional dresses. She has been in this business for almost 20 years. She has very good taste and she is ready to advise her clients which fabric to choose for this or that occasion. That is why she has constant customers. Moreover, Gulchira’s prices for fabrics are attractive for the various levels of population as she has a wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet.

The income that she derives allows her to educate her children. She hopes that she can continue to provide for them so they will be able to receive an adequate education. Now, Gulchira needs a loan to purchase new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for sale. She promises to pay the loan back on time without any violation, and expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her. Your generosity can change their lives.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Patricia es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, centro poblado Ramón Castilla, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 02 hijos y posee estudios de primaria incompleta (tercer grado). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años, se dedica al engorde de ganado menor (ovejas y porcinos), artesanías y venta de comidas; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mas ganado para engordarlo y venderlo como carne en las ferias locales de Ilave y para su negocio de comidas. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 5 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir ganado mayor (03 toros) para engórdalos y venderlos a un mejor precio, con lo cual obtendrá buenas ganancias y podrá mejorar su negocio de venta de comidas; asimismo, su anhelo es construir un Hotel en la ciudad de Ilave, puesto que ya cuenta con el terreno, por ello viene ahorrando sus dinero con gran esmero, con ello garantizará los ingresos económicos de sus hijos para el futuro.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the “3 de Mayo” community bank, located in the Ramon Castilla area of the Ilave district, in the El Collao province of Puno, Peru. She is 33 years old and lives with her common law husband. She has 2 children and has a third grade education. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 3 years. She works raising sheep and pigs as well as selling food and handicrafts. Her first loan for 300 nuevo soles was used to purchase more animals to “fatten them up” and sell them for meat in the markets of Ilave and to use for the food she prepares. With this loan for 3,000 nuevo soles, which she is committed to paying in 5 months, she will buy larger animals (3 bulls) to raise and sell for a good price. With the extra money she will earn, she will work to improve her food-selling business. However, her dream is to build a hotel in the city of Ilave. She already has the land and is saving up her money with great care, in order to guarantee an income for her children in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 3 bulls

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Mrs. Sem R. is a basket seller in Ang Ta Nou village in Takeo province. She is a 34-year-old widow with five children: one is employed in a garment factory, one is a construction worker, two are enrolled in the local school, and the youngest is too young to work or study. Mrs. Sem R. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding, and she would like to use the rest of the money to buy a staircase for her house.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for breeding and to buy a staircase for her house.

loans.name: Eleoupu

texts.en: Eleoupu P., 40, is married with four children.  She has three years of experience in the Taro Plantation business. She sells to the public and village people two days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 90 Tala (~30 USD). SPBD loans are Eleoupu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer and chemicals for the business. Her husband helps her with the business.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer and chemicals for the plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up on corn

loans.name: Vorng

texts.en:
Mr. Vorng S., 42, is not shown in the picture, but replaced by a picture of his wife, Mrs. Vin Dong. They were married in 1990 and have three children: one daughter, who works in a plywood factory, and two sons, one of whom is a chef and another one is in school. The family lives along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Vorng has been a blacksmith for five years. He works for another person who runs a blacksmithing business. His wife stays at home. Vorng doesn’t have his own motorbike to drive to work so he is applying for his first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive to work

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
La señora Modesta, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mi Sueño”, vive en el Jr. A.A.H.H. Tupac Amarú Mayor Fap, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 64 años, 04 hijos todos ellos ya independientes y formando sus propias  familias.

Modesta, a su edad aun se siente con fuerzas para seguir trabajando, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas. Manifiesta que con el negocio que ejerce se siente muy tranquila y contenta, vive sola y es ella quien administra su negocio. También se dedica al alquiler de cuartos, donde recibe mensualmente los pagos por ellos adicionando a estos las ganancias por las  ventas de sus bebidas, se siente muy capaz y responsable con las cuotas que debe pagar mensualmente al Banco Comunal.

Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio,  es conocida en el barrio; ya que sus gaseosas las vende bien heladitas al gusto del cliente.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando mas bebidas gaseosas de diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas. Así como agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Modesta, se siente orgullosa por haber logrado implementar su negocio, y asegurarse una vejez tranquila. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a superarse y a otras mujeres que quieren salir adelante y a defenderse como mujeres.
texts.en:
Modesta belongs to the Mi Sueño Community Bank. She lives at Jr. A.A.H.H. Tupac Amarú Mayor Fap, Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is 64, married, and has four children. All of them are independent and have their own families. At her age, Modesta still feels strong enough to keep working. She sells soft drinks. She feels very calm and happy about the business she does. She lives alone, and she runs the business. She also rents out rooms for which she receives monthly payments. Those payments, plus the earnings from her soft drink sales, make her feel very capable and responsible about the monthly payments she needs to make to her Community Bank. She continues with the same business. She is known in her neighborhood since she sells the soft drinks nice and cold just as her customers like. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she would like to buy more soft drinks in different flavors, sizes, and brands. She would also buy carbonated and non carbonated mineral water. Modesta feels proud of herself for having been able to implement her business and assure herself of a peaceful old age. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for having helped her improve herself. They have helped her and other women who want to get ahead and take care of themselves as women.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks to increase her drinks

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị N. is a 40 year old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, N. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. N. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. N. is now requesting a new loan of 12000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Cereza Group

texts.es:
Foto: De izquierda a derecha, Linda Urania F. L., María Milagros A. M. y María Dionisia Galán Pérez.

El grupo solidario Cereza está integrado por doña , Linda Urania F. L., María Milagros A. M. y María Dionisia Galán Pérez .
Doña   Linda Urania es la coordinadora del grupo, se dedica a la venta de comida como fritanga, refrescos y cajetas, tiene un niño, va la escuela, tiene tres años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Ella va a invertir su financiamiento en comprar alimentos como verduras, frutas, carnes, maíz y azúcar, estos los procesará en alimentos preparados que ofrece a sus clientes en la parada de buses de Masaya.
Ella es casada, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, él es carpintero desde hace mucho tiempo,pero ella le gusta tener su negocio para tener su propio ingreso y así comprarse las cosas que a ella le gustan como ropa, zapatos y artículos para su casa. Fue elegida como coordinadora por estar cerca de la agencia de Adim y así poder llevar los abonos puntuales.

La otra integrante es doña María Milagros se dedica a la venta de repostería, café, café con leche, sándwich y truchas, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace muchos años, ofrece de forma ambulante en todo el mercado, ha crecido en su negocio, con el crédito compró leche, azúcar, panes, enchiladas, etc. estos productos los ofrece a sus clientes por las mañanas, su horario de trabajo es desde tempranas horas de la madrugada hasta las dos de la tarde, espera poder ofrecer otro tipo de comidas a sus clientes.

Doña María Dionisia Galán, ella se dedica a la venta de reposterías y refrescos en su lugar donde vive y ambulante por las mañanas en el mercado municipal, ella utilizó el  crédito en comprar reposterías de mejor calidad y frutas para elaborar refrescos.
La señora es persona conocida por vender estos productos, ella es sola y trabaja solo para ella y así tener para sus medicamentos cuando se enferma, sueña con mejorar una parte de su casita.

El grupo espera siempre ser un grupo puntual, esto les ha dado mucha satisfacción y oportunidad de trabajar.
texts.en:
Photo: from left to right, Linda Urania F. L., María Milagros A. M., and María Dionisia Galán Pérez. The Cereza solidarity group consists of Linda Urania F. L., María Milagros A. M., and María Dionisia Galán Pérez. Linda Urania is the group’s coordinator. She makes a living selling foods such as fried snacks, soft drinks, and cajetas (caramels). She has a son who is in school. Linda Urania has worked in this activity for three years. She is going to invest her portion of the loan in the purchase of food ingredients such as vegetables, fruits, meat, corn, and sugar, which she will process into the prepared foods that she offers to her customers at the Masaya bus stop. Linda Urania is married. Her husband has worked as a carpenter for a very long time and helps her with the household expenses. Linda Urania likes having her business because it provides her with her own income and thus allows her to purchase things she likes such as clothing, shoes, and household items. She was selected as the group’s coordinator because her business is close to the ADIM agency and she can therefore make the payments on time. Another member of the group is María Milagros, who makes a living selling pastries, coffee, sandwiches, and trout. She has been involved in this activity for many years. She sells her foods as a street vendor in the market. Her business has grown, and she used a loan to purchase milk, sugar, breads, enchiladas, etc. She offers these products to her customers in the mornings. Her work schedule runs from the early hours of dawn until two in the afternoon. She hopes she can offer her customers other kinds of food. María Dionisia Galán makes a living selling pastries and beverages from her home, and in the mornings sells her foods in the local market. She used a loan to purchase higher-quality pastries and fruits for making beverages. María Dionisa is well known for selling these projects. She is single and works by herself, and thus has enough money for medicine when she becomes ill. Her dream is to improve part of her small house. The group hopes to always be punctual, and this has given them much satisfaction and the opportunity to work.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing supplies for preparing meals

loans.name: Oneness Group

texts.en:
Here are members of 'Oneness'group. They are local entrepreneurs based in Waterloo town, about twenty-two miles from Freetown. Business has been developing at a very slow pace for these entrepreneurs due to the lack of sufficient capital. With the opening of an SMT branch office in Waterloo, in partnership with Shine on Sierra Leone, these women have applied for a loan of Le 500,000 each to enable them to expand their businesses. 

Abibatu C. (right) is the leader of Oneness group. Abibatu is now age forty-nine. She was born in Bintin, in northern Sierra Leone. Her husband is already retired. They have two children; one is a nurse and the other a businessman. Abibatu sells food. She sells fried rice, chicken etc. She has been a businesswoman for over thirty years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Vidaldina

texts.es: Vildaldina R. Hernández tiene 3 hijos. Su edad es de 41 años. Su negocio dio inicio hace 15 años, porque empezó vendiendo ropa en su vivienda y además algunas veces transportaba en una canasta calcetines, ropa interior, camisetas y camisolas. Y posteriormente logro conseguir algo de dinero prestado, y así incrementar su inventario para ofrecer a sus clientes. Y así fue como poco a poco con interés y con mucho esfuerzo logro proporcionarle a su negocio una amplia variedad de productos. Es por esto que Vildaldina solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisetas, pantalones, ropa interior, camisolas. Por lo que todos los esfuerzos que realiza son para proporcionarle a sus hijos una educación por medio de este digno trabajo.
texts.en:
Vildaldina R. Hernández is 41 years old and has 3 children. She started her business 15 years ago when she began selling clothing from her home. Sometimes she also transported undergarments, undershirts and camisoles in a basket. She has received one previous loan, with which she increased the inventory she was able to offer to her customers. In this way, little by little, with interest and much effort, Vildaldina was able to add a large variety of products to her business. For this reason, Vildaldina is asking for a loan for working capital to purchase shirts, pants, undergarments and camisoles. The goal of all her efforts is to provide her children with an education through her dignified work.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Totosa Plus Group

texts.fr:
"Totosa Plus" qui signifie "Let's obey" en anglais, est un groupe de 34 micro-entrepreneurs à Kinshasa dont Astrid M. est présidente. Unis solidairement pour recevoir des crédits, ces membres ont déjà reçu 4 fois les prêts de l’IMF HOPE RDC et les ont remboursés correctement.
Astrid M. 39 ans, est une femme courageuse, déterminée à réaliser un jour son rêve d’ouvrir une maison d’habillement. Son activité initiale était la vente du riz, haricot et épices. Actuellement, elle vend des gaufres, beignets, œufs et omelettes dans un quartier au nord-est de Kinshasa. La bonne gestion ainsi que l’entretien de bonnes relations avec les clients sont ses atouts qui font prospérer son affaire. Elle tient à élargir son affaire au moyen des crédits reçus de Kiva à travers HOPE RDC. Elle a planifié avec le prochain prêt, de renforcer le stock de ses produits pour satisfaire le besoin de ses clients qui ne cessent de croitre. Aujourd’hui, son activité qui lui génère un bénéfice de $40 par semaine. Astrid est célibataire et mère de quatre enfants âgés de 7 à 19 ans dont trois seulement vont à l’école.

loans.use: renforcer le stock en achetant les produits de fabrication des gaufres, beignets et élargir l'activité

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción - Picota”, Distrito de Picota, Provincia de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 37 años y es madre de 04 hijos, 01 que esta bajo su poder y estudia.
