Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por ella misma, emprendió su pequeño negocio de venta de panes, con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00, obteniendo muy buenos resultados, por los precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente. Posteriormente, agrego a su negocio la venta de abarrotes, ubicada en su misma casa. En la actualidad continua con sus dos negocios, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su barrio.Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá, en la compra de insumos, para preparar sus panes.Hoy se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the Mujeres en Acción – Picota Community Bank, Picota district, Picota province, San Martín department. She is 37, married, and has four children. One child is still dependent and goes to school. Out of the need to contribute to the household income, and being self motivated, she started a small business selling bread with her first loan for 300 PEN. She got good results because of the reasonable prices and good customer service. Later, she added grocery sales to her business, which is located in her house. She currently continues with the two businesses. Her main customers are her neighbors. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she will buy more products to stock her business like kilos of rice and sugar, crates of eggs, personal hygiene items, household cleaners, packages of soft drinks, sweets, and other products to keep her customers happy. She will use part of the money to buy supplies to prepare her breads. She is very happy about the work and service offered. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping people like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes they continue this way for a long time and that they help many families and enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries and supplies to make her breads

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married and has two teenage children. She sells sport clothing at an open market in Ivano-Frankivsk town. She has been in this business for fifteen years and during this time she has obtained many repeat clients. This business is the only source of family income. 

Galina would like to borrow 6,500 UAH to increase her assortment. She will spend her additional income on finishing and improving her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To increase her assortment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate her business place and purchasing her beauty salon needs in bulk

loans.name: Xenia Jaquelin

texts.es:
la sra. Xenia G. tiene una pulperia, esta es su unica fuente de ingresos, ella decidio poner este tipo de negocio porque asi ella no descuida a su familia y esta trabajando siempre, ya que su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion. esto le permite abrir su negocio muy temprano y cerrarlo a las 10 de la noche todos los dias.
ahorita Xenia necesita el credito para comprar mas productos a precio de mayorista, asi les gana mas.
nos comento que ella tiene pensado a corto plazo hacer mas grande su negocio, dice que poco a poco lo va a hacer crecer para poder tener al final un mercadito en donde todos los clietes que vengan siempre compren algo y no se vayan con las manos vacias.
Xenia es una persona muy simpatica y muy amable, fue grato estar un momento con ella.
texts.en:
Xenia G. has a mini-market, which is her only source of income. She decided to set up this type of business because that way she does not neglect her family. She is always working because her business is located in her house. This allows her to open her business very early and to close it at ten at night everyday. Xenia needs a loan now to buy more products wholesale. That way she earns more. She tells us that in the short term she is thinking of making her business bigger. She says that, little by little, she will make it grow to be able to finally have a market. In that marker all of the customers who always come to buy something will not go away empty handed. Xenia is a very nice and very kind person. It was pleasant spending time with her.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy salsas  mayonaise, mustard, soft drinks, churros, preserves, bread, crackers, oil, shortening, beans, sugar, rice, coffee, salt, spaghetti noodles, condiments, sardines, chile, powdered milk, and dairy products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical supplies

loans.name: Eucebia Del Transito

texts.es: Eucebia del Transito B. R., vive junto a sus dos hijos y una nieta en el municipio de Armenia en Sonsonate. Eucebia  se dedica a elaborar y vender tortillas y pupusas, las cuales las comercializa en su propia casa. Ella posee varios años de dedicarse a este trabajo, el cual le ha permitido seguir adelante junto a su familia. A sus 50 años Eucebia trabaja para contribuir junto a su hija mayor con los gastos del hogar y así mismo le paga los estudios a su hijo menor. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin de comprar maíz, arroz y frijoles y de esta manera contar con materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas y las pupusas. Eucebia es una persona muy querida y respetada en su colonia, ya que es reconocida como alguien responsable y trabajadora, la cual desea mejorar su negocio y tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
Eucebia del Transito B. R., lives with her two children and a granddaughter in the municipality of Armenia in Sonsonate. Eucebia makes and sells tortillas and pupusas (a typical Salvadoran dish made with corn or rice and mixed with pork rind, cheese and beans in a tortilla), that are made in her home. She has several years of experience in this job, and this has allowed her to have a good start in life with her family. Being 50 years old, Eucebia, along with her eldest daughter, works to contribute to the expenses of the home and pay for her youngest sons’ education. She needs a loan to buy more corn, rice, and beans so that with these raw materials she can make the tortillas and pupusas. Eucebia is in her community a very loved and respected person, since she is recognized as a responsible and hardworking woman, who wishes to improve her business and live a dignified life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is a 29-year-old married woman with one child aged 10 years. Her child goes to school. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she lives with three people. She also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees for her child and the monthly rent of her residence.

Hamida works seven days a week in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She fries chapati (an unleavened flatbread, similar to tortillas) and samosas (fried or baked triangular-shaped pastry shells with a savory filling) in Kawempe Kalule Zone. She receives an average of twenty customers a day and sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale. She incurs transport costs to and from buying baking flour and cooking oil for making chapati and samosas. Her major business challenges are seasonality and the rainy season which hinders her from reaching her customers.

Hamida has been in this business for five years and with MCDT for seven years and is servicing her nineteenth loan. Hamida joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more cartons of baking flour and a jerrycan of cooking oil.. She wants to see her business  grower bigger and to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more baking flour and a jerrycan of cooking oil

loans.name: Shelita

texts.en:
Shelita A. is from the village of Baliwagan, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old. Shelita is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Shelita owns and operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Shelita is just starting this business.

In 2009, Shelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shelita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Shelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 52-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. She works hard to help her husband provide for their family. 

Victoria sells second-hand clothes. She hawks (sells door-to-door) and treks to nearby towns to sell. She buys the goods in Accra. Victoria has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy bales of textiles in bulk.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: God Grace Group

texts.en:
Mary S. is a leader of a group of five borrowers called God Grace. She is 49 years old and is a single mother with two children aged 28 and 30 years old.  Both of her children are college graduates and now working.  Mary also cares for two siblings.

Mary and her family live and work in the New Matadi Fanti town community, about two miles away from downtown Monrovia, Liberia. This is a community that is full of Fanti tribespeople from Ghana (a West African nation close to Liberia). Mary is also a college graduate herself.

Mary’s business is the sale of food such as rice, oil, onion, etc. She buys her goods from wholesalers and sells retail in the New Matadi Fanti town.   She has been running this business for five years and hopes to improve business to a shop in the near future.

Mary started selling with only a bucket of pepper but now, she sells different kinds of food. She sells at a good location and has a good business relationship with her clients in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. Mary needs this loan to purchase more goods for resale.  She dreams of being well known in society.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mary is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, oil, and onions for resale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a restaurateur with over five years' experience in the sale of cooked foods and drinks. She hopes to grow her business into a world-class restaurant.  She is 32 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is a commercial motorcyclist and he also supports the home. She is requesting the sum of 50,000 NGN to purchase a refrigerator to enable her to sell cold drinks to her customers. She says this will boost her business and attract more customers. She hopes for an increase in her business and for the best in life for her family. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Coceta

texts.en:
Coceta Y., currently in the business of selling rice in a shop, is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of rice and posho to sell. Coceta is 40 years old and married to a policeman. She has four children, all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice and posho to sell

loans.name: María Marleny

texts.es:
María Marleny es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus cinco hijos en el sector La Mercedes del caserío Paredones, una zona rural del distrito de Morrope, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Se dedica desde que se casó a la crianza y venta de animales en su domicilio. Ella cría aves de corral, vacas y cerdos en su domicilio para luego ofrecerlas en venta a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona, adicionalmente también viaja al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo para ofrecer su mercadería.

La idea del negocio surgió de la necesidad de obtener ingresos adicionales que les permitieran salir adelante ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero agrícola y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.

María Marleny desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas animales para engordarlos y ofrecerlos en venta, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y con un alto sentido de compromiso con su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es poder ofrecerle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior para que tengan la posibilidad de tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Maria Marleny is 30 years old. She lives with her husband and thier five children in the La Mercedes sector of Paredones, which is a rural area in Morrope, about an hour from Chiclayo. Ever since she got married, Maria has been breeding, raising and selling animals. She works from home farming poultry, cows and pigs, and sells them to dealers who travel through her area. She also offers animals for sale at wholesale markets in Chiclayo. Maria went into business out of necessity. Her husband, a farm worker, doesn't make enough money to cover their family's household expenses. Maria wants to expand her business by buying more animals to raise and sell. This is why she has applied for her first 1500-Soles loan from Edpyme Alternativa. Maria is a very responsible woman with a strong sense of responsibility. Her goal is to provide her children with a good education and a good future.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying animals.

location.town: Anexo Las Mercedes - Sector Paredones - Morrope -

loans.name: Maroofan's Group

texts.en:
Maroofan is a widow. Her husband died four years ago of a heart attack. She did everything possible to save his life but it was all in vain in front of God’s will. He left her without financial resources, but she fights with the circumstance bravely to overcome it.
  
She started operating a bangle-selling business. First she went door-to-door to reach out and obtain clients in various places. But now she has obtained a good number of customers. Her selling is not limited to the community but it has gone out of the community as well. She receives orders from the bangle shops too and earns good profit. 

Her family consists of five children: three sons and two daughters. She does this work to give them a good future. She is requesting a loan to expand her bangle-selling business so she gives her children a better future and fulfills their desired needs.

loans.use: To buy bangles in bulk to sell

loans.name: Las Comadritas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal  “Las Comadritas” esta representado por la señora Marcela Amparo y conformado por 11 socios D. los cuales 10 son  mujeres y un solo varón, este banco se caracteriza por ser un grupo muy unido y muy trabajador.  La señora Marcela Amparo está casada su esposo se llama Juan y juntos tienen una ferretería como actividad económica, ambos tienen 1 hijo que ya es independiente, La señora Marcela Amparo se dedica a la venta D. ropa y electrodomésticos como un negocio propio para ayudar en algunos gastos que ocasiona la casa, la señora desea al crédito para la compra D. mercadería que le ayudara a generar mayores ingresos para poder ayudar mas aun en los gastos D. su casa. El resto del grupo se dedica a diferentes actividades, como ser  venta D.  comida en puestos fijos en zonas conocida del centro D. la ciudad, otro socio se dedica a la crianza y comercialización D. chanchos, y el resto D. las socias se dedica a al venta D. abarrotes, en fríales y tiendas D. barrio. El grupo en general tiene bastante experiencia en los negocios que desempeñan y es por esta razón que son conocidos donD. venden sus productos por lo que no consideran a la competencia un factor que impida generar ingresos. El presente crédito será utilizado como capital D. operaciones para la compra D. mercadería, insumos y herramientas que faciliten su trabajo y ayuden a generar un mejor ingreso para el sustento D. su familia. En cuanto a la experiencia las socias van cumpliendo su primer ciclo con la institución pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a créditos en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital quien les brinda un apoyo económico para crecer y mejorar en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The community bank "Las Comadritas" is represented by Marcela Amparo, and has 11 members, 10 of which are women and only one man. This bank is characterized by its very hardworking and united group. Mrs. Marcela Amparo is marrried. Her husband's name is Juan, and together they have a hardware store as an economic activity. They have son who is now independent. Mrs. Marcela Amparo works selling clothes and appliances as her own business to help with some expenses of the household. She wants the loan to buy merchandise that will help to increase her income to be able to help even more with the household expenses. The rest of the group works in different activities, such as selling food in fixed places in well known areas of the downtown of the city. Another member works in breeding and selling pigs, and the rest of the members work selling groceries in markets and neighborhood stores. The group in general has a lot of experience in the businesses they have and this is the reason why they don't think the competition will be a factor that will impeD. them from generating income. This loan will be used as operating capital for the purchase of merchandise, materials and tools that will simplify the work and help to generate a better income for the support of their families. In regards to the experience, the members are finishing their first cycle with the institution. However, they already have experience in support groups thanks to loans in institutions similar to the Agrocapital foundation, which offers them economic support to grow and improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen A., is 40 and lives in Trento Agusan del Sur.  She is managing her farm alone and desires an abundant harvest. She said she learned to farm when she was just a kid. Her parents taught her everything. She wants to make her farm productive to be able to support the needs of her family. She would like to apply for a loan of 6,000 Philippine Pesos at Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Guljamish

texts.en: Guljamish I., 65, is a widow and lives with her three children in an apartment in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. She and her family have been living together in their current home for 30 years. Guljamish's husband passed away 10 years ago. Guljamish operates a traditional clothing and ger (Mongolian nomadic tent) furnishing business. She has been operating her business since 1996, and has steadily expanded over the last 14 years.  Guljamish runs her sewing workshop from a rented place. She pays 30,000 MNT per month in rent. She usually manufactures hand-embroidered decorations for gers (the Mongolian nomadic housing tent), a product in especially high demand during the summer. Between 1985 and 1995 Guljamish was a seamstress in a sewing factory. She is a professional seamstress and has built a stable operation. With her business profits, Guljamish was able to pay for her three daughters' university fees through to graduation. All of them are now married and living in households of their own. Guljamish is an open and very hardworking person. She says, “I would like to create my own workplace by successfully operating my business. ” Guljimish is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more material in Taikeshken, a Chinese border town.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr: Salimata N. est âgée de 62 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre de banc villageois depuis le 23 aout 2007. En trois ans d’existence dans le banc villageois elle a capitalisé un bon niveau d’épargne et des économies qui lui ont permis d’acheter du ciment et du sable pour faire de briques en vue de construire une maison. Elle est vendeuse de poissons fumés, de poissons séchés et d’huile de palme et avec son nouveau crédit elle va renforcer son niveau d’approvisionnement. Elle cherche à améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants et à leur chercher un abri.
texts.en:
Salimata N., 62, is a widow and the mother of six children. She has been a member of the Banc villageois since August 23, 2007. During her thee years with the Banc villageois she has been able to put aside a tidy sum and enough savings to buy cement and bricks in view of constructing a house. She sells smoked fish, dried fish, and palm oil, and with her new loan she plans to increase her inventory. Her goal is to improve living conditions for her children and provide shelter for them.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her little business

loans.name: 04.01.01-Hoang Truong 2-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
"Viên Lê Thị (12) is a 56 year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoằng Hóa-Thanh Hóa. Viên is the group leader of a 0-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 040101- Hoằng Trường 2-Hoằng Hóa (040101- Hoằng Trường 2-Hoằng Hóa).

Viên is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To making a living, Viên operates a family-run fishing business. WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Viên has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND per month from these activities.


In 2002, Viên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Viên has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase more fishing equipment including hooks & nets. The loan will be the 10th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Viên plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Lê thị Trọng (30) is a 53 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

2.  Lê thị Tích (17) is a 53 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

3.  Nguyễn thị Cúc (33) is a 26 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

4.  Phạm thị Liên (31) is a 27 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

5.  Lê thị Thu (35) is a 25 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

6.  Nguyễn Thị Minh (16) is a 35 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

7.  Lê thị Chiến (14) is a 32 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

8.  Lê Phạm thị Hợp (22) is a 21 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Viên Lê Thị (12) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoằng Hóa-Thanh Hóa.  Viên là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 0 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 040101- Hoằng Trường 2-Hoằng Hóa (040101- Hoằng Trường 2-Hoằng Hóa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở biển trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Viên thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Viên kiếm được khoảng 2,500,000 VND.  Vào 2002, Viên đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Viên đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua T.ết bị đánh cá bao gồm lưỡi câu & lưới.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6000000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 10th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Lê thị Trọng (30) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.

4.  Phạm thị Liên (31) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


5.  Lê thị Thu (35) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


6.  Nguyễn Thị Minh (16) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


7.  Lê thị Chiến (14) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


8.  Lê Phạm thị Hợp (22) là 21 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets,

loans.name: Sokkea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokkea U. (in the photo), 37, is a widow with one young daughter. She lives with her elderly parents and brother along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sokkea has been selling bananas and flowers since she was young. She buys them from her fellow villagers and transports to sell in Phnom Penh market. She does not have enough capital to purchase bananas for resale. 

Hence, Sokkea is requesting her first loan of $400 to provide additional capital.

loans.use: To purchase bananas for resale.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: La Sra. Yolanda Vive en la localidad de la guardia distante a 20 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, en el Barrio Monte Alto, su actividad es la venta de empanadas,  chicha bebida típica de santa cruz, pollos fritos; su esposo se dedica a la construcción, el cual conjuntamente con su esposa sustentan a su familia, sus hijos se encuentran en  edad escolar, el destino del crédito es para construir un techo en su domicilio  para guardar su vehículo que le sirve como medio de transporte  para su negocio; y necesita comprar material de construccion como teja, cemento, etc. hace 8 año que vive en la zona y es el mismo tiempo que se dedica al mismo negocio, es muy trabajadora y muy responsable siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Yolanda lives in the Monte Alto neighborhood of La Guardia, located 20 km away from the town of Santa Cruz. Her activity is to sell empanadas (stuffed bread), the typical Santa Cruz chicha (chicha being a variety of maize-derived fermented beverage, common all over South America), and fried chickens. Her husband works in constructions, and provides for the family together with his wife. Their children are attending school. The loan she is requesting will be used to build a canopy in her house that will shelter the vehicle she uses as transportation mean for her activity. She needs to buy construction materials such as tiles, concrete and so on. She has been living in the area for 8 years and has been engaging in her activity for about the same amount of time. She is a very hard-working and responsible person, always preoccupied with the well-being of her family. She is really thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es madre soltera, tiene 43 años de edad y vive junto a sus tres hijos en casa de un tío de avazada edad en el caserío La Capilla Central de Ñaupe, distrito de Olmos, ubicado dos horas quince minutos al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años es propietaria de una pequeña bodega que funciona en su casa. Allí vende productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite). Este negocio es bastante importante para sus vecinos ya que la zona en donde viven se encuentra alejada del pueblo mas cercano y muchas veces no tienen acceso fácil a productos de consumo diario. Con los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad se encarga de solventar los gastos económicos de su familia.

Sabina se esmera mucho por ofrecerle a sus clientes una buena atención, siempre trata de brindarles productos de calidad y una buena atención a sus clientes. Su negocio ha ido creciendo con el tiempo y ahora ella necesita adquirir mas productos para satiafacer la demanda de sus clientes, por este motivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Sabina ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y con el Fondo Kiva. Con el préstamo anterior pudo comprar algunos productos que le permitieron mantener su negocio y darle un nuevo impulso. Ella trabaja diariamente siguiendo su deseo de ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales.
texts.en:
Sabina is a single mother, 43 years old, and lives with her 3 children in the house of an uncle of advanced age in the settlement of La Capilla Central de Naupe. This is located in Olmos district, 2 hours 15 minutes north of the city of Chiclayo. Since 3 years ago, she has been the proprietor of a small grocery store that functions in her house. Here she sells products of primary necessity (rice, sugar, cooking oil). The business is sufficiently important for her neighbors, since the zone where she lives is located outside the nearest town and often they don't have daily access to consumer products. With the income she receives from this activity she is able to cover her family's expenses. Sabina endeavors to offer her customers good service, always trying to provide quality products and attentive service to her clients. Her business has been growing over time and now, she needs to acquire more products to satisfy customer demand. For this reason, she has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 new sols. Sabina has previously worked with our Institution and with the Kiva fund. With her last loan she bought products that helped maintain her business and gave it a new impulse. She works daily, following her desire to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PRODUCTS OF PRIMARY NECESSITY AND GROCERIES TO EXPAND THE GENERAL STORE INSTALLED IN HER HOME

location.town: Capilla Central de Ñaupe - Olmos - Lambayeque

loans.name: Papa God Group

texts.en:
George J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Papa God. He is 35 years old, single and has three children whose ages are between six months and twelve years. He was only able to attend school through twelve grade due to financial constraints. 

For two years, George has been operating a foreign exchange bureau in the Redlight Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 14,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 64,000 LRD group loan to add more money to his business. He describes himself as a devoted man whose goals are to improve his business and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Harris is inset at the lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To add more money to his business

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en: Mrs. Virgincita D. is from the Barangay of Bolinsong, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years of age, widow and was blessed with 4 children of whom 2 are already adults and the other 2 are school age. To make a living, she is presently operating a little piggery business. She is also receiving from her children in terms of her other needs. She has been engaged in this kind of business for almost a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from this business activity. In the year 2009, Virgincita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgincita, as an active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP Program (a microfinance program that reaches out to the rural communities) has successfully repaid a loan amount of 6,500 PHP. She is now requesting a loan amount of 8,000 PHP as her 3rd loan to be used for additional capital for her existing piggery business, particularly for purchasing feed and vitamins for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of their family especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, house repairs and maintenance, insurance and possible business expansions. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her little piggery business

loans.name: Shairgul's Group

texts.en: Shairgul S. is the leader of the group. She is 55 and divorced. She has a 14-year-old daughter who is in school. Five years ago, with the initial investment of 3,000 soms, Shairgul started to breed cattle. She resells cattle at a higher price after fattening them. In this way, she makes 12,000 soms per month. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs the money to purchase two bulls for breeding. Nazgul K. is the treasurer of the group. She is 34 and married. She has two daughters and a son. The daughters are in school and the son is not yet. In order to make money, Nazgul sells ropes and lassos at the market and her husband works in construction. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more ropes and lassos in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future, she wants to open her own store. Anvar I., 37, is married. He has a newborn son. Anvar sells fruits and vegetables at the market. In this way, he makes 15,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, he wants to purchase fruits in order to increase the turnover of his business. With part of the loan, he will purchase cattle for breeding. Mirlan A. is 25 years old. He is a private driver. He hopes to obtain the loan because he needs money to purchase auto parts and repair his vehicle. In the future, he wants to get married and start his own business. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase bulls

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is 32 years old, married with five children who are 10, 11, 13, 15 and 16 years old.  Pascal is commonly known in the business of selling foodstuffs mainly beans, etc.  Pascal has been in this business for about three years and the business hours are from 7 am to 6 pm every day.

Pascal needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, he will expand his business through purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs such as rice, beans, sugar, peas, cooking oil, etc.  As these foodstuffs are highly demanded by a large number of his customers, he will hopefully earn more profits which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business for a better financial stability.

loans.use: a large quantity of foodstuffs mainly rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es:
Pelagia  es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Salvador”, ubicado en el distrito D. Capachica, provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, tiene 51 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, con ocho hijos y con grado D. instrucción D. primaria  incompleta.
La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace siete años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles, el cual lo invirtió en la compra D. redes para la pesca, actividad que realiza su esposo. Actualmente ella realiza la venta D. pescado en las diferentes ferias D.  la zona. 
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo D. S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital D. su negocio. 
Su sueño  es crecer en su negocio. Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la unión.
texts.en:
Pelagia is a member of the communal bank "San Salvador," located in the Capachica district in the province and department of Puno.  She is 51 years old, married, and has 8 children.  She completed only part of her primary education.

Pelagia has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 7 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, which she invested in the purchase of fishing nets, as her husband is a fisherman.  Now she sells the fish in different markets in the area.

She is currently requesting a loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles, which will allow her to increase the working capital in her business.

Her dream is to grow her business.  What she enjoys about the communal bank is the solidarity of the members, who are punctual with their payments.

loans.use: to increase the working capital of her business

loans.name: Mykailo

texts.en:
Mykailo is married with two children. He owns a retail business selling construction supplies.  Mykailo has been in this business for 8 years.  His honesty and friendly attitude attracts many customers.  

A large assortment allows his customers to make good choices and purchase what they need at his store.  Since this business is the only source of income for his family Mykailo would like to develop it further.  He is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnas to increase the assortment of his inventories. Mykailo hopes to make additional income and improve his family living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of his inventories.

loans.name: Geoconda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Geoconda es una pequeña  comerciante que ha venido creciendo atreves de sus ventas, y apoyo de la institución pues lleva años trabajando en la venta de ropa nueva y ropa usada.
Pues le ha tocado trabajar desde pequeña, hoy cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja  como ebanista. 
Con sus crédito ha mejorado su casa, con el crédito anterior puso cerámica hoy desea reparar la parte interna de la casa. En donde comprara los materiales necesarios para comenzar la mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Geoconda is a small businesswoman who has been growing through her sales and with support from the institution.  She has been selling new and used clothing for years because she has had to work ever since she was little.  Today, she has her husband’s support; he works as a cabinet maker.

She has used her loans to improve her house.  She used the previous loan to install tile and now she wants to repair the interior of the house.  She will buy the necessary materials and supplies to start to improve the house.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne A. O. is twenty-nine years old.  She is single and has two children, aged ten and one. Her business is located at Kinanie Trading Centre and is known by the name Carol Boutique. Although she is a tailor, her business is known as a boutique because she makes and sells clothes on her own initiative without waiting for orders from customers. She also makes and repairs clothes according to customers requirements. Her business serves the local people.  She has had this business for ten years and has three employees. 

Carolyne says that this business is profitable and her major challenge is financial contraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 30,000 to buy more materials to expand her business. She hopes to grow her business, buy her own plot of land and build a residential house. She describes herself as very visionary.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes for her business

loans.name: Genesis 4 Group

texts.en:
Phinette is the coordinator of her group, Genesis 4. She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their 6 children.

Phinette is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and developed her business. She has had her business for around 5 years, starting with the first loan she received from Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing pounds of meat, like beef, pork, and chicken. She will continue using her business profits to save and make her dream of going back to Haiti  come true.  She hopes to have enough money to have a better life there.

Her group is located in El Seybo, an agricultural and rural city. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy meats

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline D., from the village of Bacnor East, is 45 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a service-based business providing plumbing repairs in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Evangeline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase materials needed to provide service, she is now requesting her ninth loan of 15000 PHP for the same purpose. Evangeline plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Neng

texts.en:
Neng V., 41, resides with his family in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. V. is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of approximately $7 per day. His wife sells fruits, earning an income of about $10 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $60 on food and $50 on the other necessary expenses. 

V. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more fruits and vegetables for his wife to sell. In the future, he would like to use the additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy more fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora María es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y se desempeña como tesorera del mismo, nos cuenta que le gusta el Banco por la seriedad tanto de las socias que son responsables y de parte de la institución que siempre cumple con ellas. Tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 15 y 16 años que están en colegio, en la actualidad está en su quinto mes de embarazo de su tercer hijo. Su esposo es chofer de un tráiler.

Tiene un negocio de venta de tarjetas y cabinas telefónicas, además de brindar servicios de internet, el mismo que pudo poner gracias a un crédito anterior que le sirvió para comprar unas computadoras y poner este servicio. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8 am hasta las 20h00, dice que le va bien ya que por allí cerca no hay otro negocio como el suyo, también vende colas y helados Pingüino. Nos cuenta que son varios años que lleva con su negocio.

Es para esto que solicito este crédito para comprar tarjetas telefónicas y para pagar el mes de telefonía e internet para seguir brindando sus servicios. Sus metas seguir creciendo con su negocio, que sus hijos sean profesionales y que su bebe nazca sano.
texts.en:
This location is known for its traditional culture and for being just a few minutes from two of the province’s best beaches: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

María is a founding member of the communal bank and is its Treasurer.  She comments that she likes the bank because of the seriousness both of the members, who are responsible, and of the institution which always follows through with them.  

She is 42 years old, married and has two children who are 15 and 16 years of age and in school.  She is five months pregnant with her third child.  Her husband drives a semi truck.

She has a business selling phone cards and has phone booths and she also provides Internet access services.  She was able to open this business thanks to a prior loan that was used to buy computers and to set up the business.  She works every day from 8am until 8pm.  She says she does well because there is no other similar business in the area.  She also sells soft drinks and Pingüino brand ice cream treats.  She tells us that she’s been in business several years.

She asked for the loan to buy phone cards and to pay the monthly telephone and Internet fees in order to continue providing services.  Her goals are to continue growing in the business and that her children become professionals and that her baby is born healthy.

loans.use: To buy phone cards and to pay phone and Internet fees.

loans.name: Hugo Rene

texts.es:
Don Hugo, reside en Usulután, tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica a la venta de medicina, el cual lo inicio hace 11 años después de haber terminado su servicio de militar.
El está solicitando un préstamo para adquirir más medicamentos, para fortalecer el negocio, ya que le ayudara a ofrecer mayor diversidad de medicamento y contar con la preferencia de los clientes.
Don Hugo sueña con poseer un local propio, donde pueda ofrecer a los clientes sus productos de calidad y de esta manera ayudar a su familia de una forma más solvente.
texts.en:
Don Hugo lives in Usulután.  He is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children.  He sells medicine, which he started doing 11 years ago after completing his military service.

He is requesting a loan to buy more medicines.  This will strengthen his business because it will help him provide a greater diversity of medicines and meet his customers' preferences.

Don Hugo dreams of having a separate location where he can offer his customers quality products, and thus help his family become more solvent.

loans.use: to buy medicines to sell

loans.name: Emma Rina

texts.es:
Emma Rina nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 51 años de edad y vive en la  ciudad del Cusco. En la ciudad del Cusco hay hermosos paisajes, donde hay sitios históricos y donde hay centros arqueológicos de los antiguos pobladores del imperio Inca. 

Emma Rina es profesora pero ahora esta jubilada  pero no por ese motivo ella dejo de trabajar, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de hacer manualidades, ella hace tejidos con lana y hace tras cosa más. Emma Rina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para el gasto de la educación de sus hijos. Emma Rina tiene un sueño y es de abrir un taller de tejido donde pueda hacer bonitas manualidades. 
  
Emma Rina es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Puntualito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del  Cusco se encuentra la ciudadela de los Incas de Machupicchu, Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Emma Rina was born in the city of Paucartambo in the Cusco department.  She is 51 years old and lives in the city of Cusco.  In Cusco, there are beautiful landscapes, where there are historical sites and archeological centers of the ancient settlements of the Inca empire.

Emma Rina is a teacher, but although she is retired now, she hasn't stopped working.  She has a small business making handcrafts.  She makes knitted items with wool and also makes other items.  Right now, Emma Rina needs the loan to pay for the education of her children.  Emma Rina has a dream, and it is to open a knitting workshop where she can make beautiful handcrafts.

Emma Rina is a responsible person who belongs to the "Puntualito" communal bank of Asociación Arariwa of Cusco, Peru.  The Incan citadel of Machupicchu, Cusco, Peru is located in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to pay for the education for her children

loans.name: Fe Retuya's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Fe R. is 48 years old and lives in Ozamis City with her husband and two children. She leads a two-person loan group. While she and her partner receive individual loans, each is responsible for paying back the entire loan if the other member defaults.  

Fe earns a living by making and selling food, snacks and other delicacies to people who live in her community. She has been engaged in her business for 25 years and earns about 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and her ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid five previous loans from PMPC and is applying for a new one, for PHP 14,900 PHP, to buy additional products to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Christine works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store and her motorcycle transport business.  Christine is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of dried fish for her dried fish business.

Christine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Juana Cruz

texts.es:
Juana  es una madre D. familia D. 52 años D. edad, ella vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito D. Monsefú en Chiclayo. Juana es conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora y devota a sus hijos.

Monsefú es una zona D. artesanos, allí se encuentran los mejores souvenirs D. Lambayeque. Juana pertenece a ese grupo. Ella confecciona  sombreros D. palma en su propio domicilio y se dedica hace más D.  15 años a  esto.  Juana venD. sus sombreros como pan caliente y cuenta con clientela establecida.

Juana solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 800 nuevos soles para comprar palma, que es el insumo principal D. la confección D. sombreros.

A Juana le encanta su trabajo y es feliz porque pueD. ganar dinero haciendo lo que más le gusta.
texts.en:
Juana is the mother of a family, 52 years old, and she lives with her husband and two children in the district of Monsefu in Chiclayo. Juana is a known to be a hardworking woman who is devoted to her children.

Monsefu is a community of artisans. The best souvenirs of Lambayeque can be found here. Juana is a member of this community. She makes straw hats from her own home and she has been in business for more than 15 years. Juana's hats are sold fast like fresh bread and she has an established clientele.

Juana requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1800 nuevos soles to purchase straw. It is the primary products that she uses to make her hats.

Juana loves her work and she is happy because she is able to earn an income doing what she loves best.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make hats.

loans.name: Jessica Raquel

texts.es: La Señora Jessica vive en un barrio muy concurrido, tiene 2 hijos, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 2 años en su negocio, ha demostrado ser una persona muy emprendedora sola mantiene el hogar, ella tiene que dedicarse a su hijos y al mismo tiempo realizar su actividad que es de lunes a domingo ya que sale todos los días a ofrecer cada uno de sus productos. El préstamo lo invertirá para la compra de calzado, bolsos, cremas, ropa en general, perfumes y toallas. El deseo de ella es poder tener más clientes y más inventario para así agrandar su local, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Jessica lives in a very busy neighborhood.  She has 2 children, and has a business selling general merchandise.  Over the two years she has had this business, she has been shown to be a person who is very enterprising.  She supports her household on her own.  While she is dedicated to her children, she also runs her business every day.  Each day she goes out to offer all of her products for sale.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of shoes, purses, creams, clothing, perfumes and towels.  Her wish is to be able to have more customers and more products, so that she could expand her store.  She is a very hardworking person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy shoes, purses, creams, clothing, perfume and towels

loans.name: José Elías

texts.es:
El Sr. José Elías es originario del municipio de El Sauce de la comarca Salales, es un señor luchador que tiene una gran familia trabajadora, actualmente cuenta con su propio negocio el cual consiste en brindar servicio de un molino y venta de granos como frijoles a los pobladores de dicha comarca, esta actividad la ejerce en conjunto con su esposa desde hace mucho años.
Desde que inició su negocio se ha caracterizado por dar una buena atención a sus clientes y gracias al esfuerzo propio ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y construir su propia vivienda. Una de las necesidades que tiene este señor es contar con más capital para adquirir por cantidad mayo los frijoles y venderlos a sus clientes aprovechando la ventaja de que están en su temporada de abundancia, por tal razón decidió solicitar su tercer crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de satisfacer la demanda de tales clientes.
texts.en:
José Elías is a native of the Salales region of the municipality of El Sauce.  He is a tenacious man who has a hardworking family.  He now has his own business providing milling services and selling grains such as beans to the residents of his region.  He has been working with his wife for many years.

Ever since he started his business, he has been known for providing good service to his customers.  Thanks to his efforts, he has been able to get ahead with his family and build his own home.  One thing he needs is to have more capital so that he could acquire a greater quantity of beans at wholesale to sell to his customers, taking advantage of the fact that they are plentiful in this season.  For this reason he decided to request his third loan from Ceprodel, with the objective of satisfying the demand of his customers.

loans.use: to buy beans

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 33 years old. She is a single lady with three children, ages 15, 13, and 10. She has been selling clothes for the past two years. She earns a monthly income of about 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which she uses to take care of her family.

She has applied for a loan of 25,000 KES from KADET LTD. This is her first loan from KADET. She intends to use the whole amount of her loan to purchase more clothing stock.

She plans to use the profit from her business to open up a boutique shop. In the future, she hopes to have a very big boutique in Mulolongo and to be selling imported clothes too.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing stock

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es: El señor Remberto trabaja de chofer y su esposa se dedica a la venta de camisas de hombre. Con los ingresos que obtienen de ambas actividades se mantienen. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una caja de cambios nueva para su movilidad, pues la actual está dándole muchos problemas. Remberto vive en casa de sus padres políticos (sus suegros) ubicada en la zona Villa Victoria de la ciudad de La Paz;  es casado y tiene tres hijos. Es primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Remberto works as a driver and his wife sells men’s shirts.  Income they earn from both activities supports them.  He needs the loan to buy a gearbox for his vehicle because the one he has now is causing many problems.  Remberto lives in his in-law’s house located in the city of La Paz’s Villa Victoria zone.  He’s married and hast three children.  This is his first loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a gearbox.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Mrs. Sin, 52, and her husband, 47, are living in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Both of them planting crops to support their family. Through this business, they gain profit of about $5 per day. Living with each other for a long time, they have birthed six kids and have made a happy family. To help with the expenses of a big family, some of the children try to find good jobs. In order to support her family business, Mrs. Sin needs to request a loan amount of $800. She will use the funds to purchase a plowing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a plowing machine.

loans.name: Kayissan Enyonam

texts.fr:
Kayissan est une femme âgée de  54 ans. Elle est veuve avec 05 enfants en charge. 
Kayissan travaille comme revendeuse de bijoux depuis 1980. Elle vend à ses clients au Grand Marché de Lomé. Elle achète les produits à COTONOU. 
Kayissan a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des bijoux.
texts.en:
Kayissan is a 54-year-old woman. She is a widow with five children in her care.
Kayissan has been retailing jewelry since 1980. She sells to her customers at the Grand Market in Lome. She purchases her products in Cotonou.
Kayissan requested her first loan cycle from WAGES in order to purchase jewelry.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 54 years old and lives in Bañadero, Ozamiz City. She is married and has 3 children. 

To earn a living, Rosanna has a business selling Nata De Coco. She earns about PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. Rosanna has requested a loan to purchase ingredients to be used for making Nata De Coco.

Rosanna has been a member of PMPC for 1 month.  In the future, she would like to improve her living conditions and to make her business become successful.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make nata de coco

loans.name: Noemi Candelaria

texts.es:
Noemí, se dedica al comercio de plástico, tela, vive con su esposo y dos hijo de 5 y 2 años de edad, ella aprendió de sus padres el comercio, hoy en día administra su propio negocio, con un horario de 7:00am a 5:00pm, atendiéndolo de lunes a domingo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de tela y plásticos, con esta compra surtirá el negocio, fortaleciéndolo para dar abasto a la demanda.
Su aspiración es a través de los préstamos poder crecer en el mercado y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Noemí is a plastic and fabric merchant.  She lives with her husband and two children who are 5 and 2 years old.  She learned commerce from her parents.  Today, she runs her own business with a 7am to 5pm work schedule, Monday through Sunday.

She is asking for a loan to buy fabric and plastic ware.  She will stock the business with this purchase strengthening it to meet demand.  Her hope is that through the loans she’ll grow in the marketplace and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy fabric and plastic ware.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha lives in the village of Dilikauri, Zestaponi District, West Georgia. He is 36 years old. 

Gocha is leading the agricultural business in the family. They own two milk cows and one sheep and sell the dairy products on nearby town's open market. The family earns additional income through sales of grapes harvested from their family-owned 250 vine trees. Along with the family farm, Gocha also works as a loader in the village. 

Gocha is married and lives with his family: his wife Olja and his 16-year-old daughter. Olja has health problems and gets a monthly pension from the state in the amount of 70 Laris. Gocha’s daughter goes to school. The total average income of the family is 630 Laris, including Olja’s pension. 

Gocha requested credit for building a sheepcote (pen for sheep). Part of the credit will be used to purchase five sheep. He will start selling lambs and use the milk from the sheep to produce cheese, which will be sold on nearby town's open market as well. The income of the family will increase. In the future, Gocha plans to reinvest part of the income in the sheep-breeding business for its further development. The other part of the increased income will be used for improving the daily living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a sheep pen and five sheep

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina is 40 years old, a married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Hai Gwafa in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Clementina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that the profit from this loan will help her to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en: Sophat is 28 years old. She has a plantation where she plants vegetables, beans, chili and sesame. She earns around $8 per day. Her husband is a primary teacher who earns $4 per day. They have three children; two are studying and one is too small to go to school. Every month, Sophat spends $60 on food, $7 on electricity, $25 on a school fee and $5 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a hand tractor for plowing the land for plantation. Aside from her plantation work, Sophat also sells some grocery goods at her house. However, that career has not provided a good income. She plans to plant more vegetables when she can earn better profits.

loans.use: to buy a hand tractor for plowing the land for plantation.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Señora Julia pertenece al banco comunal “Chaska Ñahui” y las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en el distrito de Wanchaq perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

Señora Julia nació en la ciudad de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades, ella trabaja en una empresa que se dedica a la venta de lácteos. Ya son dos años que se trabaja en esa empresa y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Señora Julia solicita el préstamo para la hacer mantenimiento de la casa. Señora Julia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Julia belongs to the “Chaska Ñahui” communal bank.  The bank’s meetings take place monthly in Wanchaq District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  

Julia was born in Cusco and still lives there and carries out her activities there.  She works for a firm that sells dairy products.  She’s worked there for two years already and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She is asking for a loan to do some home improvements.  Julia is happy with the loan and pledges to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en: Samar is 29, married, and has two daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. She is looking to improve her family’s living conditions at home, and she wants to purchase new home furnishings such as living room furniture, a kitchen table, etc. She does not have enough money for this, so she needs a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. Samar is a conservative woman, so her husband Hamed is photographed instead in a FATEN branch office.

loans.use: To purchase new home furnishings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to trade in metal scraps

loans.name: Richell

texts.en:
Richell is 32-years-old, married with one child and she's from Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Richell is operating a specialized retail store, selling a variety of food products in the local community. Richell has been 3 years engaged in her business and she earn 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Richell joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richell is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional product to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Richell from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional product to sell.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz María tiene 26 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene una hija, vive con el esposo y con la hija de 4 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Luz María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, maíz hace 10 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San Juan. Solicita el crédito para  sembrar y comprar semillas, productos agrícolas. Con el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar las semillas sin ningún tipo de problema por el dinero.

No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema El sueño  es tener una casa.

En los tiempos libres le gusta dedicarse a la hija.
texts.en:
Luz María is 26 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has a daughter. She lives with her husband and four-year-old daughter in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Luz María is a member of the San Juan Communal Bank, which is located in the neighborhood of San Francisco and part of the parish of San Juan. The members are farmers.

Luz María is a farmer who has been growing rice and corn for 10 years. She buys and sells in San Juan. The loan she is requesting will be used for her crops, so she will buy seeds and farming supplies. The loan will be a great help because the money will enable her to buy seeds without any problem. At the moment, she is not facing any challenges. Her dream is to have a house.

Luz María devotes her free time to her daughter.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Deylin Del Socorro

texts.es: Deylin de 30 años de edad es soltera, sus hijos estan pequeños en edad preescolar, ademas cuenta con el apoyo de su compañero de vida que asume los gastos del hogar. Deylin labora el MINED Santo Tomas desde hace 10 años como directora en una comarca de este muncipio, donde supervisa a los maestros de esta zona o bien les apoya a brindar clases cuando alguno se enferma. Esta solicitando  su 5to credito con el objetivo de terminar de mejorar su casita, pues con los creditos ha logrado instalar el agua y  levantar con piedras la mitad de su casa y desea terminarla para brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Deylin is 30 years old and single. Her children are small and preschool age. Also she has the help of her life partner who takes on the household costs. Deylin has worked with MINED Santo Tomas for the than 10 years as the director in a region of this municipality where she supervises the local teachers or helps them provide classes when someone is sick. She is asking for her 5th loan with the objective of finishing improvements to her small house. With the loans she's been able to install plumbing and to raise the middle of her home with stones. She would like to finish the house in order to give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to finish home construction.

loans.name: María Lucrecia

texts.es:
María es una persona alegre, cordial, sencilla y humilde que le gusta trabajar por su hijo para darle una buena educación y buena alimentación. Vive con su esposo y su hijo en Otavalo, Provincia de Imbabura.

María tiene un centro de cómputo, el cual es su fuente principal de ingresos económicos. Esta vez solicita un nuevo crédito a Fodemi ya que lo quiere invertir en la compra de dos computadoras más ya que su negocio poco a poco crece y sus clientes igual entonces necesita dar buen servicio al cliente e indirectamente producir más ingresos para poder mantener a su hijo.

Su sueño es poder tener un negocio propio cerca de su casa para poder estar más tiempo con su familia.
texts.en:
María is a happy, friendly and humble person who enjoys working for the sake of her son--in order to give him a good education and good food. She lives with her husband and son in Otavalo, Imbabura Province.
Maria has a computer center, which is her main source of income. She is now requesting a loan from Fodemi because she wants to invest in the purchase of two more computers because her business and customer base are growing bit by bit. She needs to provide good customer service in order to generate more income to take care of her son.
Her dream is to be able to have her own business near to her home so that she can spend more time with her family.

loans.use: to buy two more computers, since her customer base is expanding.

loans.name: Violeta Victoria

texts.es:
Violeta es una mujer de 32 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz con sus padres, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación;  lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Violeta no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Medicina Humana, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Violeta trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende diversas prendas de vestir tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, Violeta trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Violeta se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de prendas de vestir, como polos, shorts, blusas, pantalones y otros, de esta manera ella tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues Violeta seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Violeta is a 32-year-old woman, is single and lives in the city of Huaraz with her parents. She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to overcome. Unfortunately due to a lack of financial resources and because of necessity she had to work from a very young age. Violeta wasn't able to study for the professional career of Human Medicine. In her free time she likes to listen to music and sometimes she makes a delicious Arroz con Pollo [chicken and rice dish] to share with her family.

Of her own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Violeta works at her small business selling clothing. She sells various kinds of clothing for women, men and children. Violeta works every day for approximately 12 hours and she thinks that her business is going well because of the good prices and friendly treatment that she provides her clients.

Violeta is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help provided she will be able to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothing, like shirts, shorts, blouses, pants and other things. In this way she will have her business better stocked and will be able to attend to more clients. Violeta will thus keep working and making an effort to achieve her great dream of having her own home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Jecelita

texts.en:
Jecelita is 51 years old and married with one child. She has settled for a living in Kinangay Sur, Clarin with her family. Her husband is a farmer and Jecelita manages a small retail store in their village in order to make a living. 

By doing this, Jecelita is able to support their daily expenditures. She became a member of Gata Daku MPC and took a loan to buy organic fertilizer for her farm and some grocery home products for her retail store. 

Jecelita wants to become successful in her business and wants to provide her family with a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Pyalo est une femme mariée âgée de 45 ans résidante à Adidogomé. Mère de quatre enfants, Pyalo est une revendeuse de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Pyalo désire ce prêt pour commander des sacs de pâte de manioc, de légumes et des bassines de noix de palme. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne revente, Pyalo compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider sa famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.

loans.use: Acheter 10 sacs de pâte de manioc, 14  bassines de nois de palmes et 03 tas de condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow

loans.name: Zumrud
