texts.en: Zumrud M. (employee pictured) owns a “1001 things for the home” store in the small town of Khachmaz, located on the Northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. These types of stores are common throughout Azerbaijan. She would like to increase the variety of items that her store offers in order to differentiate herself from the competition.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of her store.

loans.name: Francisca Antonia

texts.en:
My name is Francisca M. and I make women's clothing. I have been doing this for three years and have a lot of clients as they like the way I work. My aim is to produce more clothes and therefore sell more. I would use the extra earnings to feed my family and pay the household costs.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Francisca M. me dedico a la produccion de ropa para dama actividad que realizo hace unos 3 años atraz, tengo muy buenos clientes, ya que les gusta como trabajo yo, mi meta es producir mas ropa para vender mas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y cubrir con los gastos de mi casa.

loans.use: To buy material, thread, needles, oil and sewing machine equipment/compra de tela, hilos, agujas, aceite, repuestos para  maquina de cocer

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Born in 1956, Julie S. is married to a polygamist and is the mother of seven children. The problems usually associated with polygamous families led to her mal treatment. She has to work very hard to fend for herself and her children. Motivated by this, she became a GHAPE member in 1998. Before receiving her first loan she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since 1998, she has been able to invest and repay loans up to $1000 with which she raised money to buy food and to pay school fees and apprentice fees for her children.

Given a loan of $1200, she plans to buy a motor bike and do transportation business. The motor bike will be driven by her son who has experience in the motor bike business. She believes the business will be lucrative as she has been trained by GHAPE in business skills and it is a faster source of transportation especially on poor roads. With this, she will raise money to educate her children in formal and vocational schools. She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Julie would like to purchase a motor bike for her son to start a transportation business to provide for their family.

loans.name: Seymur

texts.ru:
Seymur M. was born in 1980. He lives in Aksu. Seymur has been in auto repair business for more than 8 years. He is a great mechanic. To produce quality job, he was lacking modern tools. Seymur used his first NorMicro loan to purchase some new tools. Now he asks to borrow more money to complete his tools inventory.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мамедов Сеймур.1980 года рождения. Проживает в городе Аксу. Более 8-и лет занимаеться ремонтом автомобиля.Семейный, имеет двоих детей. Этот молодой человек прекрасный мастер.Для качественный работы не хватало современного оборудивания.Сеймур обратилься Нормикро Аксуниского филиала. Он взял кредит и купил необходимые инструменты.Теперь еще хочеть взять кредит.

loans.use: To purchase new tools

loans.name: Modupe-Ola

texts.en: Thirty-three years ago Modupe-Ola T. was born in a poor village in Lagos State, Nigeria. Against the odds she has taken nothing but her ingenuity and work-ethic and made it into a successful salon business. She has successfully grown the business over the last five years, but now she needs your help to further improve her salon. A loan of only 400 USD from you would allow her to buy the supplies she needs to prosper. She is married and mother of two young children.

loans.use: To buy hair products such as dye and hair relaxer necessary to sucess in the salon buissness

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en: Lusia is a married mother of 39 years of age. She has four children whom all in primary school. The plantation has been their only source of income over the years, and they have always wanted to buy a back sprayer, but money has been her problem. Lusia heard of SPBD through the village women, and she thought this was the only opportunity where she could get financial help. With her first loan she bought more equipment used on her plantation. This is now Lusia's 4th loan request and with her loans she has managed to improve her family's lives and develop her business.

loans.use: Lusia would like to buy supplies for her plantation.

loans.name: Pili's Mohemo Group

texts.en:
Pili, age 33, is married with 3 children (ages 6, 8, and 11). She owns a small grocery store which she opened in 2006. She works there from 5am to 6pm daily and now makes a monthly profit of about $70 from this business.

In the past, Pili received a loan to increase her inventory for her shop. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose to once again increase her business. She will share this loan with Mwajuma, another member in their loan group. Mwajuma is a food vendor in the same neighborhood.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her small grocery store

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam is a hard-working woman, daily she works in the store she started in her home three years ago because she’s always wanted to get ahead but at the same time not miss taking care of her 4 school aged children. Difficult life circumstances where they lacked financial security in the home were no obstacle for their loving and supportive household. To stay together she’s always looked for alternative jobs with her husband’s help and support. When she noticed that her neighborhood didn’t have a store nearby that her neighbors could buy different food products, Miriam decided to open a store with some small savings that she had and with the help of her husband has been working hard to increase her sales. She is always willing to improve her store as this is one of her family’s main sources of income. For the moment Miriam continues to hold many hopes and wishes for her family, her biggest desire being augmenting her store with more merchandise that will increase it’s profits. Help Miriam, a diligent and hard-working woman, realize her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Miriam es una mujer esforzada, día a día trabaja en la tienda que instaló en su casa, hace tres años porque su deseo siempre ha sido desempeñarse sin descuidar la atención de sus cuatro queridos hijos que aún se encuentran en edad escolar; las circunstancias difíciles de la vida en las que existían carencias económicas dentro de su hogar no fueron obstáculo para que coexista el amor y apoyo entre sus miembros, es así que para mantenerse unidos siempre ha visto la manera de buscar alternativas de trabajo con la firme ayuda y compromiso de su querido esposo.Cuando observó que en su barrio no había una tienda cercana en la que sus vecinos adquieran diferentes productos alimenticios, Miriam decidió con unos pequeños ahorros aperturar su pequeña tienda y con apoyo de su esposo la ha estado implementando para que sus ventas se incrementen, ella pone mucha atención y dedicación si se trata de buenos consejos para aumentar sus ventas y siempre está dispuesta a mejorar ya que es una de las fuentes de ingreso de su familia más importante. Por el momento Miriam continúa albergando muchas esperanzas y deseos para su familia y su deseo ferviente es implementar mucho más su tienda, con mayor mercadería que le permita obtener mayores ganancias.Ayuda a Miriam una mujer muy diligente y esforzada a cristalizar sus sueños.

loans.use: Influx of capital to buy more basic necessities and products for her little store.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 25-year-old mother of two children. Eunice and her husband live in the Nyalenda slums in Kisumu, Kenya. She began her tailoring business in the year 2006. She has been able to build a successful business due to her hard work and perseverance. She specializes in both men's and women's dresses. The central location of her shop and her many years of doing good business within the community have earned her a good reputation and a wide customer base. She is proud of her accomplishments and proud that she is now able to contribute to paying the household expenses. She requires US $600 to further expand her business. She wants to increase the variety of her clothes-making materials and purchase tailoring supplies to keep up with the growing demand.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Buy dressmaking materials

loans.name: María  Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora B., native of the Somotillo municipality, is married with two school-aged children. As a responsible mother, she makes every effort along with her husband to accomplish her dreams of having a decent roof over their heads where their children can grow and develop in their studies.

Over the course of time, there have been infrastructure problems in the home where they have lived, which has prompted them to invest in the reconstruction of this property. After starting the reconstruction, they have had to delay the process due to lack of financial resources. In order for them to continue with the project, she has requested a loan from Ceprodel with the goal of acquiring construction materials to proceed with the reconstruction and thus, offer her children all the possibilities to develop in their studies. Currently, the progress has been the erection and painting of plycem walls, but the roof and floors still need an investment.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Auxiliadora B. originaria del municipio de Somotillo es casada y con dos hijos en edad escolar, como madre responsable se esfuerza junto con su esposo para lograr ver cumplido sus sueños de tener un techo digno donde sus hijos logren crecer y desarrollarse en sus estudios.

A través de los años la casa de habitación donde han vivido ha presentado problemas de infraestructura por lo que los ha inquietado a invertir en la reconstrucción de esta propiedad. Al haber iniciado la reconstrucción de la casa han detenido la labor por falta de recursos económicos. Es por este motivo que para continuar con la labor, ella ha solicitado el crédito en Ceprodel con el fin de adquirir los materiales de construcción para continuar con esta obra y por medio de ella proporcionarle a sus hijos todas las posibilidades para desarrollarse en sus estudios. Actualmente el avance se ha llevado en el levantamiento y pintado de paredes de plycem pero aun hace falta invertir en el techo y piso.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo lives with his wife and two children in their own home, which is in the area north of the city of La Paz. Teofilo is employed in a services provider company in La Paz. The loan he seeks is to build a cement floor in his home. It is currently made of dirt, so when it rains, the humidity damages the walls. This is the first time he solicits a loan and a socio-economic analysis favorably qualifies him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

El señor Teofilo vive en casa Propia, en la zona norte de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus dos hijos. El Señor Teofilo trabaja como empleado en una empresa de servicios de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito que solicita es para el vaciado de piso de cemento en su vivienda ya que actualmente es de tierra y en épocas de lluvia, la humedad daña las paredes. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: to build a cement floor in his home

loans.name: Sahadou

texts.fr:
Sahadou S., 37, is married and the father of 3 children. He has been working as a butcher for more than 10 years in Kpalimé, a town located about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Sahadou is presently requesting his second loan and hopes to use it to purchase cows, sheep, and goats for slaughter. The income from his business will permit him to improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Sahadou S. est âgé de 37 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il exerce l’activité de boucherie depuis plus de 10 ans à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Monsieur Sahadou est à son deuxième crédit et espère, avec ce second acheter des bœufs, des moutons et des chèvres pour l’abattage. Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
purchase cows, sheep, and goats for slaughter

Acheter des bœufs, des moutons et des chèvres pour l’abattage

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla N., 37, and her husband, Sam-Ol Mol, live in a small village about 10 miles from Phnom Penh, Cambodia's capital city. Married for 17 years, they have two sons and one daughter. Two of their children are currently in school.

To help support her family, Phalla is woven silk into cloth, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a man in their village, who then sells in Phnom Penh's markets. Meanwhile, Sam-Ol works as a salesman.

Phalla and Sam-Ol have recently moved into a new house. Phalla is requesting a loan of $1,200 U.S. dollars to build a fence around their home, and also purchase more silk for weaving.

loans.use: For home repairs and to buy silk for weaving

loans.name: Ndèye Ndioro

texts.fr:
Ndèye Ndioro F., age 44 ans, is married and has four children, plus four other persons in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Keur Khaly, in Thiès, for three and a half years. She is the manager of a game arcade (foosball, video games). She wants a loan to buy a role-playing video game and to address operating costs, such as electricity. Her income is going to enable her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan that she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, a Kiva volunteer

Ndèye Ndioro F., 44 ans, mariée avec 04enfants et 04 autres personnes en charge est membre du banc villageois de Keur Khaly à Thiès depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle est gérante d’une salle de jeux. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter une maquette de jeu et faire face aux dépenses de fonctionnement comme l’électricité. Ses revenus vont lui permettre d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy a role-playing video game

loans.name: Fabiola Margarita

texts.es:
Fabiola inició el negocio porque ella laboro en una zapatería, y cuando inicio su familia se dio cuenta que es una actividad que puede hacer sin descuidar a sus pequeños hijos por lo que hace tres años con una vitrina que compro empezó su negocio en su domicilio, donde sus vecinos le compran.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir las novedades de temporada otoño que esta por iniciar
texts.en:
Fabiola began her business because she worked in a shoe store, and when she started her family she realized that this is an activity she can do without worrying about her small children so 3 years ago she bought a display case and began her business in his home, where her neighbors buy from her. She needs a loan for US $300 which will be repaid in 6 months to acquire season items for fall.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad B. is 37 years old and lives in a small village close to Nabatieh in the south of Lebanon. He is a kind man who nearly everyone in the village trusts and works with daily. Ahmad owns a mini market in town where he sells household items such as food and cleaning supplies. Ahmad wishes to increase the variety of products he sell so he can respond to his client's needs. He has asked Al Majmoua for a loan of $1000. This is the fourth time that Ahmad will be taking a micro-loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase a diverse new stock of items

loans.name: Holdrich

texts.es:
Holdrich tiene un radio taxi en la empresa Tramix de la zona Sur, es soltero y no tiene hijos .Vive en el Sector de El Rosal de la Zona Sur en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito será destinado para el mantenimiento completo de su vehiculo (chaperia, compra de llantas y tapizado de asientos)
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito ya que se gano la confianza financiera.
texts.en:
Holdrich has a radio taxi with the company Tramix in the south area of the city. He is single and he doesn't have children. He lives in the El Rosal neighborhood in the south area of the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to do a complete car maintenance of his vehicle (door locks, tires, and new tapestry for the car seats). This is the second time that he has requested a loan with Impro. His records show that he qualifies as client "1" , meaning he makes his payments on time, therefore he can have access to this loan since he has a good financial history.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance for his taxi.

loans.name: Gladys Marlene

texts.es:
Gladys forma parte del Banco Comunal “Palatinas Al Progreso” del distrito de Tarica, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 40 años de edad, tres hijos y convive con el padre de sus hijos que es profesor. Comenta que aún cuando su más grande logro ha sido tener una profesión, porque ella también es profesora, no lo pueda ejercer debido al cuidado que debe tener con sus hijos, convirtiéndose ello en su mayor dificultad. En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza que distribuye a pedido desde hace cuatro años en la casa de sus padres en Paltay s/n. También comenta que todo está tranquilo por ahora, porque en el negocio aún cuando no le pagan a tiempo tiene reservas para suplir su inversión con productos de promoción y en su familia se encuentra bien porque afirma que el velar por sus hijos también es una gran satisfacción.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en la educación de sus hijos y en la compra de cosméticos para tenerlos de reserva.
 
Gladys afirma que la mejor inversión que puede hacer es brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the communal bank called "Palatinas Al Progreso" in the district of Tarica, in the province of Huaraz in the state of Ancash. She's 40 years old with 3 children. She lives with the father of her children who is a teacher. She tells us that, even though she has been able to achieved one of her biggest goals which is to become a teacher, she can't teach at this time because she's taking care of her children who are her biggest responsability for now and her main reason to stay at home. She currently sells beauty products which she distributes/delivers to people who have placed orders. She has been doing this for the past 4 years out of her parent's home in the city of Paltay. She also tells us that everything is going very well because even when people don't pay her on time, she has reserves to purchase promotional items. Her family is doing well and she tells us that taking care of her children give her great satisfaction. With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will put some money away for her kids' education and she will purchase more cosmetics to have as a surplus. Gladys tells us that the best investment she can make is to give to her children the best life has to offer.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finance her kids' education and to purchase more cosmetics

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Villa del Lago II” del distrito, provincia, y departamento de Puno. Tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente  y madre de 4 hijos mayores. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/ 500 compró artículos de segundo uso y ferretería para vender en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que ha aumentado su capacidad de compra de artículos de segundo uso.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mayor cantidad artículos de segundo uso y ferretería para aumentar sus ingresos.
Maria desea continuar trabajando para apoyar en la compra de una casa, un auto y aumentar las ventas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora María is a member of the community bank "Mujeres de Villa Del Lago II" of the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 45 years of age, married, and mother of four grown children. With the first loan of 500 Soles, she bought second-hand articles and hardware to sell in her work. She has almost two years experience working with the community bank and tells us that she has increased her capacity to purchase second-hand goods. With this loan of 1000 Soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy a greater quantity of second-hand articles and hardware to increase her income. Maria wants to continue working to purchase a house and a car and to increase the sales in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy second-hand articles and hardware.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 25 años de edad, vive hace 4 años con su pareja, tienen 2 preciosos hijos, actualmente está viviendo en la casa de su madre.Desde pequeña se han dedicado a labrar la tierra, cultiva papa y en menor cantidad arveja. En todo este tiempo ha ido aprendiendo los gajes de una buena agricultora, su especialidad es la siembra de papa, para ello se levanta a las 4.00am a preparar los alimentos y a eso de las 8.00am carga la comida y camina 1 hora y media para llegar a sus chacras, y mientras que su esposo labora en la chacra desde las 6.00am, para que avancen y no les gane el tiempo. La dificultad que les acecha y no pueden controlar  es cuando cae hielo a la papa, pierden sin reparo alguno, debido a este factor siembran en las chacras de regadío, pero no tienen propias, por lo que alquilan si encuentran algunas libres; así no pierden mucho y a la vez no es de mucha inversión, y la otra parte siembran la chacra temporal donde tienen sus terrenos, pero es más costosa la inversión y corre peligro de la helada. Elizabeth es una cliente muy antigua de MFP, viene trabajando 7 préstamos consecutivos, en todo este tiempo ha crecido en su actividad sembrando cada vez en mayor cantidad, por ello le tiene mucha gratitud a esta institución, y sigue comprometida a realizar los pagos en las fechas exactas. El dinero solicitado es para la compra del insecticida llamado Temex que cuesta aproximadamente 1000 soles, y con el resto comprará sacos de fertilizantes, cada bolsa cuesta 95 soles.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 25-year-old woman who has been living with her husband for 4 years. They have 2 precious children and are currently living in her mother’s home. Ever since she was young, she has worked the land. She grows potatoes and, on a smaller scale, peas. During this whole time, she has been learning the responsibilities of a good farmer. Her specialty is growing potatoes, for which she gets up at 4:00 am to prepare meals. At around 8:00am, she takes the food and walks for an hour and a half to get to her farms. Meanwhile, her husband starts working the fields at 6:00am in order to get a head start. The problem, which is out of their control, that threatens them is when frost affects the potatoes, they lose their investment. Because of this aspect, they grow crops in irrigated lands, but they do not have their own land, which means they must rent land that is available. Hence, they do not lose much and at the same time, they do not invest much. They plant the other half on their seasonal farm, but the investment is more costly and they run the risk of frost. Elizabeth is a senior member of MFP. She has requested 7 consecutive loans, during which time her business has expanded and her crops have increased. For this reason, she is very grateful to this institute. She is still committed to making her payments punctually. The money being requested will be used to purchase a pesticide called Temex, which costs approximately 1,000.00 PEN, and fertilizer at 95.00 PEN a sack.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Socorro Guadalupe

texts.es:
Socorro inició el negocio por la necesidad tener una entrada extra de dinero, ya que aunque es empleada de ventas en una empresa que se dedica a la fabricación de tintas plásticas, el sueldo que percibo no  es suficiente por lo que decidió comenzar su negocio  en Julio de 1998 en un cumpleaños de una de sus hijas elaboro algunos arreglos infantiles y le gustaron mucho a sus amigas, fue entonces que decidió arriesgarse a elaborarlos para su venta y a la gente le ha gustado mucho su trabajo lo cual ha hecho que cada día tenga mas clientes.
Gracias  a su esfuerzo su negocio ha ido progresando considerablemente ya que inicio  haciendo pocos arreglos pero en la actualidad la gente ya conoce su trabajo y además de hacer sus arreglos, desde hace seis meses ya también se dedica a la impresión de invitaciones, vasos, servilletas, etc

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $4000 que pagara en 8 catorcenas lo que le permitirá contar con suficiente materia prima para poder elaborar arreglos ahora que se acerca el 14 de febrero, día de san Valentín en donde la gente organiza fiestas y hace regalos.
texts.en:
Socorro started her business out of the necessity to have extra income, although she is employed in the sales of a company that makes dyed plastics, the income of which is not enough to be dedicated to starting a business. In July of 1998, on the birthday of one of her daughters, she made some arrangements for children (with toys, candy and decorations), and her friends liked them a lot. She then decided to make them to sell, and everyone has liked her work a lot. She makes them every day for her customers.

Thank you for your support of her business. The business has progressed considerably since it she started making the arrangements. Everyone now knows her work. and for 5 months she has been making invitation cards, glasses, napkins, etc.

She needs a loan of 4,000 Mexican pesos that she will pay in 8 2-week periods. This will let her have enough primary materials to elaborate her products, now that it is around February 14th, Saint Valentine's Day, when everyone has parties and gives gifts.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material for her work

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is a 32-year old woman and blessed with 1 child. She runs a variety store with an auto-load section. She started her variety store through her initiative and knowledge of dealing with customers. 

Her business is growing in because the people in her neighborhood like her products and find what they need in her store. She is requesting a loan to use for additional capital to improve her store and her income.

She dreams to grow her variety store into a mini-grocery store and expand it to other places. She also supports her niece and hopes to help her finish her studies so she can find a good job.

loans.use: To purchase stock for a variety store and more autoloads

loans.name: María Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Maria Auxiliadora, está ubicado en la comarca El coyolar que pertenece a la ciudad de Granada, está conformado por las siguientes personas:
Manuel Antonio M. C., vende granos básicos en el mercado de Granada, Juliana del Carmen F. C., vende frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya, María Lucrecia V. también vende frutas y verduras e n el mercado de Masaya y Granada de forma ambulante y Mario José O. C. vende granos básicos en el mercado de Granada. Tienen actividades similares ya que es en el mercado donde se encuentran y además se conocen en su comunidad.

Esperan trabajar bien, cumpliendo con sus cuotas, ellos llegaron a tener crédito con Adim porque una cliente les habló del tipo de crédito que recibían, donde confiaban en la honorabilidad de los clientes.

Doña María Lucrecia V., es una mujer de treinta y ocho años, con un hijo de catorce años, su fuente de trabajo es la venta de frutas y verduras ambulante  en el mercado de Masaya. Ella tiene la ayuda de su esposo en los gastos del hogar, piensa dar estudio a su hijo y mejorar su vivienda, expresa que esta contenta de trabajar con Adim porque ella nunca había tenido oportunidad de un crédito por no tener garantías y ahora ella va a agradecer mucho a la institución que confía en ella.

Estos señores abonan todos los Lunes, es el mejor día para abonar, después del fin de semana que las ventas son mejores y así garantizan la cuota del préstamo.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora group is located in the region of El Coyolar in the city of Granada. It is made up of the following people: Manuel Antonio M. C. sells basic grains in the Granada market. Juliana del Carmen F. C. sells fruits and vegetables in the Masaya market. María Lucrecia V. also sells fruits and vegetables in the Masaya market and in Granada as a street vendor. Mario José O. C. sells basic grains in the Granada market. They all have similar work, which is why they met each other in the market and know each other in the community, They hope to work hard, fulfilling their payments. They came to Adim for credit because another customer told them about her loans and their trust in the honesty of their customers. Doña María Lucrecia V. is a 30-year-old woman with a 14-year-old son. Her work is in the sales of fruits and vegetables from stalls in the Masaya market. She has the support of her husband in household expenses. She is thinking of giving her son an education and improving her home. She expresses her satisfaction for working with Adim, because she never had the opportunity to take out loans before for lack of credit. Today she is very thankful that the institution trusts her. They make payments every Monday, the best day to pay after the higher weekend sales and in this way guarantee the loan repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama A. is single and has no children. She has received schooling through junior high. Mariama sells ladies' underwear, fabric, and powder in Elmina, which she has done since 2007. Mariama contributes towards the living expenses of her younger siblings; she uses her income to buy textbooks and other basic needs for her them .

Mariama will use the loan as additional capital to enable her increase the sale of ladies underwear, fabric, and powder to meet the increase in demand by her customers. Mariama plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business, further expanding her trade.

loans.use: Purchase of additional inventory

loans.name: Asat

texts.ru:
Асат Ризокулов  родился в 1967 году, образование среднее, по национальности узбек. Асат проживает в Шахристанском районе, вместе с женой Салимой и 4 детьми.
  Дома имеет крупнорогатый скот, и получает прибыль от откорма и ее перепродажи.
  Животноводством он занимается 12 лет, и в данный момент нуждается в сумме 1600 сомони, для того чтобы откормить свой скот, и после продать на рынке. В будущем, после успешного погашения и полученной прибыли от животноводства, хочет взять займ для увеличения количества своего скота.
  Дополнительный семейный доход Асату приносит его работа в дехканском хозяйстве «Ризокулбобо».
texts.en:
Asat R. was born in 1967. He graduated from high school, and is an Uzbek ethnically. Asat lives in the Shahristan region, together with his wife Salima and their four children. He keeps large-horned cattle at home, and earns a profit raising and reselling them. He has been in the livestock business for 12 years, and at present needs 1600 somoni to fatten his cattle, then resell them in the marketplace. In the future, after successfully repaying his loan and receiving the profit from the livestock, Asat wants to take out a loan to increase the size of his herd. By way of additional family income, Asat works at the Rizokulbobo farm.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijas de 20 y 15 años en su casa propia. Ser ama de casa, no es limitación, por lo que ha decidido abrir en su propia casa una tienda, la cual le permita atender su hogar y a la vez generar ingresos económicos. La buena atención que ofrece cada día y el peso exacto de cada producto, han logrado que en sólo 2 años, su bodega crezca rápidamente y sus clientes estén en aumento. El horario de mayor venta durante el día es cuando se acerca el medio día, ella es la única encargada de la atención de su tienda y aunque refiere que es un trabajo cansado, también es gratificante porque diariamente está en contacto con sus clientes. Para más adelante, Teodora piensa tener una tienda más grande donde pueda ofrecer mayor variedad de productos comestibles. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está muy entusiasmada de pertenecer a su nuevo banco comunal, donde promete ser una integrante activa y responsable. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de mercadería; un saco de arroz valorizado en 60 soles, y con el resto comprará arena para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, y a su vez de su tienda.
texts.en:
Teodora is 36 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children, ages 20 and 15, in their own house. To be a housewife is no limitation, for she has decided to open a store in her own home, which will enable her to both take care of her home and generate income. The good attention that she offers every day, and the exact weight of every product, means that she has succeeded in only 2 years; her store grows rapidly and her clients are increasing. The best time of the day for sales is near mid-day; Teodora is the only attendant in the store, and although that means tiring work, it is also gratifying because she has daily contact with her clients. To advance, Teodora is thinking of having a bigger store where she could offer a larger variety of edible products. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is very enthusiastic to belong to a new communal bank, where she promises to be an active and responsible member. The money she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandise; a sack of rice worth 60 soles, and the rest will buy sand to improve the infrastructure of her house, and, in turn, her store.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Aterei E Ailigat Jane Group

texts.en: Ailigat J. is 47-years old, married, and has eight children. All her children are in schooling. She looks after five dependents, of which, two are in schooling. She sells smoked fish and she has been operating this business for over 2 years. She is using the loan to purchase additional smoked fish for sale to improve her business. She is an active and hardworking business lady whose dream is to purchase cassava in large quantities to take to Juba, in Sudan.

loans.use: To purchase additional smoked fish for her business.

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es:
Yadira es socia del Banco Comunal Luz Divina.
Yadira es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hija, Yadira viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, productos que proceso en molinos alquilados y los comercializa en los mercados.
Yadira necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cebada, trigo.
Los sueños de Yadira son mejorar su negocio para brindar todo lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
Yadira is a member of the Banco Comunal Luz Divina. Yadira lives with her partner. She is 27 years old and has a daughter. She travels to various markets in the area, where she buys grains and has them processed at mills, and then sells them in the markets. Yadira needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will use to buy barley and wheat. Yadira's dream is to improve her business so she can offer her daughter the best.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase barley and wheat

loans.name: Nyame Ye Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is forty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. She is a petty trader. She sells tubers of yam. She sells in her community and treks to other towns to sell as well.

Elizabeth is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame Ye’ which literally means 'God is good'. She is the fair woman in middle foreground of the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. They work to help their spouses provide for their families.

They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo S., age 47, is a rice grower from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. He is the father of three children, and his only ambition is to have all his children graduate from college and improve their lives. He started farming when he was a small child. Now, he has a farm because his parents gave him one when he decided to marry his wife, Angelita S..

He would like to ask for a loan of 15,000 PHP so that he can buy the fertilizer, rice seed, and chemicals that he needs for his farm. He hopes that this will bring good profits in his farm business.

CEVI helps Danilo sustain his farm. In addition to loans, CEVI also provides training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizer, rice seed and chemicals

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac B. is married and has four children. He has senior high school education (computer studies). Isaac sells electrical spare parts and also repairs electrical appliances at Nyanta near Elmina, which he has been doing since 1999. His wife is a trader. Isaac uses his income to pay school fees and utility bills. Isaac will use the loan to buy more spare parts for resale and also for his repair work in his shop. With the new profits from his expanded business, Isaac plans to save towards renovating his house.

loans.use: Isaac will use the loan to buy more spare parts for resale and also for his repair work in his shop.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Vann O., 30, is a low-income citizen who is requesting a loan of US$100. He will use the funds to buy more fertilizers to fatten his rice crop that is not growing well. He and his wife are local cultivators. Besides their farm, Vann O. is also going to work in constructiO., for a profit. This couple now lives with their five school-aged children in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to fatten his rice crop.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela es socia del Bancomunal Nuevo Amanecer, es conviviente, tiene 62 años y 4 hijos que están casados y viven con ella, pero en diferentes pisos de su casa.
Daniela tenía un taller familiar de calzado, lo cerró porque la competencia era muy grande, empezaron a llegar zapatos de China y los pedidos que le hacían bajaron, con los ahorros de su negocio pudo comprar una casa, pero en cascaron, es decir una casa no terminada, la zona donde ella vive es una zona donde buscan bastante alquiler de cuartos, Daniela tuvo la idea de construir su casa con cuartos para alquilar.
En FINCA Perú ella aprendió con las capacitaciones como sacar los ingresos y egresos y separa sus ganancias.
Daniela  necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles para hacer  de las habitaciones que alquila.

loans.use: arreglos en los baños

loans.name: Sai

texts.en: Sai S. is 48 years old widower man and father. Sai S. is a local cultivator who has been farming rice since 2000. He has now four single children, and they live together in a medium house located in Banteay Meanchey Province. Sai S. is a sacrificing and determined man who tries to earn money to feed his children since they were very young. He has encouraged his two children to attain suitable jobs: his daughter is selling grocery item from home and other one son raises poultry for a profit, and they both provided their income to support their family’s daily living expenses. Sai S. is taking out his loan as capital to be allowed to his daughter to order more her grocery inventories for sale.

loans.use: To order more her grocery inventories for sale

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las diversas tareas agrícolas, pero hace 2 años decidió incrementar sus ingresos económicos implementando una tienda de comestibles en su casa, donde vende todos los productos que no se producen en su localidad como el arroz, azúcar, menestras (lentejas y frijoles), entre otros productos. Debido a su buena atención y variedad de mercadería, Natalia ha visto que su tienda está siendo más concurrida y sus ventas cada vez más estables por lo que está dispuesta a seguir invirtiendo en ella.

Esta es la segunda oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal, donde es muy responsable y puntual con sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para su tienda, y con otra parte adquirirá sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Natalia is 32 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in their own house. Since childhood she has worked at a variety of agricultural tasks, but 2 years ago decide to increase her income by setting up a grocery store in her house, where she sells goods that are not produced locally, such as rice, sugar, and legumes (lentils and beans) among other products. Because of her good service and variety of merchandise, Natalia has seen her shop become more popular and her sales become increasingly stable, so she is willing to keep investing in it. This is the second time she has had a loan with MFP. She belongs to a commual bank, where she is very responsible and punctual with her payments. The money she is requesting will be used to buy groceries for her store and with part of it she will buy sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of goods.

loans.name: Rech

texts.en:
Rech P., 49, is married with nine children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. Mrs. P. is a housewife who stays at home and looks after the children and household chores. Both Mrs. P. and her husband’s living depend on the support of their four children who are currently employed at various workplaces. Most of them are construction workers who are able to earn enough for their living and to help cover the family expenses.

Mrs. P. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. This is her third loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. P. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a new motorbike for her children to commute to work easily. By doing so, she will be able to cut back on public transportation expenses. (Rech P. is pictured with two of her children.)

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Noribel

texts.en:
Noribel I. is from the village of Lower Gamay. She is 28 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child.

Noribel owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.  Aside from business income, she receives also monthly remittance from her husband working abroad for not less than 10,000 PHP.

In 2006, Noribel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital.

Noribel is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional construction materials and to pay the labor for house improvement. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to finish her house to have a comfortable shelter for the family to live in. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials and labor for house improvement

loans.name: Ean

texts.en: Ean S., 36, is a construction foreman of many years' experience, earning about $4 per day. He is married to Cham Chorn, 30, a local crop grower, and they have three school-aged children who are dependent on them. Since Ean incurs high transportation costs commuting to work because he doesn’t have his own vehicle, he is requesting a loan to add to his own small savings to buy a used motorbike which he will use to commute to work.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, 55, and her husband Domingo are busy with their lives and for good reason, they have three businesses:  a sidecar service, a vegetable stand, and bed space for rent. They are blessed with two children, one who is now working and the other one who passed away.

Rosita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than three years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow several times from CCT’s Cooperative. The reason why she was consistent in paying her loans was because she used almost all of the money she borrowed to improve her business. 

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 19,000 loan. This amount will be mostly used  to buy an additional pedi-cab for their transportation service and to increase vegetable stocks for more profits. 

She dreams that all her businesses will continue to grow so that they can have more savings and see more opportunities to start new businesses in the future.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy an additional pedi-cab for their transportation service and added vegetable stocks for more profits.

loans.name: Yessika Waleska

texts.es:
la Joven Yessika Waleska C. tiene 23 años de edad,  es soltera y tiene un hijo. Yessika se dedica al negocio de pulperia, tiene pocos años de tener su negocio, esta pulperia era de su madre y ahora es de ella. Yessika lo esta administrando bien, dicho negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion.
Yessiika esta solicitando el credito para poder surtir mas su negocio, desea comprar otro tipo de productos y asi tener mas variedad y que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que anden buscando,
 
nos comento que esta muy feliz ya que a su corta edad ya tiene un negocio propio y que lo piensa hacer crecer hasta llegar a tener un supermercadito.
su meta es poder darle los mejores estudios a su hijo que es lo mas importante en su vida.
texts.en:
Yessika Waleska C. is 23 years old, is single, and has one son. She is the proprietor of a general store. She is fairly new in this business; the store previously belonged to her mother. She is doing well with the administration of the store, which is located in her house. Yessika is seeking a loan to buy more merchandise for the store. She wants to buy other types of products to have more variety, so her customers can always find what they are looking for. In particular, she will buy cough drops, chicken, pork, sugar, rice, cleaning products, cheese, fried snacks, soft drinks and juices. Yessika says she is happy to have her own business at such a young age. She would like to expand to become a small supermarket. Her goal is give the best education to her son, who is the most important thing in her life.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for store

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es: El grupo Solidario El Carmen lo conforman Karen y Pía Bonifacia. Ellas se han unido para realizar un financiamiento que les será de mucha ayuda a las dos. Con mucho amor son personas que trabajan humildemente en sus negocios, Pía se dedica a la venta de ropa, desde hace 29 años ella visita las comarcas más cercanas para ofrecer sus productos, pues a pesar de que tiene que caminar mucho no se detiene porque sabe que tiene proporcionar el alimento diario de su familia, pues la mayoría de sus clientes son muy tranquilos y cariñosos con Pía ya que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar en esta actividad. El financiamiento que solicitan es para la compra de mercaderías necesarias para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Solidarity Group “El Carmen” consists of Karen and Pía Bonifacia. They have joined together to receive a loan that will be helpful to both of them. These loving women work humbly in their businesses. Pía has been selling clothes for 29 years. She travels to nearby districts to offer her products. Even though her job requires a lot of walking, Pía continues to work because she knows this is her way of putting food on the table for her family every day. Most of Pía’s customers are very calm and considerate when dealing with her because they know she does a lot of walking in her work.

The loan being requested will be used to buy the necessary goods for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr: Madame Aby S. est une femme mariée âgée de 48 ans. Mère d’un enfant de 16 ans, elle est femme de charge à la garderie du PDEF (Programme de développement des enfants et Familles), un programme du Child Fund ex Christian Child Fund (CCF). Madame S. pratique en parallèle le commerce, une activité qu’elle a copiée sur ses parents commerçants. Cependant pour renforcer son activité, elle vient solliciter pour la première fois un crédit de 100 000 FCFA. Elle compte acheter avec ce montant des chaussures qu’elle va revendre à ses clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aby S. is a 48-year-old woman, mother of a 16-year-old child. She is a housekeeper at the PDEF Nursery (Development Program for Children and Families), a program of Child Fund, ex-Christian Child Fund (CCF). Mrs. S. has another activity selling goods, which was inspired by her parents’ own commercial activities. To strengthen her business, she is requesting for the first time a loan for 100,000 FCFA, with which she will buy shoewear for resale to her customers.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes

loans.name: Ngi

texts.en: Ngi S., age 37, is married and resides with her children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She has a business of selling various kinds of groceries at home, earning an income of US$ 5 per day. Her husband operates a business of selling palm juice and fruits, earning an income of US$ 5 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially on the children’s education. She has been with this job since 1990. S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more various kinds of groceries to stock the store. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered Kiva.

loans.use: buy groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Roger Antonio López, es un padre de familia de tres hijos, los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar y
 Trabaja para el centro de insumo para la salud.
.
Es el primer crédito que trabaja con ceprodel, el cual lo va invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines, clavos y pintura para el techo de su casa de habitación.

Todo esto con el objetivo de tener una vivienda mas segura para su familia.
texts.en:
Roger is the father of three school-aged children and works for a medical supply center. This will be his first loan through CEPRODEL, which he will use to buy building materials; such as zinc metal sheeting, beams, nails, and paint for his home's roof. He wants to have a more secure home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
Este cliente es un productor de la zona de Chinandega es un hombre casado y padre de 4 hijos 
El crédito lo esta solicitando para la compra de semillas e insumos para la siembra de 3 mz de sandillas 
Siempre a vivido de esta actividad y a mantenido a su familia
texts.en:
This gentleman is a farmer in the Chinandega zone. He is married and the father of four children. He is requesting this loan in order to buy seeds and supplies to plant watermelon. This is how he makes a living and supports his family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Faming supples

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Carlos, pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco; situado a 1 hora desde la ciudad de Cusco.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Nuestro socio tiene 32 años de edad, el socio es conviviente y tiene 3 hijas mujeres de 7, 6, 3 años de edad; Nuestro socio se dedica a prestar servicio de moto taxis, el también tiene terrenos cultivados con maíz, papa, habas, su conyugue es ama de casa y también se dedica a la venta de granos secos, ella vende en el mercado de Urcos los granos y ahora quiere vender comida en el mercado, para lo cual Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para su conyugue, con este dinero comprarán algunos ingredientes y ollas y cocinita a primus (utiliza kerosene).  

Nuestro socio valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Carlos belongs to the “Las Amistosas” communal bank. He is a native of the Urcos district in the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco. This is about one hour from the city of Cusco. Carlos is 32 years old, lives with a partner, and has three daughters aged 7, 6, and 3. He is in the moto-taxi business. He also farm land and grows corn, potatoes, and beans. His partner takes care of their home and also sells dry grains in the Urcos market. Now she wants to sell food in the market, so he is requesting this loan so that she can buy some ingredients, pots and a small kerosene stove. Carlos appreciates this loan and promises to complete his payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for his partner to set up a food stand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more hair accessories and firewood to sell

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean D. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 43 years old, married and has two children. To make a living, Mary Jean raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mary Jean has been engaged in her business for over three years already.

In 2007, Mary Jean joined CEVI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. 

Mary Jean is requesting a new loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Mary Jean from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to acquire piglets to fatten.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rasi

texts.en:
In Prolueng Meas village in Prey Veng province lives a person named Mrs. Rasi N.. She is 40 years old. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land on which to cultivate rice to support her family. 

Now her problem is that her field has infertile soil and it is far away from an irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Rasi N. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. Her husband Mr. Lang Sor is a construction worker. With these activities, they support three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the others are students in the local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Mrs. Son O. lives in Trapeang Krasang village in Takeo province. She was born in 1976. She is a mother of three children -- two are in local public school and the third is too young to work or study.

Mrs. Son O. is a farmer who owns two hectares of land where she cultivates rice to sell and support her family. Her husband, Mr. Thou Khun, is a motorbike taxi driver. In order to improve their family’s standard of living, they want to start breeding animals but they do not have enough money.

To achieve this goal Mrs. Son O. is asking for a loan to buy a cow, two pigs for breeding, and pig food. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow, two pigs for breeding, and pig food.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann M. is from the village of Claveria in Misamis Oriental. She is 23 years old and married with 2 infant children. To make a living, Mary Ann owns & operates a specialized retail store selling different kind of vegetables in the local community. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.  Mary Ann has recently joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first HSPFI loan, for 5000 PHP, in order to purchase additional products to sell.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es: Alexis M. J. , tiene la edad de 39 años, está en unión libre, y  tiene 2  hijos, uno de 12 y otro de 7 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado para revenderlos y transportarlos a diferentes lugares o fincas  y así ganarse el flete. Con esto el espera  obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Alexis  tiene algunos años dedicada al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Alexis M. J. is 39 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children (ages 12 and 7). This loan will be used to buy livestock for resale. He transports them to different places and farms that want to build up a herd. Alexis hopes to earn the highest income possible when selling the animals. He also wants to increase the number of animals he has and be able to raise them in the best conditions. Alexis has an ideal area that is suitable for maintaining them.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the services that have been provided. Don Alexis has several years of experience raising livestock. He hopes in the future to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater financial stability. In addition, he hopes to continue growing as a person and as producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock for resale

loans.name: Riverlee Sisters Group

texts.en:
Dekontee M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Riverlee Sisters. She is 40 years old, is married, and has five children who range from 3 to 23 years old.  She also cares for one sibling. Dekontee was only able to attend school through 5th grade due to lack of financial support.

For 20 years, Dekontee has been selling soft drinks on Broad Street, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 44,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more crates of soft drinks to sell.

Dekontee describes herself as an earnest woman. Her dream is to grow her business, build a house, and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Leny Lilibeth

texts.en:
Leny Lilibeth E. is a married woman who lives in Dolores/Lipas St., Brgy. San Pedro, Puerto Princesa City, Palawan. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: hog fattening and a tricycle operator business. Her husband, Wilton E., who is 47 years old, works as a bank security guard to earn his living. They have four children who range from seven to 19 years old. 

Leny Lilibeth joined NWTF - Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF - Project Dungganon, Leny Lilibeth has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 21,500, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 which she intends to use for the purchase of pig food so she can continue to save up for her family's future and her children's education. Leny Lilibeth is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase pig food

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson, who is 40 years old, married and the father of one child, operates a cafeteria as well as a key cutting business.  A hardworking man, he is also an electrician.  In his business, Wilson employs two people. He is now requesting a loan of 60,000 Kes to buy a gas cooker and a refrigerator.  He hopes to build flats in the future so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a gas cooker and a refrigerator

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida L. is from the village of Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. She is 40 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Aida runs a grocery store. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Aida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida is requesting her first loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her existing business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more dozens of lappas ( a traditional dress for women)

loans.name: Chuluuntsetseg

texts.en: Chuluuntsetseg C. is a 52-year-old widow who lives with her son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her son live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. Her son works as an engineer at the Ulaanbaatar Institute. Chuluuntsetseg has a business purchasing vegetables from wholesale traders and selling them in a rented stall in the basement of Gam trade center. In 2005, she started selling a variety of vegetables by renting a stall at the vegetable trading section of Narantuul, the main market in the city, and has gained significant experience in her business. Chuluuntsetseg is requesting a 900,000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve more vegetables for her business in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase and preserve more vegetables

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Mr. Pech H. is a villager in Kandal village in Kandal province and he is 56-years-old. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family and his wife.  Mrs. Yorng Choeung, is a pig breeder and white wine maker. His problem is that his wife’s pigs are too small to sell, but he did not have enough money to support them. So to improve the breeding, Mr. Pech H. is applying for a loan to buy more pig food. He is a father of five children, one of whom is a car repairer, another is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the other one is a farmer, and the others are attending a local school. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy more pig food.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi B. is from the village of Bitibut Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old and is single. Noemi owns & operates a pig raising business. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Noemi joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise & sell

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “SR. DE TAYANCANI”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Florencio; El socio es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos, el socio es maestro constructor, el trabaja en todo tipo de obras de construcción y en el pueblo generalmente lo buscan para este tipo de trabajos, el socio todos los domingos  apoya a su economía alternando con el servicio de trici taxi (son unas carretas sin techo acondicionadas a las motos). El socio trabaja solo los días domingos para aumentar la semana. El socio desea el préstamo para invertir en su hogar en la compra de productos básicos para el hogar lo cual el los ira pagando con su trabajo. El socio solicita el préstamo para uso personal.  

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Florencio is a member of the “Sr. de Tayancani” community bank which is located in Ocongate district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Florencio lives with his common-law wife and has 6 children.  He is a master builder and works on all kinds of construction jobs.  In his town they generally seek him out for this type of work.  Every Sunday he supports his family's finances by also providing a service in his 'trici taxi' (a cart without roof which is attached to the back of a motorbike).  He works Sundays to supplement his week's work.  He would like this loan to invest in his home by buying basic products which he will pay for through his work.  He is requesting the loan for personal use.

He is grateful for the loan and appreciates it.  He pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy basic products for his household

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en:
Josiane is 32 years old, married and has five children. Currently, four of her children go to school. Josiane has a motorcycle that she rents out for transportation, which she has been doing for 11 years.  Her husband is a driver. 

Josiane will use this loan to purchase more motorcycles.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Josiane plans to buy a vehicle. In the future she would like to have a enough profits to own many more vehicles.

loans.use: To buy more than two motorcycles for transportation.

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Uranchimeg D. is 51 years old and lives with her husband in Hovd province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. All of their children live on their own. Uranchimeg's husband is retired and works as a guard for a local company, earning a monthly salary of 150,000 MNT. Uranchimeg operates a fuel trading business in her town. She collects dry droppings of cattle (for fuel) from the rural areas and sells those droppings at the local market once a week. Uranchimeg is a talkative and hardworking person. She needs more funds to rent a car in order to transport her products to the local market. She is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to rent a car for her business.

loans.use: to rent a car for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric and other items.

loans.name: Horloo

texts.en:
Horloo, 37, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is currently unemployed and her two children attend local secondary school. 

Horloo graduated from college as a designer and she started her sewing business after her graduation. She operates a sewing service at a local trading center. She makes various types of clothing including traditional and modern. She is popular in her area as she has been operating her business for about eight years and she has her regular customers. She is a reliable customer of our bank. 

Horloo says, " I am trying to expand my business in order to save for my children's future studies and open my own workshop where I could train my students." She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to buy necessary materials for her sewing business.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is the father of two daughters and two sons. He is an employee. He lives in his parents' house, since they passed away and left the house to him. The house is relatively small; therefore, Mustafa took out a loan from FATEN to build an additional room for the girls. The additional room will help the family have a more organized house and give privacy for the girls.

Mustafa appears in the photo in FATEN's branch in Ramallah.

loans.use: To build an additional room for the children

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: N. is currently in the business of selling food in a hotel. She is 40 years old, a widow and has 3 children, none of whom go to school. N. is requesting a loan to increase her stock of food to sell in the hotel. She hopes to build a house with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell in a hotel

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is married with two sons. He is a farming entrepreneur from Kamenka, which is a predominantly agricultural region of the Ukraine. Andrei runs 10 big greenhouses and a separate one for seedlings. He started this enterprise 15 years ago. He has already invested about 150,000 Grivnyas in the trade. 

Andrei is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase black plastic film to be spread on the ground, to finish installation of a heating system and construct a drip irrigation unit. Polyethylene film expenses will amount to 10,000 Grivnyas. Costs related to installation of a heating system amount to 3,000 Grivnyas. Installation of an irrigation unit costs about 2,000 Grivnyas. Greenhouse business has a huge potential in this region of Ukraine, which is why Andrei pins great hopes on further development of his venture.

loans.use: to purchase plastic film, and install heating and irrigation systems

loans.name: Jhonny Javier

texts.es:
Jhonny de 21 años, joven emprendedor que inicio su labor cuando se graduó un día su papa le compro una tricimoto para que trabaje en el entonces realizo un préstamo en d-miro y se compro su propia tricimoto.

Ahora el labora solo diariamente para solventar sus gastos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción para adecuar su cuanto y la de su mama y vivir tranquilo como familia.
texts.en:
Jhonny, 21, is a young entrepreneur who started working when he graduated and his father bought him a three-wheel vehicle to work with.  He then took out a loan with D-Miro and bought his own three-wheeled vehicle. He now works just to meet his own expenses.  

He wants to use the loan to buy building materials and supplies to equip his and his mother’s room and live in peace as a family.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina D. is from the village of Gango, Ozamis City. She is 39 years old. Ludivina is married and has two adult and two school-aged children. Ludivina runs her own sari-sari (variety) store and vegetable selling business. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2008, Ludivina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Ludivina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Ludivina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en:
Altangerel is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house in Songino-hairhan district, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His two children, age eight and 11, both attend local secondary school. 

He manages a coal and wood trading business at a local market called Hangai. He started his business in 2001 and gained much experience. Through years of business operation he managed to stabilize his business and is planning to continue it. He is an honest man who says, "I am happy to have consistent earnings by operating my business." He is requesting a 1,500,000 Mongolian tugrik (MNT) loan to buy more coal and firewood for his business sales.

loans.use: to buy more coal and firewood

loans.name: Yulissa Natali

texts.es:
Natali es una joven de 23 años de  edad, ella  vive en casa de su madre junto con su menor hija que esta en edad escolar. Esta familia vive en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz en Chiclayo. Esta es una comunidad en vías de crecimiento y  principalmente es zona de comerciantes.

Natali se dedica a la venta de repuestos de moto, los cuales distribuye a tiendas conocidas de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Y a pesar de llevar 8 meses en este negocio, le ha generado buenos ingresos. Adicionalmente Natali obtiene ganancias por la venta de refrigerios que realiza los fines de semana.

Natali ha logrado ahorrar dinero que  le ha permitido darle comodidades al hogar de su madre. Ahora Natali desea comprar artefactos electrodomésticos para su casa y es por ello que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de  800 nuevos soles que le permitirá completar sus ahorros para realizar dichas compras.

Natali es una hija y madre bondadosa que lo único que desea es darle comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Natali is a young woman of 23 who lives in her mother's home together with her school-age daughter.  The family lives in José Leonardo Ortíz district, in Chiclayo.  This is a developing community and is mainly a commercial area.

Natali sells motorcycle spare parts which she delivers to well-known stores in the city of Chiclayo.  In spite of the fact that she has only been in this business for eight months, it has made her good profits.  Natali also makes money selling light refreshments on a weekend.

Natali has managed to save some money which has allowed her to provide her mother's home with some comforts.  Now she would like to buy some electrical appliances for her home.
