For this reason, she has requested a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will be able to add to her savings in order to make these purchases.

Natali is a kind-hearted daughter and mother and the only thing she wants is to provide her family with some comfort.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances for her home

loans.name: Yamilet Del Rosario

texts.es: Yamilet Del Rosario tiene 31años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Inicio esta actividad por la sugerencia de una tía que le enseño a sufragar los ingresos de su hogar y mantener a su familia. El objetivo del financiamiento es para la compra de calzado, cosméticos, perfumes, cremas, toallas y sabanas. Sueña con agrandar su inventario.
texts.en: Yamilet Del Rosario is 31 years old, and has sold general merchandize for over 6 years. She has 2 children who are underage and under her care. Yamilet Del Rosario began her work because of her aunt’s advice who taught her to manage her household income to support her family. She will use the loan to buy shoes, makeup, perfumes, creams, towels and sheets. Yamilet Del Rosario dreams of increasing her inventory.

loans.use: buy shoes, makeup, perfumes, creams, towels and sheets.

loans.name: Jade

texts.en:
Jade is 52 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquita city, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with 2 children.

Jade works as a fisherman, he and his wife helping each other. Jade catches fish and his wife delivers fish to the market. Jade has been doing this kind of work for 20 years. He earns PHP 3,500.00 per month. Jade wanted to buy an additional fishing net to double his catch every day. Jade requested a loan at GDMPC PHP 5,000.00 to buy fishing materials.

Jade has been a member of GDMPC for  one year. In the future, Jade hopes that he will be a member in good standing in GDMPC and that he can buy additional fishing boat.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima sells waakye (a classic Ghanaian rice and beans dish) at Abura. She serves the waakye with fried fish, chicken and eggs. She has received junior high education.  She is married and has two children. Her partner is a tailor. 

Alima has been in this trade for five years. She assists her husband in the education of her children. Her loan will be used to buy rice and beans to cook to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a restaurant. In this picture she is seen frying the fish she uses to serve waakye.

loans.use: to buy rice and beans to cook to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA GENERACION III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 46 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de molinera, el prepara harinas y cereales de trigo,cebada,maíz y moraya ,el vende las harinas al por mayor y ofrece a las diferentes tiendas que vende los cereales y también en forma independiente, el trabaja juntamente con su esposa ya que ella se ocupa a  realizar las cobranzas del negocio de venta de harina, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de cereales y harinas. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su molinera y para comprar trigo, cebada y maíz.
                                                
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Nueva Generación III” (New Generation III) communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.

He is 46 years old, married and has three children.  He alternates his daily chores with a milling business.  He makes flour and cereals from wheat, barley, corn and dehydrated, freeze dried potato.  He sells the flour at wholesale to various stores that sell cereals and also independently.  He works alongside his wife since she does the bill collecting for the flour selling business.  He wants to expand the business of selling cereals and flour.  He is asking for the loan to service his mill and to buy wheat, barley and corn.

He is happy with the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to service his mill and also to buy wheat, barley and corn.

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Sreypov is a nail decorator. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Their income is $8 per day. She has one child who is one year old.  Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy little fishes to raise and sell. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for a long time (since before they were married).  He has always wanted to change to another career but he didn’t know what a good career would be for him. He had talked to his wife, and they found that feeding fishes is one good career that he can do.  He hopes he can make a good income from his new career.

loans.use: To buy young fish for fish farming

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia de 47 años tiene 9 hijos,ella se dedica al cultivo de tomates desde hace 5 años ella nos cuenta que es Gracias a Dios le a ido bien en su negocio,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas y abono para el cultivo,ella nos cuenta que su sueño es agrandar su siembra ya que las temporadas le han quedado bien,y se a producido en cantidades grandes.
texts.en:
Alicia is 47 years old and has nine children. She has been cultivating tomatoes for five years. Alicia says that she has done well in her business, thanks to God. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and compost for her crop.

Alicia says her dream is to increase her planting because the previous seasons have been good and have yielded large quantities.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and compost.

loans.name: Sokundy

texts.en:
Sokundy and her husband, Samny, both 28 years old (pictured together), live in a village along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have a young son. 

Sokundy is a garment worker and her husband is a fisherman and farmer. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora María dedicada a la venta de productos de primera necesidad  en su tienda de barrio el crédito que solicito actualmente es para el incremento de capital y compra de una heladera grande para conservar todos lo refrescos y  productos que ofrece a sus clientes, este es su segundo crédito con el financiamiento kiva en el primer crédito ella se encontraba embarazada y para este crédito su hijo ya nació, esta es una de las razones mas fuertes para que ella continúe trabajando con mucho mas esmero y dedicación por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
María sells basic household necessities in her neighborhood store, The loan she is applying for now, is to increase her working capital, and to buy a large refrigerator for keeping soft drinks and other products that she sells to her customers.

This is her second loan financed by Kiva.  At the time of her first loan, she was pregnant, and by this loan, her son was already born.  This is one of the strongest reasons why she continued working, with much more effort and determination, for her family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a farmer and a father aged 33. He has one child, aged four. He has been in farming in his hometown of Kitale for five years, with his milk, eggs and produce going to the local market.

Simon has requested for a loan of 52,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional dairy cow will enable him meet his family's daily needs, as well as expand his business to be more reliable in meeting his needs.

Simon notes animal diseases and the high cost of feeds as the challenges in farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Doumit

texts.en:
D. is a 42-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife, four children and two cousins. 

He has owned a mini market since 2009, where he sells different types of food products. 

This will be his second Kiva loan, and we note that he has been a very reliable client with payments on time. 

Today, he is asking to borrow $1,800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new merchandise to increase his sales and therefore his income. In the future, he hopes to enlarge his business operation into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise to increase his sales and therefore his income.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is an industrious person. Though her family is less fortunate, she works hard to provide a good education for her children. She has eight children; five of them attend school and need daily allowances. Together with her husband, she has been engaged in rice farming for almost 10 years. They have a yield twice a year during the months of May and November.

Liezel has insufficient funds to buy herbicides and pesticides (chemicals used to kill unwanted herbs and pests that affect the growth of plants) used in rice farming. She is now asking for a loan of P10,000. 

In the future, Liezel would like to continuously send her children to college to earn a degree for better employment someday.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: Actualmente la socia tiene 35 años de edad, la socia esta en espera de su 5to hijo, ella se encuentra embarazada y feliz por la llegada de su hijo ; la socia ha cambiado totalmente de negocio, ella en la actualidad se encuentra con sus nuevo y propio negocio, la socia se concidera comerciante minorista, la socia compra y vende animale menores, ella compra cuyes, chanchos, aves de corral y los vende ella comenta que cuando compra una gallina a 10 soles ella lo cría engorda y luego viva la vende a 25 soles, entonces ahí esta la ganancia de hacer madurar a las gallinas y es casi igual con los otros animales menores es más rentable los cuyes porque se procrean rápido y aumenta el numero de ellos para la venta. La socia ahora depende solo de su esfuerzo y trabaja arduamente para mejorar sus ganancias y sacar adelnate junto a su conyugue a sus menores hijos y mejorar su vivienda. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores.
texts.en: This group member is 35 years old.  She is currently awaiting the birth of her fifth child. She is pregnant and happy about the arrival of her baby.  She has completely changed her business and now works with a new business.  She works buying and selling small animals, like guinea pigs, pigs, and poultry.  She shared that when she buys a hen for 10 soles she can fatten it and later sell it for 25 soles.  That is how the profits work with hens, and it is almost the same with the other animals, although guinea pigs are more profitable because they procreate quickly and then she has more to sell.  She is dependent on her own labor and works very hard to increase her earnings and, together with her husband, help her young children and improve their home.  She is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of young animals.

loans.use: buy young animals to raise

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 38 years old and lives in West Point. She is single and has two children aged 15 to 12 years old, two of whom are presently in school and live at home. For the past six years, she has been selling bread in her community. She makes a lot of profit and has more customers since she is the only person who sells short bread, sweet bread, and coconut bread in her community. She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, butter, and oil  for her business. Her plan is to become an international business woman in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase more flour, sugar, butter, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Lejani

texts.en:
This is Lejani, 33, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Rony, a carpenter. She has one child. With her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Lejani owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, and sugar: primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors in the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more grocery items, which will enable her to have more inventory on hand. The more items displayed at the store, the better. It helps to attract more customers to buy in her variety store. More sales will result in more profit. It will help her to save more money for the expenses of her child in school. 

Lejani hopes that her business will continue to generate an income that is sufficient enough for the needs of her family. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps to learn a lot from the Bible. It strengthens her spiritual life.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for inventory

loans.name: Habsamet

texts.en: Habsamet is 51 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in a ger (traditional Mongolian hut) in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife is employed and his son is a college student. He started his taxi service business in 2008 with his own car. He is a well experienced driver. Now that his car is old, he is unable to run his business. He is requesting a loan of MNT 1,800,000 to buy new parts for his car. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "It has been horrible since my car got broken apart. I have to fix my car in order to pay my son's college tuition."

loans.use: To buy new parts for his car

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: La señora Felicidad es una cliente antigua aproximadamente trabaja con la institución hace  4 años, pertenecía al Banco de emprendimiento Agua de Vida, actualmente trabaja en la venta de productos de ropa de temporada, es decir vende blusas poleras, ropas de bebé, chompas, camisetas, polares en época de invierno, el préstamo le servirá para viajar hasta la localidad del Desaguadero y comprar al por mayor de poleras, blusas y por esta temporada que esta cerca  la navidad también tiene pensado dedicarse al negocio de juguetes. La Sra. Felicidad,  vive con una de sus hijas que se encuentra en la casa, y ella colabora con la atención  y mantención de sus 2 nietos. Aumentando su capital tiene pensado el ahorrar para su anticrético y darles más comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Felicidad is a long-standing client who has been working with the institution for approximately four years. She belonged to the "Agua de Vida" communal bank.

Now she sells seasonal clothing; that is to say, she sells blouses, skirts, baby's clothing, sweaters, T-shirts, and fleeces in the wintertime. 

She will use the loan to travel to the town of Desaguadero to buy skirts and blouses at wholesale. Because it's close to Christmas, she has also thought about selling toys. 

Felicidad lives with one of her daughters who is at home, and she helps support and look after her two grandchildren. 

In increasing her working capital, she has thought of saving for her anticrético (rental contract where the renter pays the landlord a fixed sum), to provide more home comforts for her family.

loans.use: To buy clothing, such as blouses, and sweaters.

loans.name: Suhey Del Socorro

texts.es:
Suhey, de 33 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Granada, madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, ella es comerciante, vender ropa y zapato lleva tres años con este negocio. Inicio con esta actividad con apoyo de su madre quien la apoyo a ella al quedar embarazada necesita tener un negocio que le permitiera generar ingresos para criar a su pequeño hijo. Fue entonces que se fue a vender con su madre al mercado ropa y zapatos es así como se gana al alimento diario para ella y su familia.   
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar ropa y zapatos para vender durante la época navideña donde la afluencia de clientes es muy constante durante esta época del año y ella no quiere perder la oportunidad de vender.  Pues una de sus metas es lograr comprar una casa para que su hijo tenga un techo digno en donde vivir.
texts.en:
Suhey, 33, lives in the city of Granada.  She’s a single mother of a three-year-old son.  She’s a merchant.  She sells clothes and shoes and has been in business three years.  She started out with this activity with help from her mother who supported her when she became pregnant and needed to have a business that would make it possible for her to earn income to raise her small son.  It was then that she went to sell clothes and shoes in the market with her mother and this is how she earns her and her family’s daily food.

She requests the loan to buy clothes and shoes to sell during the Christmas season when customer abundance is very constant during this time of the year and she does not want to waste this opportunity to sell because one of her goals is to manage to buy a house so that her son will have a proper roof over his head.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Carmen Lucciola

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Banquito.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, uno de ellos ya es mayor de edad y dos de 16 y 5 años que  estudia en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella  es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar realiza el crédito para que él pueda financiar su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de granos como frejol, lentejas, maní, entre otros, trabaja cuatro días de la semana en el mercado de Manta,  lleva 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que gracias a Dios esto le ha dado para salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar lentejas, frejol, maní, maíz, entre otros. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito.
 
Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir adelante.

En la fotografía está la socia con su hijo.
texts.en:
Los Bajos de Montecristi is a city known for its great diversity of traditional products. These include toquilla straw hats (also known as Panama hats), which are famous both inside and outside the country. The members of the Mi Banquito communal bank in that city meet every 15 days. 

Here we meet Mrs. Carmen, 46, who is married and has three children, one of whom is an adult and the other two, 16 and 5, are in school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a very good homemaker who wants to help her husband with the household expenses by taking out a loan to finance his business.  He sells grains such as beans, lentils, peanuts, etc., working four days a week at the market in Manta.  He has been in business for 15 years and thankfully it is going well and allowing them to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy lentils, beans, peanuts, and corn, among other things.  She is a founding member of the communal bank which she enjoys because the institution's interest rate is lower than anywhere else.

Her dream is to have good health and continue striving to get ahead.

In the photograph she appears with her son.

loans.use: To buy lentils, beans, peanuts, corn, etc.

loans.name: Rolando Elias

texts.es:
Rolando, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo ya que quiere surtir el negocio comprando más mercadería, pues su idea es ofrecer a los clientes Cd y Dvd con un contenido navideño, también comprar material (tela) para la elaboración de trapeadores esto le ayudará para mejorar su capacidad frente a los clientes.
El considera que a través de una buena administración los negocios pueden mejorar y en su caso a través de estos préstamos está obteniendo una mejor ganancia y crecimiento.
texts.en:
Rolando would like a new loan, as he wants to stock up for his business and buy more merchandise.  His idea is to offer his customers Christmas-themed CDs and DVDs.  In addition, he will buy more fabric to make mops.  This will help him improve his ability in front of his clients.

He believes that, through good management, businesses can improve.  In his case, through this loan, he will be obtaining better earnings and growth.

loans.use: To buy CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Eutropia Teodosia

texts.es: Eutropia es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy, es feriante de ropas al interior de Ayacucho, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 10 años, gracias a Finca pudo progresar en su negocio y ser mejor madre, su carácter cambió mucho todo esto es gracias a las capacitaciones que recibió, lo que mas le gusta de Finca es que puede ahorrar, y solo le dan préstamo, sino que la educan en los préstamos que saca, en como invertiros y hacer crecer su negocio. Ahora con  el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para los carnavales.
texts.en:
Eutropia is a member of the communal bank Kusikuy. She sells clothing in the provinces of Ayacucho. 

She has been a member of Finca Peru for ten years and thanks to Finka she could progress in her business and become a better mother. Her character has changed a lot and all this is thanks to the training she received. 

What she likes most about Finca is that she can save, not only get a loan, but receive training about the loans that she gets to invest and to make her business grow. 

Now with this loan she will invest in the purchase of clothing for the festivals.

loans.use: to buy clothing for the festivals

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 45 years old, married and has 6 children. She sells bananas to earn a living.  She has been in the business for 7 years and has employed two people. To earn extra income, she does maize farming. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Veronica has been able to educate her children and she hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy bananas to sell.

loans.use: buy bananas

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es un mujer de 58 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su esposo y sus hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo desde muy joven de trabajar, Rosa no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver novelas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rosa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella vende diversos platos típicos de su ciudad, como tamales, papas rellenas y otros, Rosa trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de insumos, como arroz, azúcar, papas, condimentos y otros, adicionalmente comprará utensilios de cocina para acondicionar su negocio, así pues Rosa seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Rosa is a woman of 58. She lives in the city of Chincha with her husband and their children, whom she loves and who are her principal focus in life. She is a very kind person, hard-working and enthusiastic, who together with her husband dedicates all her efforts to advance her family. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources and because of the need to work since she was very young, Rosa was not able to study for a professional career in education, but she very much would have liked to do it. In her free time she likes to watch soap operas, and sometimes she cooks a very delicious rice with duck to share with her family.

On her own initiative, with much effort and dedication, Rosa works in her little business of selling food. She sells a variety of typical dishes of her city, such as tamales, stuffed potatoes, and others. Rosa works every day for approximately 10 hours and believes that it is going well for her because of her good flavorings and because of the friendly treatment that she offers her customers.

Rosa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered she will be able to make the purchase of a larger quantity of ingredients, such as rice, sugar, potatoes, condiments, and other items. In addition, she will buy cooking utensils to outfit her business. Thus Rosa will continue working and striving to achieve her great dream of having a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the food she prepares

loans.name: Sr. De Ccoyllority Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR. DE CCOYLLORITY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yrene Concepcion ella es soltera y tiene 50 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de queso,leche y mantequilla, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de queso. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar queso leche y mantequilla.

Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pideron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de hotel, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de hotel.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “SR. DE CCOYLLORITY” communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department, Peru.

Yrene Concepcion is a member of the group. She is 50 years old and single. She has a business selling cheese, milk, and butter. She works from 8 AM until 6 PM. She has had this business for many years and it is going very well. She dreams of expanding her cheese selling business. She seeks a loan to buy cheese, milk, and butter.

The members inserted in the photo had their photo taken after the meeting because they received permission to arrive late because of work. The other members in the group have the following businesses: hotel business, selling clothing, grocery store, hotel business.

loans.use: to buy cheese, milk, and butter.

loans.name: Kikumbo Mixed Farmers S&c Group

texts.en: Jennifer will use the requested loan to buy drugs to sell. She owns a drug shop and has been in business for the last 10 years. The responsibility of looking after her family was the major cause of her involvement in business. Jennifer is a member of Kikumbo mixed group where members guarantee each other to access the loan simply because they don’t offer securities. Group members have supported each other to start up income generating activities and educating their children from good schools. Her business is affected by competition from government hospitals that offer free service on top of bad debtors.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Charlotte A.

texts.en:
A married mother of two (2) children, Ms. Charlotte A. E. cares for the young daughter of one of her older brothers. Her business is the sale of food products. She is a dynamic woman and a fighter who works hard for the success of her children. Her husband is a woodworker with no shop and is obliged to help his friends on construction sites. This does not provide him with consistent income to cover household expenses. It is therefore Ms. E. who supports the majority of the family's needs thanks to her commercial activities. Rigorous in the management of her business, she has demonstrated exemplary promptness in the repayment of her loans. She is looking today to improve her business and is asking for financial support. She is therefore seeking a loan of $850 to increase her product stock levels and improve her revenue, which will result in better living conditions for her family.

Translated from [language] by [your name], Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants, Madame E. A. Charlotte a à sa charge une petite fille d’un de ses grands frères. Elle exerce comme activité la vente des produits alimentaires. C’est une femme combative et dynamique qui travaille avec ardeur pour la réussite de ses enfants. Son mari qui est un menuisier n’a pas d’atelier et est obligé d’aider ses amis sur des chantiers. Ce qui ne lui procure pas un revenu consistant pour couvrir les charges du ménage. C’est donc Madame E. qui supporte la grande partie des besoins de la famille grâce à son commerce. Rigoureuse dans la gestion de son activité, elle a fait preuve d’une promptitude exemplaire dans le remboursement de ses crédits. Elle cherche aujourd’hui à améliorer son activité et demande un appui financier. Elle sollicite pour ce faire un crédit de $850 pour pouvoir augmenter le niveau de stock de ses produits et améliorer son revenu qui se traduira par de meilleures conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Increase stock levels of food products

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria has a 16-year-old son and two daugthers, ages 14 and 11. Sadly in 2003 her husband died, leaving her in charge of the three kids with no means of income. To keep her family together and give the children an education, Maria decided to start a convenience store, and little by little the business has grown. Recently she put in video games at the store. Her son helps her run the business in the mornings before going to school. It has been difficult for this family to deal with the loss of their father and overcome all of the family expenses, but by sticking together and working they have been able to move ahead.

Currently, Maria Victoria needs a loan of $475 to purchase merchandise to expand the product selection at the store and to increase profits. You can help improve this family's quality of life. They need your help and would appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Victoria tiene un hijo D. 16 años D. edad y dos hijas D. 14 y 11. En el año 2003 lamentablemente falleció su esposo, dejándola a cargo D. sus tres hijos, sin ningún tipo D. ayuda económica, por la necesidad D. mantener a su familia y darles educación Maria decidió iniciar con su negocio D. abarrotes y poco a poco ha ido creciendo, recientemente incorporó el servicio D. videojuegos. Su hijo mayor es quien le ayuda en su negocio por las mañanas antes D. irse a la escuela. Ha sido difícil para esta familia sobreponerse a la pérdida D. su padre y sobretodo a superar los gastos, pero con la unión D. la familia y el trabajo D. todos han podido salir adelante.

En estos momentos, Maria Victoria necesita D. un préstamo por la cantidad D. $ 475 dólares que utilizara en la compra D. mercancía con la finalidad D. incrementar la variedad D. productos que ofrece y poder obtener un mayor beneficio. Tú puedes mejorar las condiciones en que se encuentra esta familia, ellos necesitan D. tu ayuda, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: Buy products to sell at the convenience store.

loans.name: Margarita Maria

texts.en:
Margarita is 33 years old, is married, and has one son. Her husband works in the fields cultivating corn. She sells a typical food of the region called tamales, which consist of corn dough filled with a variety of fillings (chicken, vegetables, meat) that is then wrapped in corn leaves. She sells them from her house to people from the community. She represents the “White Rose Group 3”, whose other members are María L. Gomez (grocery store) and Alejandra Aguilar L. (grocery store). With the loan, María and Alejandra want to buy merchandise for their stores, such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, soft drinks, cookies, pastas, and candies, which are the foods that are most requested by their customers. In Margarita’s case, she would like to buy more kitchen equipment, corn, lard, and corn leaves, which are necessary to increase her production of tamales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

MARGARITA TIENE 33 AÑOS CASADA UN HIJO, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA COSECHA DEL MAIZ , ELLA VENDE UNOS ALIMENTOS TIPICOS DE LA REGION LLAMADOS , TAMALES ,QUE SON MASAS DE MAIZ QUE POSEEN DISTINTOS RELLENOS ( POLLO, VERDURAS, CARNES ) Y POSTERIORMENTE SON ENVUELTOS EN HOJAS DE MAIZ, LOS COMERCIALIZA DE CASA EN CASA ENTRE LAS GENTES DE SU COMUNIDAD. ELLA REPRESENTA AL GRUPO BLANCA ROSA 3 QUE ESTA INTEGRADO ADEMAS POR : MARIA L. GOMEZ ( TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) ALEJANDRA AGUILAR L. ( TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) CON EL PRESTAMO MARIA Y ALEJANDRA ESPERAN COMPRAR MAS MERCADERIA PARA SUS TIENDAS COMO ACEITE , AZUCAR, SAL , VREFRESCOS , GALLETAS, PASTAS Y DULCES O SEA LOS ALIMENTOS MAS SOLICITADOS POR SUS CLIENTES . EN EL CASO DE MARGARITA ELLA PIENSA COMPRAR MAS BATERIAS DE COCINA Y MAIZ , MANTECA DE CERDO Y ALIÑOS NECESARIOS PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION DE SUS TAMALES .

loans.use: To buy kitchen equipment and ingredients for making tamales; To buy merchandise for small grocery stores

loans.name: Tersa Macaza

texts.pt:
Teresa Macaza C. is 43 years old. She is married and has 5 children. She lives in the neighborhood of Macaza C., a province of Maputo. She is a seamstress and sells drinks and sodas from her house.

Teresa joined the Fund for the Development of Women program in December 2006. She borrowed 6.000MT as her first loan. She is now on the 3rd stage of the program and plans on borrowing 10.000MT to invest in her business. It hasn't been long enough since Teresa joined the program to see concrete improvement in her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa Macaza C. tem 43 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de 5 filhos. Vive noTeresa Macaza C. Província de Maputo. É modista e também tem uma barraca em casa onde vende bebidas e refrigerantes.

Está no Programa desde Dezembro de 2006, tendo tomado 6.000MT como 1º empréstimo.Vai para o terceiro ciclo e pretende um empréstimo no valor de 10.000MT para aplicar nos dois negócios. Não é ainda notável um desenvolvimento substancial do seu negócio pois está pouco tempo no programa.

loans.use: Increase stock - aumento de stock

loans.name: Vusala

texts.en: Vusala is a widow and she doesn't have a child. This 26-year-old young woman lives in Khachmaz town. She buys foodstuffs (tea, butter, etc.) and then she disburses these foodstuffs wholesale to market. Vusala has been a wholesale merchant for 2 years. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy foodstuffs to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Albertina

texts.en:
Albertina, age 27, owns a photo studio with her husband in downtown Ayacucho, Perú. They provide all types of photographic services and sell every imaginable camera accessory. Film is developed and cameras, batteries, and even movies are sold within their walls. Albertina and her husband have been the sole owners of their studio for almost one year and a half. Before, Albertina was working in various other photo studios in the area and her husband was an employee in the shop they currently own, under different management. When the owner of the studio Albertina’s husband was working in retired, the couple jumped at the opportunity to buy the studio and apply the knowledge they had been gaining over the past several years.

Today, Albertina’s photo studio is a rapidly growing business where she and her husband are busily attending to their many customers. When asked if she has any goals for maximizing the growth of her business, Albertina’s eyes widen and she sighs with an exasperated expression she saying “yes!” The machine currently being used to develop customers’ film is rented, and to own one themselves would be an incredible help, she explains. As well, they still lack the equipment to develop digital pictures. Acquiring such capabilities would allow Albertina and her husband to enter an entirely new market and bring their photo business to the next level.

Everything Abertina and her husband do is with the motivation of supporting their growing family of a seven year-old daughter and baby girl on the way. Being a part of her village bank has allowed them the opportunities needed to grow their business and this is why she says she is so pleased to be involved. She has also learned how to save her money in the bank, a skill that has helped immensely in provision for her family. Albertina is asking for a $400 loan. With this money, she will buy and sell larger quantities of products, the first step on her way to new equipment.

loans.use: To buy and sell larger quantities of products, the first step on her way to new equipment.

loans.name: Khup

texts.en:
Mrs. Khup C., 45, is a mother of five children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.

She and her husband work producing mortars and pestles, earning collectively around $6 a day in revenue. Also, three of their children work producing pestles and mortars, which is the main business of this village.

Mrs. Khup C. hopes to use this loan to purchase more stone and some tools to assist in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stone and some tools to assist in her business.

loans.name: Olida's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Olida, age 34, is single and runs a small timber business. She started this work in 2004 and now makes a monthly profit of about $73 from the sales. Her day consists of selling timber from 6am to 8pm.

In the past, Olida successfully took out a loan to buy more timber. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with her subgroup, who also have timber businesses in her neighborhood.

loans.use: To buy more timber stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of pants and beauty products

loans.name: Mashari Fahari Yetu Group

texts.en:
Mashari H. R., age 27, is single and has two children (ages 4 and 1). She has a pharmacy which she began 4 years ago. She works from 8.30 am to 9pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about US$173.

In the past, Mashari has taken out one previous loan with Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more medicine. She hopes for a new loan to increase the size of her business and to start selling cosmetics. Mashari will share this loan with her subgroup members dealing in selling pharmacy, clothes and cosmetics.

In the picture Mashari is 2nd from left in a green blouse

loans.use: To buy a larger stock of medicine and start selling cosmetics

loans.name: Rosa Alpina

texts.es:
Rosa Alpina’s business is the sale of prepared meals (fritanga) from her home in the municipality of Somotillo in Chinandega. She puts great effort into her business and is open in the evenings, when she sells her delicious dishes to the general public who visits her.

Rosa is a married mother and has the advantage of having her daughters support her in the business. However, the necessity she is facing is the urgency to purchase prime materials for the creation of her meals. For this reason, she has turned to Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will enable the purchase of the necessary ingredients to make her dishes. Curently, she is a loyal customer of Ceprodel and for that reason, she is confident that she will receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica la señora Rosa Alpina es a la elaboración y venta de comida (fritanga) en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Somotillo de Chinandega. Se dedica a este negocio con mucho esfuerzo teniendo su horario de atención por las noches donde vende sus deliciosos platillos al público en general que le visita.

Rosa es una madre casada y posee la ventaja de que sus hijas le apoyan en el negocio, sin embargo la necesidad atravesada por ella es la urgencia de la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos. Por ello ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los ingredientes para elaborar los platillos. Actualmente es fiel cliente de Ceprodel y por ello es que confía que su crédito sea otorgado.

loans.use: Purchase the necessary ingredients to make her dishes.

loans.name: Abcd

texts.en: vkkfmf

loans.use: jfjfdjgj

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mrs. Asha B. lives in the village of Bhatkepati. She lives with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband and son. Her husband, Mr. Dinesh B., works in a private office and her son is studying in pre-primary school.

Mrs. B. is a tailor. She opened her tailoring shop two years ago after undergoing four months of training. She prefers to make Nepali ladies' dresses, such as the kurta-sulwar. She is requesting a Rs 10000.00 loan to buy raw material for the dresses.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: El Renacer Group

texts.en:
Argentina C. is a 36-year-old woman who lives with her husband and four children (ages 11, 14, 17, and 18) in a small community called Quisquella Verde in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. She began a small business selling undergarments earlier this year and continues to increase her inventory with each loan. Argentina travels by bus from town to town selling her products to people in the small communities in the countryside as many of these rural people do not have the means to travel to town to do their shopping. She has started this business so that she can provide her children with a good education and a comfortable home. In Argentina’s free time, she enjoys going to church and spending time with her family.

Argentina is the leader of the 5-person micro-bank group, Renacer. In English, this means ´rebirth`. These unique Dominican entrepreneurs have united in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would never be able to receive on their own.

On behalf of Argentina, the Renacer group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support of this micro-loan!

loans.use: To buy various undergarments for re-sale

loans.name: Inés

texts.es:
Ines R. is a single mother of 3 kids, 2 of whom work and support her financially, while the youngest is studying in primary school. She is 46 years old and lives in the neighborhood Villa Venezuela where she has a small grocery store in her house. She has had this business for 16 years and this means she has a lot of clients, all neighbors of hers form where she lives. The demand from her clients grows each day, and this is why she sees the need to invest in her business and to stock it with the necessary products. The loan she has asked for is to buy dairy products and bread as these are everyday products that she sells most of. Her plan is to keep working so she can support her son in his studies and to make him a professional in society.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Inés R. es madre soltera de 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 están trabajando y la apoyan económicamente, el menor de ello está estudiando la educación primaria. Tiene 46 años, habita en el barrio Villa Venezuela, donde tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación. Tiene 16 años de tener este negocio, lo cual le ha permitido hacerse de una cantidad considerable de clientes, todos ellos vecinos de la zona donde habita. La demanda de productos de sus vecinos crece día a día, es por eso que ella se ha visto en la necesidad de invertir en su negocio para abastecerlo de los productos necesarios. El préstamo solicitado es para compra de productos lácteos y de panadería ya que por ser de consumo diario necesita tener mayor inventario de éstos. Sus planes son contar siempre trabajo para seguir apoyando a su hijo en los estudios y formar un profesional para la sociedad

loans.use: To buy dairy products and bread/Compra de productos lácteos y panadería

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva comercializa víveres (azúcar, arroz y aceite) y pequeños artefactos (garrafas, ollas, vasos) a plazo de dos a tres meses con cobros diarios, su esposo trabaja en la Republica de Argentina de costurero. La pareja tiene dos hijos (uno tiene  un año, el otro tres). Eva  vine con su madre y paga el anticrético (especie de alquiler) de una casa ubicada en la Zona Rió Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito será destinado para incrementar su capital de operaciones.
 
Es su tercer crédito en Impro, su buen comportamiento de pago permite la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Eva sells provisions (sugar, rice and oil) and small items (pitchers, pots, glasses) on two to three month installment plans with daily collections. Her husband works in Argentina as a tailor. The couple has two children (one is one year old and the other is three years old). Eva lives with her mother and pays the lease/security deposit (a type of rent) for a home located in the Rió Seco zone of El Alto city. The loan will be used to increase her operating capital. This is her third loan with Impro, her good payment history qualifies her for the current loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital to purchase products

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.ru: Ризоева Зайнаб живет в районе Файзабад. Замужем , имеет четверых красивых детей. Сама работает в средней школе кишлака. Кроме этого занимается животноводством. Хочет получитьь кредит и купить молодого теленка. Откормив его она сможет выгодно продать. Это принесет ей доход. Кроме того позволит увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев
texts.en:
Zaynab R. lives in the Faizabad region. She is married and has four beautiful children. She works in a secondary school in the village. Besides this job she also does animal husbandry. She wants to receive a loan to buy a young calf. By feeding him for a while she can later resell it for more. This will bring her good profit and also help increase the headcount of her cattle. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga lives with her mother and sister.  She owns a small booth at the central market and sells women’s clothing - terry cloth robes. Due to good marketing strategy – reasonable mark-up and renewed assortment– she is able to attract many clients. Her gross revenue is about 13,000 UAH per month. The income is about 2,000 UAH. 

Olga has been working in this business for 12 years. At that time she just could not find any other job. Being very responsible and honest person she was able to start and develop this business to provide for herself, her mother and her sister. 
 
Olga would like to get a loan for 5,000 UAH to buy more terry cloth robes and increase the sales. She hopes that increased sales activity will generate the funds they need to fix their house.

loans.use: purchase more goods

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Jesusa is a member of the Morenita Huamanga Village Bank. She is 53 years old and is married, with four children. She has a stand at the April 12th Market, where she sells dry goods and ground spices that she prepares herself very early in the morning. She is requesting a loan to buy rice and sugar. Her dreams are to educate her children so that they graduate with professional degrees and to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Juana Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Roxana es socia del Banco Comunal “Dante Nava” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 3 hijos.
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró abarrotes y cerveza para vender en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que su negocio ha mejorado.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mayor cantidad abarrotes. 
Juana desea continuar trabajando para tener una bodega.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the "Dante Nava" community bank in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 40 years old, single, and the mother of 3 children. With her first loan of 300 soles, she purchased groceries and beer to sell. She has been working with the community bank for almost 3 years and tells us that her business has improvement. With this loan of 2,000 soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy larger quantities of groceries. Juana wishes to continue working in order to have a proper store.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Luzdina

texts.es: Luzdina tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos que están en edad escolar. La casa donde habitan es propia. Se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco y salado en un puesto del mercado. Se levanta muy temprano, a las 2.00am, para comprar en el puerto el pescado que traen los pescadores, luego de esto lo vende en el mercado hasta las 10:00am. Luzdina cuenta con una gama de clientes que consumen sus pescados y constantemente visitan su puesto, está satisfecha con su trabajo porque cada día termina de vender todo el pescado que lleva, recuperando su inversión y obteniendo buenas ganancias. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a construir un kiosco para vender más tranquila y protegerse de la lluvia.
texts.en:
Luzdina is 38 years old. She lives with her husband and their four children who are of school age. The house where they live is their own. She works selling fresh and salted fish in a stall at the market. She gets up very early, at 2 am, to buy in the fish store where the fishermen bring the fish. Later she sells this in the market until 10 am. Luzdina has a number of clients who eat her fish and continually visit her stall. She is happy with her work because each day she finishes selling all the fish she brings, recovering her investment and getting a good profit. This is her first loan with MFP, and with the money that she is asking for she wants to order the construction of a kiosk to sell more peacefully and to protect her from the rain.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk for Luzdina's fish sales

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La señora Basilia es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Blanca” centro poblado D. Chijichaya, distrito D. Ilave, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 54 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (segundo D. primaria). 
Ella es socia nueva con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos tiene un negocio D. compra y venta D. chuño y tunta, con este D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo pagará en 03 cuotas mensuales; podrá incrementar su mercadería y convertirse en distribuidora mayorista D. este producto. Sus ganancias las piensa invertir en incrementar su capital y ayudar en la educación D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Basilia is an associate of Banco Comunal “Ciudad Blanca” (White City) of the village Chijichaya, in the key district Provincia Del Collao, in the State of Puno. She is 54 years old, married, has 4 children, and is educated until her second year of primary school. She is a new associate with the “Movimiento Manuela Ramos.” She has a business in which she buys and sells chuño y tunta, which is a freeze dried potato dish culturally associated with the Quechua. With this loan of 500 soles, which she will pay in 3 monthly quotas, she will be able to increase the amount of merchandise she can offer, and convert to being a major distributor of this product. She thinks she will invest her earnings in increasing her capital stock and supporting the education of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount of merchandise she may offer, and become a leading distributor of her product.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
With her desire to increase the family income, Sheryl M. decided to start up a business. She is 25 years old and is presently residing at Balite, Sagay, Camiguin Province. Sheryl is a single parent and has 1 child to feed. She is very proud to be an entrepreneur in their village; she used to sell dried fish and dried squid. As of the moment, Sheryl buys and sells other products, because she doesn't have enough capital for this kind of business.

Now, she needs an additional capital amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase boxes of dried fish and squid and also to buy fresh fish. With the profit, Sheryl is planning to enroll in the Social Security System; for her family's health and security.

loans.use: to purchase  dried fish and squid for re-sale

loans.name: Las Crucitas 0200082-10 Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Las Crucitas son originarios de la comarca del mismo nombre, tienen varios ciclos de trabajar con Adim porque sienten que es una institución que ha confiado en ellos, expresan que se sienten como parte de la familia de Adim.

Sebastiana del Rosario V. G. es la coordinadora de este grupo, ella tiene una pulpería en la comarca, esta ha venido creciendo con los diferentes prestamos que se le han otorgado, expresa que ella ha visto como en cada préstamo le va quedando mejoras en el negocio y mayor inventario.
Esta señora tiene un niño a cargo, él tiene una discapacidad, ella lo cuida y compra sus medicinas, el tener su negocio en su casa le favorece porque tiene su propio empleo y puede cuidar a su hijo, su marido le ayuda con los gastos pero ella se siente bien siendo dueña de su negocio.
Todo lo que ha logrado le anima a seguir trabajando y quedando bien en Adim, esto se lo hace saber a su grupo y por eso se encarga de ir a dejar el abono para garantizar la puntualidad.
texts.en:
The Las Crucitas group are from the region known by the same name. they have worked with Adim for several cycles, and they feel that the institution has shown trust in them. According to them, they feel like part of the Adim family. Sebastiana del Rosario V. Gaitan is the group coordinator. She has a small store in the area, which has grown with each new loan that she has received. She says that she has seen her business improve with each loan and with greater investment. She has a child in her care who has a disability. She cares for him and purchases his medicine. By having her business in her home she is able to be self employed and care for her child. Her husband helps her with the expenses, but she feels good being the owner of her own business. She is encouraged to keep working and to keep caring for Adim when she thinks of all that she has achieved. She shares this with her group and for this reason she is charged with delivering the payment to ensure that it is made on time.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
Primer prestamo:
http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82574
Marivel  es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo. 
Marivel es casada tiene 44 años, tres hijos de 13, 9 y 6 años que están en la escuela estatal.
Marivel hace dos años juntos sus ahorros  alquilo un local, compro una  maquina fotocopiadora  y se puso a trabajar, ella atiende  sola todos los días en su negocio de fotocopiadoras.
Marivel necesita 1000 soles, para invertirlo en su negocio y comprar más hojas, tintas para fotocopiadoras.
Desde que está en Finca ha aprendido a invertir su dinero, le gustan las reuniones del Bancomunal y tiene amigas.  
El sueño de Marivel es tener un local propio para su negocio de fotocopias.
texts.en:
Marivel's first loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82574

Marivel is a member of the Communal Bank El Triunfo ("Triumph"). Marivel is married and 44 years old. Her three children are 13, 9, and 6, and they are in public school. Two years ago, Marivel put together her savings and rented a space, bought a photocopy machine and started to work. She alone tends to her copy store every day.

Marival needs 1000 Peruvian nuevo soles to invest in her business and buy more paper and ink for the machines. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned to invest her money. She likes her Communal Bank and has friends in it. Marivel's dream is to own a space for her copy store.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business and buy more paper and ink for photocopy machines.

loans.name: Karema Group

texts.en: Karema is the group leader of Karema group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for the success of her business. Karema wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. Bebe Zenat wants to take a loan for her son who has a mobile-selling business. Bebe Saieda wants to take a loan for her bakery business. They are all very happy for this opportunity of a loan.

loans.use: for business progress.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
"I started my business using my own capital. I want to make it grow and to be able to establish my own space for my business. The income that I get from duplicating and selling keys, locks and doorknobs is what I use to pay for the schooling of my four children," says Ruben M., 41-year-old entrepreneur from Trinindad Bohol.

He would like to ask for a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy blank keys for replication in his key duplicator business. He also considers looking for some possible income areas to further help his family pay for all their needs.

Through CEVI, Mr. M. has ready-access-credit to support his business. He also receives training and insurance coverage services by joining in the CEVI credit program.

loans.use: To buy blank keys for replication in his key duplicator business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell food items

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes tiene 31 años, la base D. su desarrollo como familia es primordial, ya que su esposo y sobre todo su hijo son sus mayores amores. Por ahora viven en la casa D. su suegra, lo cual es un ahorro mientras consiguen su casa propia. DesD. que contrajo matrimonio tuvo la necesidad D. apoyar a su pareja, quien como comerciante no se daba abasto con los gastos D. la familia. Gracias al apoyo D. su madre pudo adquirir un coche D. comida con el cual sale a vender en la puerta D. su casa todos los días desD. hace 5 años. DesD. entonces, a partir D. las 3 D. la tarD. prepara lo necesario para su venta diaria, luego a las 5 D. la tarD. venD. hasta la media noche, ya que la mayoría D. sus clientes son trabajadores que regresan a sus hogares a altas horas D. la noche con deseos D. degustar algunos platillos en el camino. Esta demanda está creciendo y Lourdes desea aprovecharla instalando un restaurante dentro D. su casa. Microfinanzas PRISMA le ha otorgado 13 créditos a Lourdes y junto a sus compañeras con quienes trabaja en su banco comunal tratan D. que estos créditos sean bien aprovechados en sus negocios y para el desarrollo D. su grupo. Con los 3000 soles que solicita comprará los comestibles necesarios para incrementar la cantidad D. porciones que venD. al día.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 31 years old and loves her husband and son very much – they are the loves of her life. Right now they live in her mother-in-law’s house which helps them save while they try to get their own home. Lourdes has worked to help her husband since she got married because he is a shopkeeper and they cannot cover their household expenses on what he makes. She has sold plates of food from a cart (her mother helped her get) in front of her house for the past five years. She starts preparing everything she will need for her sales at three o’clock in the afternoon and then sells from five until midnight. Most of her clients are workers who are returning home late at night and are hungry for something on the way. Demand is increasing, so Lourdes would like to take advantage of this and start a restaurant in her home. Microfinanzas PRISMA has authorized loan money for Lourdes and her fellow communal bank members who hope to take advantage of this money to develop their businesses and their group. With the 3,000 soles asked for, Lourdes will buy the food necessary to increase the amount of portions she can serve each day.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de comestibles

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil casada y es madre de 02 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en la Parcialidad de Camicachi.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 05 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó  para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado menor.  También comprará cereales para luego ponerlos a la venta.

Su deseo es continuar con us negocio y poder vender por mayor.

A ella le gustan los ahorros los encuentros y las charlas de capacitación.
texts.en:
Verónica belongs to the Manuela de Hoy Community Bank, which is located in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 25, married, and she has two children. She has a high school education. She lives in the Parcialidad de Camicachi. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years. With her first loan of 300 PEN she bought small livestock. She now needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy small livestock. She will also buy grains to sell later. Her wish is to continue with her business and to be able to sell wholesale. She likes the savings, the meetings, and the training talks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small livestock (sheep), and buy grains

loans.name: Bout

texts.en: Bout T., 54, is a widow who lives in the Kampong Cham province with her 27-year-old child, who is a grocery seller with an income of around $5 US per day. To make a living, she has been subsistence farming – producing rice that is just adequate for her family to eat. In light of her country's economic difficulties due to the financial crisis, T. is seeking to increase her income. T. is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase various kinds of groceries to expand her child's business. She believes that this will help raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for a store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 36-year-old married mother of four children, two sons and two daughters. All of her children are still in school. Mary lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana. She works very hard to help her husband provide for their family.  Mary trades in tubers of yam. She buys her goods from nearby towns and sells on a table top at the market square in her community. She has been in business for over 15 years and is requesting a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy tubers of yam in bulk

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng S., 52, buys cows from people who live in rural areas, fattening and then selling them for profit. He normally makes around $6 per day to meet his family’s daily living expenses.  His wife takes care of their seven children, maintains the home, and sells a variety of vegetables in the busy local Pursat Market.  Leng S. is requesting this loan to buy several cows currently available at cheap prices in order to sell them later.

loans.use: To buy several cows to sell later

loans.name: Shale

texts.es:
Shale es una mujer muy responsable, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura, alquila chacras para sembrar papas y arvejas, pues considera que estos productos son muy rentables. Pero es su esposo quien más se dedica a sus cultivos, ya que Shale aprovecha la zona para pastar sus vacas. Y cuando dan leche, logra juntar hasta 18 litros al día, los cuales vende a una vecina que elabora quesos. Es por ello que Shale no puede descuidar a sus vacas, ya que le permiten obtener recursos mientras su esposo se dedica a sus cultivos. Pero durante la temporada de cosecha, deja a sus vacas pastando solas, para que ella pueda apoyar a su esposo en la recolección de las papas.
Este es su octavo préstamo con MFP, donde todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser muy responsable en sus pagos, por lo que se ha ganado el aprecio de los integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos, para su próxima siembra de papas.
texts.en:
Shale is a very responsible woman. She is 39 years old, married, and has 3 children. She is engaged in agriculture, growing potatoes and peas from a rented field. These crops are considered to be very profitable. Her husband is more devoted to cultivating the crops, so she takes advantage of caring for her cows and letting them out to graze. When it is time for them to produce milk, Shale collects up to 18 liters each day and sells it to a neighbor who makes cheese. For this reason, she cannot neglect her cows because they provide her with an income, which leaves her husband responsible for tending to the crops. During the harvest season, she allows her cows to graze alone while she helps her husband gather potatoes.

This is Shale’s eighth loan with MFP. Throughout this time, she has demonstrated that she is very responsible with her payments and has earned the appreciation of the members of her Communal Bank. The money she is requesting will be used to buy chemical fertilizers for her next crop of potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertlizers

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es: Juan Ramón C. V. reside en el departamento de Santa Tecla  en el municipio de La Libertad. Juan vive con sus dos hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad y se encuentran trabajando. Juan tiene una panadería con quince años de experiencia, que le han permitido ganar mucha clientela, en la panadería de Juan solo se elabora pan francés que luego es  distribuido en tiendas de la zona. El crédito que solicita es para comprar materiales que le den la oportunidad de aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Juan Ramón C. V. lives in the Santa Tecla neighborhood in the city of La Libertad. He lives with his two children who are grown and have jobs.

Juan has a bakery, a business he has had for 15 years. In that time, he has gained a large clientele. He makes only French bread, which he distributes to be sold in stores in the area. With this loan, Juan will buy materials that will allow him to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for the bakery

loans.name: Gildanita

texts.en:
Gildanita L. is from the village of P-Rizal, Lugait, Misamis Oriental. She is 52 years old. Gildanita is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Gildanita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Gildanita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gildanita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gildanita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP. These funds will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Gildanita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
Mr. May M. is 38 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He has been operating a workshop next to his house for a long time, providing a service repairing motorbikes and bicycles. He currently makes an income of US$ 4 per day to support his family.

May M. is married to Pheap, 22, who is a good housewife and who makes a living planting a little vegetable patch on her own farmland. May M. is applying for his second loan to buy more vehicle accessories to better meet the needs of his customers.

Note: May M. was busy at his business activities, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy more vehicle accessories to better meet the needs of his customers

loans.name: Hayatullah

texts.en:
This is Hayatullah, son of A. R.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 50 years old and married with six children. He is a hard working man and  owns a small retail shop. 

He would like to take an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to buy the required supplies for his house construction. He is really glad about the process of obtaining loans in Afghanistan and would like to thank the Kiva lenders very much.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk

loans.name: Ana Margie

texts.en:
Ana Margie D. is 29 years old and is from the village of Talinga. She is married to Alfredo and their marriage is blessed with three kids. Her husband (shown in the photo) is a baker and currently operates a small bakery in their house which specializes in the production of hardened bread, popularly known in their locality as "binangkal".

Ana Margie helps her husband in managing their business. She is responsible for the repacking procedures and for some marketing aspects.

Ana Margie has a good credit record and is currently utilizing her second loan from the Cooperative. She started her Cooperative affiliation last year and she manifests a good repayment status.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her miniature bakery

location.town: Sindangan-Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Melchi Susana

texts.es:
la señora Melchi Susana R. P. tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos que estudian y le ayudan en las tareas  de la casa, su esposo es policia preventivo. viven en El Barrio El Centro de la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
 
Melchi se dedica a la comercializacion de productos de plastico para el hogar, como ser platos, vasos, pailas, cestas, palanganas, tasas, etc. 
tambien vende lacteos los fines de semana como ser: mantequilla, queso, quesillo. 
 
este negocio lo realiza desde hace 11 años tiene casa propia y vende su productos a los vecinos de la comunidad en donde vive. 
esta solicitando el prestamo para surtir su negocio, ya que ahorita tiene poco producto y estos productos se consiguen mas baratos comprandolos al por mayor, asi logra tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Melchi Susana R. P. is 34 years old, married, and has 2 children. The children are in school and they help her with the household chores. Her husband is a policeman, and they live in the El Centro neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo. Melchi sells plastic products for the home, such as plates, cups, basins, baskets, bowls, etc. She also sells dairy products on the weekends including butter and a variety of types of cheese. She has had this business for 11 years. She has her own home, and she sells her products to her neighbors in the community where she lives. She is requesting a loan to stock her store, since right now she has few products and she can get these products at a cheaper price if she buys them wholesale. In this way she can increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy plastic products for the home

loans.name: Carmen Deylin

texts.es:
Carmen Deylin C. B., tiene la edad de 46 años, es casado, y tiene 4 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 22,18,17 y 12 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para Compra de inventario para el negocio de abarrotes.El desea darle el mantenimiento adecuado para que sus ventas aumenten y por ende aumentar sus ingresos económicos, su negocio es un pequeño abastecedor que lo creó hace algunos años. 
No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron, porque esto le va ayudar a que su negocio crezca.
El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Carmen, 46, is married with 4 children who are her first priority. Her children are 22, 18, 17, and 12 years old. She wants a loan to buy inventory for her grocery business. She wants to maintain her business so that her sales and income increase. Her business is a small grocery store she started some years ago. This is not the first time she has had a loan through FUDECOSUR, and she has been very happy with the opportunities the loans have brought to her, helping her to increase her business. She would like to give her family a better quality of life in the future and better economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory for her grocery store

loans.name: Kankalay Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Kankalay Group. The leader of the group is Salamatu K.. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. Salamatu sells charcoal, rice, groundnuts, and palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). She is 45 years of age. Salamatu has 3 children, 2 of whom are in primary school and 1 in secondary school. She was born in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. Salamatu will use this loan to further expand her business. She will use it to buy charcoal, rice, groundnuts and palm oil.

Members of the Kankalay group are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni city.  This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs will be accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit, and consequently improve their living standards.

loans.use: Buy charcoal, rice, groundnut and palm oil

loans.name: Eam

texts.en: Eam S., age 42, is married and resides in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer, earning an income of US $2 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family's expenses. She has been doing this job since 1988. Her husband is a well digger, earning an income of approximately US $10 per day. S. is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase more tools to dig wells to expand her husband's current business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy tools to dig wells

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes T. is from the village of Capihan, Tacangon, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Lourdes is widowed and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling firewood in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es: Pablo Emilio Gómez labora como vigilante de CEPRODEL  desde hace 11 años casado , tiene 3 hijos quiene dependen de el y su esposa , el señor pablo Emilio ha obtenido 9 créditos con CEPRODEL  estos han sido de mucha utilidad en el desarrollo de su famila , ya que su casita la ha hecha  atreves  de los financiamientos que le han otorgado en CEPRODEL por lo que agradece el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Pablo Emilio Gómez has worked as a guard for Ceprodel for 11 years. He is married, and he and his wife have three children who are dependent upon them. Pablo Emilio has had nine loans with Ceprodel. They have been very useful to his family’s well-being. He built his house via the loans from Ceprodel. He is grateful for the help he received.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to make improvements on his house

loans.name: Judith Eudocia

texts.es:
Judith es socia del Banco Comunal Totorilla.
Judith es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 1 hija, Judith se dedica a la siembra de alfalfa en sus terrenos y también alquilados, producto que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Judith junto a su esposo tienen un mototaxi con el cual realiza transporte publico.
