Judith necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido para el pago de alquiler de terreno.
Judith sueña con tener casa propia y brindar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Judith is a member of the Totorilla communal bank. Judith, 31, lives with her life partner and their child. She farms alfalfa on her own and on leased lands and sells her crop in Ayacucho’s food wholesale market. In addition, Judith and her husband have a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) with which he provides public transportation services. Judith needs 900 soles to pay for land rental fees. Judith dreams with owning her own home and providing a good education to her child.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for land rental.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: The people who appear in the photo are Mrs. S. and her husband. This couple has an annual business, of which the main activity is to grow rice and vegetable crops. They live with two teenage children who are studying at secondary school. Besides the farming work, S. has another skill in breeding fish and she wants to use her knowledge to generate more income. She has recently dug a pond near her house where she wants to raise fish for extra income. Because S. doesn’t have capital, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy a stock of small fish to raise.

loans.use: To buy stock of small fish to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chan Thoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan Thoeun L. is a villager in Chong Angkar village in Takeo province and she was born in 1983. She is a weaver at her home from which she is able to earn some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Seourn Sem, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land he uses to cultivate rice to sell to support his family.

Now Mrs. Chan Thoeun L. has a problem because her husband’s field has infertile soil. So, to improve production, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan she will buy gasoline and pesticide.

Mrs. Chan Thoeun L. is the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local public school, while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn E. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old. Merlyn is single. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ready to wear clothing & shoes in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es: Ángela del Carmen tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, por lo que siempre esa pendiente de lo que necesitan. Ella necesita sufragar los gastos del hogar, por lo que no es la primera vez que recurre a los financiamientos, ya que ha sido de gran beneficio para su negocio. Ella se dedica a vender productos como perfumes, calzado, ropa, toallas y sabanas pues todos los días se levanta para vender sus productos, día a día trabaja arduamente en llevar el pan de cada día. Este financiamiento es para comprar materia prima. En un futuro le gustaría establecer una pulpería en su vivienda, pero hasta los momentos quisiera tener un gran inventario.
texts.en:
Ángela Del Carmen has two young children and is always aware of their needs. She must also defray the household expenses. This is not the first time she has obtained a loan, which has been a great benefit for her business. She sells products such as perfumes, shoes, clothing, towels and sheets. She sells her products every day and works arduously day after day to provide for her family. This loan will be used to purchase raw materials. In the future she would like to establish a grocery store in her home but for the moment she would like to have a large inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Magbanie Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Magbanie” group. They are small-scale-business women based in Masorie, a village near Makeni city, northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Ya Bom Kaprr S.. The forty-year-old woman was born in Masorie village. She is married to a farmer and they have six children, one of whom is attending primary school, three are in secondary school and two are already grown-ups.

For many years now, Ya Bom has sold market food – rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), Margi (used to give sauces a sweet taste), onions, etc. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying more of the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy more rice, palm-oil, Margi, onions, etc., to add to her stock

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M. is from the village of Sta.Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Evelyn owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables such as "kalamongay", "likway" and "alogbati" for sale. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used for additional capital for her business. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Evelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Arturo Ramon

texts.es:
El  Sr Arturo se dedica a la fabricación y ventas de colchones . Hace 3 años que se dedica a este rubro , ya que anteriormente trabajaba como operario en una empresa del mismo rubro , el es soltero y con un poco de su ahorro pudo montar su negocio  propio y así se   pudo independizar.
El  necesita invertir el crédito en la adquisición de un vehiculo  de mayor porte, para la distribución de sus productos, teniendo en cuenta que su actual vehículo ya le resulta pequeño para satisfacer las demandas. En el futuro  desea abrir su local propio.
texts.en:
Arturo makes and sells mattresses and has been doing this for three years. He used to work in a factory doing the same kind of work. He is single and he was able to start his own business with a bit of his savings. This allowed him to go out on his own. He needs this loan to invest in a large vehicle so that he can deliver his products. His current vehicle is too small to meet his needs. In the future he wants to open his own store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle for business

loans.name: Vigen

texts.en:
Vigen K. is from the village of Aghin in the Shirak region of Armenia. He is married with a 6-year-old daughter and a 1-year-old son.  

Vigen has a high school education and for the past 15 years, he has been in the vegetable-growing and pig-breeding business. At this time of the year, animal feeds and additional livestock are less expensive. Therefore, Vigen has chosen to take a loan at this time to grow his business. He has chosen microfinance as the services are well organized without complications.  

With the loan, Vigen is going to purchase feed and additional livestock. He is expecting his family income to increase by up to 20 percent with this investment. His dream for the future is to save enough money for his children to attend university. He enjoys the village life and being a farmer.

loans.use: Feed and livestock

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa S. is a 25-year-old married woman with a 5-year-old daughter. She lives with her husband in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her daughter lives with her mother-in-law, who operates a small cafe in the Uyanga sub-province. 

Bayarmaa started her own business in 2005 by trading a variety of grocery and consumer products between two sub-provinces, Uyanga and Arvaiheer. Her  husband operates a taxi service using his own car. Bayarmaa purchases her grocery products from local wholesale stores and her consumer goods from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Over the years, she has managed to expand her business, and her earnings have allowed her to purchase a new car as well as a house and fence for her family. Bayarmaa is a hardworking and optimistic person. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of food and other goods in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of food to sell.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin S., age 31, has a brick-making business that he has been running for the past three years. Over this time, he has built up a large clientele. He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd after being introduced to us by a friend who is a client here. He wants to buy materials for making the bricks as well as to purchase timber for building a shade for his bricks. His monthly income is Kshs 4,200. He intends to use the profits to buy a grade cow to be used to supply milk to the nearby shops.

His desire is to be able to build rental houses to boost his business.

Martin and his wife, Beryl Achieng, have six children. They live in the town of Migori.

loans.use: To buy brick-making materials

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for ten years and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk to a cooling plant in Litein town. He also earns income from his small-scale farming of tea which he sells to a local tea factory, and a garage which he operates in the same region. His biggest challenges in farming have been the poor road network and lack of enough funds to expand his farm.

He has requested this loan of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle for transporting milk to the cooling plant. He says that this motorcycle will enable him to transport his milk to the plant without any problem. It will also be used as an asset to secure more loans in the future. Someday, he would like to purchase a pick-up truck to help transport milk to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transporting milk to the market.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen G. is from the town of Surallah. She is 49 years old. Helen is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Helen also grows pigs for fattening and sale. She does her best to manage her time between business and family.

Helen joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP that will be used to purchase fertilizers as well as feed for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers as well as feed for the pigs

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es: Eulalia, de 34 años, convive con José, de 37 años. Ambos tienen, 4 hijos, todos menores de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Está emprendedora mujer, hace tan solo 4 años, que emprendió la siembra de maca. Primero vendía su producción a los intermediarios que trasladaban a la ciudad de Junín, al ver que la maca que producía era de buena calidad, hace 2 años que Eulalia, recibió la propuesta de vender su producción a una empresa procesadora de bebidas a base de maca en la capital, desde entonces comenzó su inversión en la mejora de la calidad de su producto, el cual le genera ganancias de 9 mil a 10 mil nuevos soles anuales. Por ello está planeando abrir su propia empresa de procesadora de maca, con el cual pueda expandir su negocio y por ende generar mejores ganancias, en corto plazo. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, y espera salir adelante junto a los integrantes de su banco comunal, al cual augura muchos éxitos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 16 kilos de semillas de maca, que utilizará en sus 4 hectáreas de terreno agrícola. Cada kilo oscila entre los 180 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Eulalia is 34 years old and lives with José, age 37. They have four children, all of whom are minors. This family lives in their own home located in the town of San Pedro de Cajas. Eulalia is an enterprising woman who began growing “maca” (a type of root vegetable) four years ago. At first her products were sold through middlemen who travel to the city of Junín where the maca that is produced is of high quality. Two years ago, Eulalia received a proposal to sell her harvest to a processing company that makes beverages out of maca. Since then she began investing to improve the quality of her product and now generates revenue between 9,000 to 10,000 PEN per year. For this reason, she plans to open her own maca processing enterprise so that she can expand her business and earn higher profits in the short term.

This is her second loan with MFP. Eulalia hopes that she and the other members of her Communal Bank can move forward together and achieve great success. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy 16 kilos of maca seeds for planting on four hectares of farmland. Each kilo can fluctuate up to 180 PEN.

loans.use: Purchase 16 kilos of maca seeds

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de desayunos, ella prepara diferentes desayunos como quinua con leche, manzana entre otros desayunos, ella trabaja desde las 4:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de desayunos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para hacer los desayunos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Marina belongs to the "Maquimanta Purisun" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Luz Marina is 42 years old.  She is single and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling breakfasts.  She prepares different breakfasts such as quinoa with milk, apple, and other breakfasts.  She works from 4.00am to 11.00pm.  She would like to improve her business and is requesting this loan to buy products for making her breakfasts.

Luz Marina is happy to be receiving a loan and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy products for making her breakfasts

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira tiene 53 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Paiján, una zona comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ascope, región La Libertad. La localidad se encuentra situada a más de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización de pan y diversos productos en un puesto ambulante situado en una de las esquinas de la localidad en donde reside. Ella trabaja ofreciendo su mercadería generalmente por las tardes y siempre atiende a sus clientes con un buen trato. El negocio le sirve para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.

Elvira desea aumentar su capital de trabajo para adquirir mas pan y así poder satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Elvira is 53 years old, single, and lives with her family in the District of Paiján, a commercial area that is located in Ascope Province in the region of La Libertad. This community is located more than two and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Elvira sells bread and different products from a mobile stand situated on a street corner in the town where she lives. She usually sells her merchandise in the afternoons and always provides good service to her customers. This business helps her family get ahead.

Elvira wants to increase her operating capital so that she can acquire more bread and satisfy the current demand. For this reason she is requesting a loan of 500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to help achieve her goal.

loans.use: Purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Leonor Gioconda

texts.es:
Leonor pertenece al banco comunal “Kukuli” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene 13 ciclos de funcionamiento (Cada ciclo son 4 meses) y el banco comunal está bien administrado por la junta directiva. 

Leonor, tiene 35 años y tiene tres hijos, ella nació en el departamento de Cusco provincia de Cusco, Perú. Actualmente, Leonor  vive en el distrito de Wanchaq de la ciudad del Cusco junto con sus hijos. 

Leonor se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía de tipo muñequería, ella también se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos y bordados. Ya son cinco años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

Leonor espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles de crédito y utilizará este dinero para comprar materiales como por ejemplo telas y muchas cosas más.
texts.en:
Leonor belongs to the “Kukuli” Communal Bank of the UMF Arariwa Association. The Communal Bank has received 13 loans (each cycle is 4 months) and the Communal Bank is well managed by its governing board.

Leonor is 35 years old and has three children, she was born in the department of Cusco, province of Cusco, Perú. At present, Leonor lives in the district of Wanchaq in the city of Cusco with her children.

Leonor sells handicrafts, dolls, and she also knits and embroiders. She has been in the business for five years and is doing very well thanks to all of the hard work that she invests in her business.

Leonor hopes to receive a loan of S/. 1500 nuevos soles and she will use the money to buy materials like fabric and many other items.

loans.use: To buy materials like fabric and many other items.

loans.name: Suan

texts.en: Sewing clothes is the main part of 46-year-old Suan S.’s daily routine. She provides this service to her neighbors and sews both traditional clothes and modern clothes at home. She runs her business very well and a lot of customers recognize the good service she provides. She is married to Srey Chantha, 44, a policeman, and they have two young children. This rice harvesting season, and Suan S. has applied for this loan to buy many sacks of rice to store. She will sell them later, when the price of rice rises to its highest level.

loans.use: To buy rice now, when the price is low, and sell it when prices are higher

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah rakhi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve the business of her husband. He is a loader by profession and operates a donkey cart through which he offers loading services to his customers. With the loan, he will buy a new cart because his current cart has gone rough and rotten from different areas. A new cart will help him provide better loading services to his customers by being able to carry heavy loads. This will allow him to complete more orders and to earn more profits. 

He started this business 6 years ago. Allah rakhi is hopeful that an investment will be profitable for her husband. She herself is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and do her household works. She is very cooperative and is always ready to help her family to overcome difficulties of life. 

Allah rakhi resides in Samundri, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a 4-room brick house with her family for the past 15 years. She lives in a combine family system with her brother-in-law and father-in-law, who are also wage earners in the family. She has given birth to 3 sons. Her eldest son is getting an education, while the others are too young to attend school. 

Allah Rakhi is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Allah rakhi.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading business

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia solicita el préstamo para refaccionar el baño de su casa y construcción en obra fina de las gradas que van al segundo piso de su casa. Trabaja como empleada en un bufete de abogados. Ella es viuda y tiene tres hijos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la Villa Copacabana de  ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en: Eugenia is requesting this loan in order to repair her bathroom and detail the stairs that lead to the second story of her home.  She works in a law office.  [Eugenia] is a widow and has three children.  Her home is located in the Copacabana area of La Paz.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Noe Efrain

texts.es:
Noe Efrain G. X., tiene 48 años de edad, curso el tercer años de educación primaria, se dedica a la fabricacion de muebles, carpinteria, lleva 23 años de experiencia con este trabajo, inicio haciendo trabajos con herramientas mecanicas y actualmente usa maquinas para agilizar y facilitar su trabajo. 

Solicita un préstamo para compra madera de pino blanco, que le servirá para fabricar mas muebles y mejorar sus ganancias, espera con el préstamo en el futuro contar con mas maquinaria y empleados.
texts.en:
Noe, who is 48 years old, completed the 3rd year of primary education.  He  does carpentry and makes furniture, and has 23 years of experience at it.  Noe began working with mechanics' tools and now uses machines to facilitate his work.

Noe is requesting a loan to purchase white pine lumber with which he will make furniture and improve his earnings.  He hopes that with this loan, he will be able to acquire more machinery in the future and hire more employees.

loans.use: TO BUY WOOD TO MAKE FURNITURE

loans.name: Nazareno Group

texts.es:
La comunidad de Nuevo Paso Nazareno es una comunidad indigena en la cual hablan un dialecto llamado mazateco. En esta comunidad vive la señora Genoveva la cual pertenece a una UDE(Unidad de desarollo) llamanda nazareno en honor al nombre del pueblo, doña Genoveva tiene la edad de 60 años solo asistio al segundo grado de primaria, esta casada y tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya estan casados. Ella nos platica que hace un poco mas de 23 años con el apoyo de su esposo pusieron un molino de nixtamal (maiz) en el cual muele el maiz a sus vecinas. Cada día se levanta a las seis de la mañana para iniciar a moler el maiz a sus clientas y necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de maiz y algunas piezas para dar mantenimiento a su molino. Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere y deje buenas ganacias ya que desea comprar un nuevo molino.
Los otros 13 integrantes del grupo son:
Julia S.- tienda de abarrotes
Linda Beatriz P. P.- antojitos
Alicia G. F.- deposito de refrescos
Maria De Los Angeles F. A.-deposito de refrescos
Martha Graciela M. C.-cosina economica
Enriqueta S. H.- antojitos
Louerdes A. S.- deposito de refrescos
Apolonia P. T. - abarrotes
Angela G. G.- polleria
Lilia M. C.- dulceria
Epifanio M. P.- taller mecanico
Cristina T. R.- venta de refrescos
Lucia P. F.- antojitos
texts.en:
The community of Nuevo Paso Nazareno is a an indigenous community in which a dialect called “mazateco” is spoken.  In this community lives Genoveva who belongs to a development unit (DU) called “nazareno” in honor of the town’s name. Genoveva is 60 and only studied up to 2nd grade, she is married and has four children that are married. She tells us that more than 23 years ago with the support from her husband, they installed a corn grinder in which she grinds corn for her neighbors. Every day she gets up at six in the morning to begin with the corn grinding for her customers and she needs a loan to purchase corn and some parts to give maintenance to the grinder.  She hopes that with this investment her business will flourish and gives good profits as she wishes to buy a new grinder.

The other 13 members are:
Julia S. - grocery store
Linda Beatriz P. - snacks
Alicia G. F. - soft drinks 
Maria De Los Angeles F. A. - soft drinks
Martha Graciela M. C. – take out food
Enriqueta S. H.- snacks
Louerdes A. S.- soft drinks
Apolonia P. T. - groceries
Angela G. G.- chicken
Lilia M. C.- candy
Epifanio M. P.- repair shop
Cristina T. R.- soft drinks
Lucia P. F.- snacks

loans.use: to buy corn and parts for a grinder.

location.town: Nuevo Paso Nasareno, San Miguel Soyaltepec, oaxaca

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a fishing business in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy fishing gear and equipment. She has been in this line of work for 25 years and supplements her income by selling some of the fish she catches to people who live in her community. Her goals are to repair and renovate her home and earn enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment and sell some of her fish to people in her community.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is an active lady, carrying out her responsibilities as a housewife and mother very well. She prefers to stay at home and take care of her family. She is a resident of Jaranwala, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agricultural industry. She has been living there with her family in a three-room brick house for the past 10 years. Her husband's name is M. S. and he is a scrap dealer. He supplies scrap to different factories and to other scrap dealers on demand and generates income for the family.  

Razia has four sons and a daughter. Her eldest son left his education and started working. He is a bus conductor. The other two are enrolled in a local school getting their education. 

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband who wants to buy scrap to fulfill the demands of his clients. With the loan, he will buy scrap such as used paper, plastic bottles, etc. He has been operating this business for the past many years and is well known among his clients for his good work. Razia hopes that an investment will bring positive financial changes to his business and will help her family to live a better financial life as a result. 

Razia is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In previous years, she has established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: to buy scrap for a scrap business.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Julienne est née en 1968 et a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à sa charge. Julienne vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs différentes charges. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Julienne vend de l’«akassa » (aliment local fait à base d’amidon de maïs) et des poissons frits à son domicile, mais également de façon ambulante. Julienne s’approvisionne au marché de Cocotomey. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à couvrir les charges de ses enfants. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Julienne sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits dont Julienne avait bénéficié ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Julienne was born in 1968 and has three children.  All the children are in school; Julienne is still financially responsible for two of them.   Julienne lives alone with her children and takes care of the household expenses by herself.  For the past ten years, Julienne has been selling “akassa “ (a local food made with corn starch) and fried fish from her home and also as an itinerant vendor.  Julienne obtains her supplies at the Cocotomey market.  This business generates revenue that helps her cover her children’s expenses.  Julienne is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to meet her goals of expanding her business and increasing her profit.   The first two loans that Julienne received have been fully repaid.

loans.use: To buy three bags of corn and three bags of fish

loans.name: Ericka Esperanza

texts.es: Ericka Esperanza se dedica a brindar el servicio de video juegos. Tiene más de 5 años  con su negocio, pues es una persona que siempre se preocupa por brindarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. Ericka es una persona emprendedora que todos los días tiene que prepararse para  atender a sus clientes. El financiamiento es para la compra de controles, discos y PlayStation. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora disfruta de relacionarse con sus clientes y además de brindar un buen servicio.
texts.en: Ericka Esperanza has a video game place; she has worked for 5 years in this business. She is a person who always worries about giving her family the income necessary. Erika is an enterprising person that works everyday and prepares herself to take care of her customers. The loan is to buy controls, disks and a PlayStation. Erika is a hardworking person and enjoys connecting with her customers besides giving them a good service.

loans.use: buy controls, disks and a PlayStation.

loans.name: Loem

texts.en:
From the province of Siem Reap, Mrs. Loem is a 21-year-old married woman who lives in a small wooden house which is located along the river. Mrs. Loem and her husband sell various kinds of items to all travelers and villagers who come to buy something in the busy market. They have over two years' experience in this business, and their sales business is running smoothly because of their good communication skills. 

In order to make the business do even better, Mrs. Loem will use the loan she has asked for to buy more essential goods for resale.

loans.use: to buy more essential goods for resale.

loans.name: Kossi Fofovi

texts.fr: Mr Kossi veut renforcer son activité (vente de ferrailles) qu’il a commencé en 2003 c’est pour cela il sollicite ce montant. Il achète à Lomé et revend dans un magasin. Sa femme est revendeuse.
texts.en: Mr. Kossi wants to strengthen his business (sale of scrap metal) that he started in 2003.  For this reason he is asking for this loan. He buys in Lome and resells in a store. His wife is a reseller.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal.

loans.name: Ludgarda

texts.es: Ludgarda de 40 años de edad, separado actualmente de su esposo, con  quien tuvo 3 hijos. Ella y sus hijos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de gloria amargura, del distrito de LLochegua. Para  Ludgarda Todo empezó cuando desde muy joven se dedicó a trabajar para un agricultor, en ese entonces cultivaba y cosechaba cacao. Ella sentía que no tenía posibilidades de crecimiento y que solo con el sueldo que recibía procuraba ahorrarlo con la finalidad de tener su propio negocio. En el presente cultiva y comercializa frutas, específicamente piña, y agradece a sus mentores por las buenas lecciones de cosecha que lo enseñaron. Es por ello que tiene buenos productos de alta calidad, por las cuales sus compradores más potenciales se sienten satisfechos, en efecto es un negocio que lo está dando buenos resultados económicos. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos en temporada de cosecha, a la vez tiene a cargo de sus peones para que le puedan facilitar el traslado de su producto hacia los centros de acopio de su comunidad, con la finalidad de poder venderlo a un precio justo. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para crecer en su negocio. Con los  2.000  soles que solicita,  desea extender sus cultivos de piña, por ello contratará peones y plantas de piña.
texts.en:
Ludgarda is 40 years old and currently separated from her husband. She and her three children live in their own home in the community of Gloria Amargura in the District of Llochegua. Everything began for Ludgarda when she was a very young woman. She decided to work as a farmer, cultivating and growing cacao. Ludgarda felt she lacked growth opportunities, so using only the salary she had saved up, she was able to have her own business. At the moment, she grows and sells fruit, especially pineapple. She is grateful to her mentors for the great lessons in farming that they gave to her. For this reason, she is able to grow high-quality products that will satisfy more potential buyers. As a result, her business will generate good financial results. Ludgarda usually works on her own, but occasionally she gets help from her children during the harvest season. During this time, she hires workers to facilitate the transport of her product to the collection centers in her community so that she can sell it at a fair price.

This will be her first loan with MFP. Ludgarda hopes that everyone will support her so that she can grow her business. The loan of 2000 PEN that she is requesting will be used to expand her pineapple crop. She plans to hire workers and buy pineapple plants.

loans.use: to hire workers and to buy pineapple plants.

loans.name: Ium

texts.en:
Ium and her husband have five children and since 1979 have been happily living in Prey Chor, a district in Kampong Cham Province.

Ium is a farmer as well as a cake seller. She would like to request a loan from HKL of $150 in order to purchase seed, fertilizer and other farming necessities. In the future she hopes to expand her farm and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and other farming necessities.

loans.name: Adelayda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco.  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos a la señora Adelayda que nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú), tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, y nos cuenta:

“Actualmente, Yo vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizo mis actividades, Yo me dedico a la venta de cometicos. Ya voy dos años con este negocio y me va muy bien. También me dedico a limpiar y dar mantenimiento de departamentos. Ya son 7 años que me dedico a brindar este servicio y me va muy excelente. En esta oportunidad requiero el préstamo para comprar más cosméticos. Uno de mis sueños es abrir un bazar o boutique”.
texts.en:
The community bank "We Come Together" meets every month in the city of Cusco.  Cusco is known as a popular tourist area, and a business center.  It is also known for its traditional festival of Inti Raymi and because it is the location of Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

In this place we meet Señora Adelayda, who was born in the city of Cusco (in Peru).  She is 33 years old and married, and has two children from this relationship.  She tells us:

"Currently, I live in the city of Cusco, where I do my work.  I work selling cosmetics.  It's coming up to two years that I've had this business and it's going very well.  I also work cleaning and doing maintenance for the local government.  I've been providing this service for 7 years, and it's going extremely well.  At this moment, I am requesting a loan to buy more cosmetics.  One of my dreams is to open a bazaar or boutique."

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Furkatchon

texts.ru:
Фуркатчон умный, образованный и целеустремленный человек.  Он женат и ответственный отец 2 детей. Его жена занимается шитьем национальных платьев в местном районе. Фуркатчон занимается купля продажей скатов более 4 года. В настоящее время у него в активе имеется 4 скота на сумму 8000 Сомони. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получит максимальный прибыль с целью улучшение условие свой семейной жизни. Фуркатчон хотел бы получит займ на сумму 1000$ США для покупки скота. Он заранее благодарен всем за поддержку и доброты. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Furkatchon is a smart, educated and goal-oriented person.  He is a married and responsible father of two children.  His wife is involved in sewing national dresses at the local district.  Furkatchon is involved in buying and selling livestock for over four years.  He currently has four heads of livestock, valued at 8000 Somoni.  He wants to expand his business and obtain a maximum profit in order to improve his family's conditions.  Furkatchon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1000 for the purchase of livestock.  He is thankful in advance to all for the support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Juana, vive con su madre, no tiene hijos, se dedica a la venta de mariscos y cosméticos de revistas, tiene 9 años en los negocios, con los ingresos que consigue de las ventas, ayuda a su madre a cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Ella necesita invertir un préstamo en la compra de mariscos frescos que le permitan mejorar la venta, los productos más demandados son pescados de varias clases, camarones, mejillones, filetes, con esta compra estará mejorando su condición de comerciante.
El proyecto de Juana es mejorar el inventario, buscar nuevos mercados para atender con el negocio, teniendo mayor rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Juana lives with her mother, she has no children and she has been engaged in selling seafood and catalogue cosmetics for 9 years. She helps her mother paying for family expenses with the money she earns from selling her products.
She needs to invest the loan in the purchase of fresh seafood that will help her improve her sales. The most requested products are various kinds of fish [such as] shrimps, mussels and fillets. Thanks to this purchase she will grow as a merchant.
Juana's project is to stock up her inventory and to search for new markets where to establish her activity, thus gaining higher profitability.

loans.use: To buy shrimp, mussels and fillets.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua, who is married and assists her spouse in taking care of the home, makes palm oil for distribution. She will use her loan to buy more palm fruit to make oil for sale, and hopes to use the new profits from her business to save toward buying land.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruit to make oil to sell.

loans.name: Golden Flames Group

texts.en:
Sita is 41 years old and lives in Gweru. She is married, but her husband is currently unemployed. They have five children between the ages of 19 and 3, four of whom attend school. They also care for three other dependents.

Sita sells a range of items including shoes, children’s clothing and chicken. The principal problem she faces at present is lack of funds to buy stock to meet demand. She has two employees. Sita will use the money she borrows to buy shoes and chicken feed.  She hopes that this will enable her to rent a larger shop.

loans.use: To buy additional shoes and chicken feed

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en: Vahe is 40 years old and lives with his wife, a daughter and a son in Yerevan. Vahe’s wife stays at home and takes care of their children who are pupils.  Vahe has a high education in the economics sphere but he has never worked in any organization. For more than 17 years, he has been engaged in the clothes trading business. He imports women's clothes from neighboring countries and resells them in Yerevan. Vahe used to rent stalls in different clothes markets in Yerevan, but now he is renting a stall in the one of the biggest  trade center in Yerevan, which is the most comfortable and largest place for trade. Vahe prefers to sell women's clothes because in Yerevan it is in high demand and as he confessed, it is more pleasurable for him. Thanks to his business, Vahe solved his family's needs and bought new furniture and home appliances for their apartment. Vahe received loans from Nor Horizon 12 times and he has never delayed his repayments. Now Vahe needs a $3,000 loan to buy autumn and winter women's clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy autumn and winter women’s clothes to resell

loans.name: Pamgnodo Group

texts.fr:
Mme Haoua est la représentante du groupe PAMGNODO. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 38ans et le moins âgé a 16ans.01 de ses enfants va à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle prépare et vend le soumbala depuis 20ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants (Tanghin Dassouri et baossa). Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter 05 sacs de grains de néré pour la transformation en soumbala et une charrette de bois de chauffe.

Mme épargne et assure la scolarité de ses enfants avec ses économies. Elle ambitionne construire une maison d’habitation et agrandir ses points de vente de soumbala.
texts.en:
Mrs. Haoua represents group Pamgnodo. She is married and a mother of three. Her oldest is 38 years old and her youngest 16. One of her children goes to school. She has five people in her care.

She has been preparing and selling sumbala for twenty years. She gets her supplies from neighboring villages (Tanghin Dassouri and Baossa). Her clients are women and men.

She wants to purchase five bags of African locus beans to prepare sumbala, as well as one cartload of firewood.

She is putting money aside and pays for her children's school with her savings. Her ambition is to build a house to live in and to enlarge her sumbala sales outlets.

loans.use: to buy a cartload of firewood and 5 bags of African locus beans to make sumbala (a traditional condiment).

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with four children who are enrolled in school. Her husband is a driver who contributes to the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanakombo has operated a leso (kanga-a wearable cloth) selling business for the past seven years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a challenge of seasonality in that she makes most of her sales in the holiday seasons. She aspires to open a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more lesos for resale. She decided join Yehu Microfinance to gain financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more lesos for resale.

loans.name: Lucy Silvia

texts.es:
Lucy Silvia tiene 50 años vive en la urbanización Mercurio de la ciudad de el Alto, cuenta con casa propia, cuenta con un ingreso por sueldo de vendedora con 18 años de experiencia laboral en una librería.
La cliente con el transcurso del tiempo ahorró dinero de donde con ese pequeño ahorro tiene un pequeño patrimonio en bienes muebles e inmueble.
El destino del crédito es para capital de inversión, refacción de vivienda y trámites de la misma en las oficinas de regulación de documentación de bienes inmuebles.
La cliente, en cuanto a su experiencia quiere mejorar su nivel de ingresos, cuenta con actitud de pago y emprendimiento en su vida personal y laboral.
texts.en:
Lucy Silvia is 50 years old. She lives in the Mercurio development in the city of El Alto. She has her own house and she has an income as a salesperson with 18 years of work experience in a book store.

Over time she has saved money and because of these small savings she has a small amount of personal property and real estate.

She will use the loan as capital to invest in house repairs and for some legal processes related to her house in the offices that regulate the documentation of real estate. 

The client, who wishes to improve her level of income, is responsible with payments and is enterprising in her personal and work life.

loans.use: to pay for legal processes related to the legalization of her house

loans.name: Vinh

texts.en: Vinh is 49 years old and lives in Cho Town with her husband and two children, both of whom are married. Her husband and her children all work, and she contributes to the family income by running a store. She has been in this line of work for five years and earns about 6,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND) a month. She is applying for her sixth loan, for 9,632,000 VND, to buy foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products and other items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia se dedica a la elaboración de aretes, camándulas, anillos y collares para dama y caballero en diferentes materiales tales como plata, murano y fantasía. Lo anterior lo aprendió en cursos que tomo de bisutería. La señora Patricia vende sus productos a vecinas, amigos y compañeras de estudio. La señora Patricia desea comprar materiales para hacer sus productos tales como pedrería, plata e hilos con el fin de suplir la demanda de fin de año, poder incrementar sus ventas y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo de 5 años. El sueño de la señora Patricia es tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
Sra. Patricia makes earrings, rosaries, rings, and necklaces for women and men out of different materials such as silver, murano glass, and precious stones. She previously took jewelry-making courses where she learned this skill.

Sra. Patricia sells her products to neighbors, friends, and classmates. She wants to buy materials for making her products, such as precious stones, silver, and thread, so that she can meet the year-end demand. This will enable her to increase her sales and improve the quality of life for her five-year-old son. Sra. Patricia dreams of having her own store.

loans.use: to purchase craft materials.

loans.name: Saem

texts.en:
A 55-year-old married mother, Saem has five children and only one of them is dependent. She lives in a rural area located in the Ponhea Krek district where cassava-planting is common. 

Saem has been farming on her rice field as her main income source for 30 years. She has supplemented her income by planting cassava for more than three years to raise additional income. Sometimes, she works for others for a fee. Her current daily income is more than $15 and she saves around $5 per day. 

This is Saem's first loan with VisionFund. She will use the loan to buy cassava (starchy plant) from the village as stock for sale. This loan will enable her to increase her income and make a better living as well as build her savings for the future.

loans.use: To buy cassava (starchy plant) from the village for sale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Chan Nary

texts.en:
Chan Nary, 30, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband travel around the village to purchase junk material from villagers to resell at the junk shop. 

Chan Nary is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for traveling to purchase the junk. In the future, she would like to run a junk shop of her own, build a small concrete house, and support her children to study until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for traveling to purchase the junk.

loans.name: Sarahi Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sarahi lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María Eugenia de 36 años quien se dedica a la venta de leche agria desde hace 5 años. Ella está casada y tiene 4 hijos de 20, 15,17 y 12 años de edad todos estudian el mayor está en la universidad.
Ella invertirá el crédito en vasos, cucharas, servilletas…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Rebeca de 27 años quien vende ropa desde hace 3 años y Ninfa de 28 años quien vende cosméticos desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
The Sarahi group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial people.  One of them is 36-year-old María Eugenia who has been selling 'leche agria' (a fermented milk product) for five years.  She is married and has four children who are 20, 17, 15 and 12 years old.  They are all studying and the eldest is at University.

María Eugenia will invest her loan in cups, spoons, napkins, etc.

The other members of this group are 27-year-old Rebeca, who has been selling clothes for three years, and 28-year-old Ninfa, who has been selling cosmetics for three years.

loans.use: to buy leche agria (a fermented milk product), cups, spoons and napkins

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is forty-eight years of age and is married with nine children.

Luisa owns & operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has five years of experience in this business.    Luisa needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase new items to expand product offering.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to pay her children's tuition fees.

In 2008, Luisa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Luisa's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Gnongonfamou Group

texts.fr:
Gnongonfamou est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels le charbon de bois, les tissus,  des draps de lit, la friperie, du Sounbala, fait  de la couture, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur sixième   prêt de groupe. 
Djene est un membre du groupe Gnongonfamou,  assise à  l’extrême bout en T-shirt rouge  sur la photo, qui  fait de la couture et vend des prêts -à –porter (pantalons, chemises) et des draps de lit.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des tissus et les matériels pour  coudre.. Elle se procure  de matériels  à Koutiala auprès des grossistes qui viennent de Bobo Dioulasso. Elle vend ses articles en détail et au comptant à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Gnongonfamou comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 180 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Djene compte réaliser 192 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.

loans.use: Achat  de matériels pour la couture

loans.name: Phulamati

texts.en:
Phulamati is a 27-year-old lady lives with her parents-in-laws, husband and children. She has a small grocery store in her village. She is selling food items like vegetables, rice, lentils, salt, detergents, soap, spices, etc. She is the only one earning member of this family. She has to travel every three days to the nearest market in Jeypore to get more stock. She wants to reinvest in her grocery store so that she can stock up more inventory at her shop to meet the demands of the local people and reduce her transportation and buying costs. This will increase her earning capacity. 

Phulamati has requested a loan of 36,000 INR to purchase more of the items she stocks, add more variety to her product line and more stock for her grocery shop and grow her business.

She is a part of Gayatri Mahila SHG.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, rice, lentils, salt, detergents, soap, spices, etc. for his grocery shop.

loans.name: Vi's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vi, born in 1997 is the Thai ethnic woman, living with her husband and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province. 
Her family lives mainly based on cultivation and breeding. Each year the income after each harvest is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and save a small amount. She wants to invest in raising breeding cow but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.
She hopes that the loan amount will help her family develop the breeding well, and next year it will bring her family a healthy calf. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in raising breeding cow

loans.name: Fadayel

texts.en:
Fadayel is 44 years old, for many years ago her parents had dead and she stayed alone with no income, and that made ‎her to go and live with her brother who  is working with low income and has a wife and children and that's mean he cannot ‎help Fadayel or cover her daily expenses.‎
Fadayel is ambitious woman and wants to be a productive woman; therefore she decided to start her own business. She ‎started her business with low quantity of household supplies and she was sold her products at her brother`s house where ‎she lives.  Then she decided to do expansion for her business, she rented a shop and now she needs to stock her shop ‎with a large quantity of products, therefore she applied for a loan to help buy household supplies and kitchen supplies such ‎as dishes, laundry baskets, trays, cups, jars, Etc. Fadayel needs your support. ‎

loans.use: to help buy household supplies and kitchen supplies such ‎as dishes, laundry baskets, trays, cups, jars, Etc.

loans.name: Dawlossi

texts.en:
Ms. Dawlossi A. is a mother of five children. She has been married for twelve years, but her husband’s farming business does not earn him enough to pay all of the family’s expenses. This is why she has invested the profits from selling ice water at the market in Afagnan in the production of palm oil, something highly popular and widely consumed in her country. Having seen that the production and sale of palm oil is a very profitable activity in her town, she is seeking the means to develop her business. To do so, she is requesting a loan of $600, which will serve as the capital to buy palm nuts in large quantity and to prepare red palm oil. Ms. A. has a lot of experience in managing loans, and the success of her business gives her the ability to repay them. The granting of this loan will give her the ability to meet the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Dawlossi est mère d’une famille de cinq (5) enfants. Mariée depuis une douzaine d’années, la profession de cultivateur de son mari ne lui permet pas de bien subvenir aux charges de sa famille. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle a investi les bénéfices de la vente de l’eau glacée au marché d’Afagnan dans la production de l’huile de palme, une huile bien appréciée et consommée dans le pays. Ayant constaté que la production et la vente de l’huile de palme est une activité très rentable dans la localité, elle cherche des moyens pour l’agrandir. Elle sollicite à cet effet un crédit de $600 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat des noix de palme en grande quantité et la préparation de l’huile rouge. Madame A. possède une grande expérience en gestion de crédit et son activité lui confère une bonne capacité de remboursement. Comme impact, l’octroi de ce crédit lui procurera une capacité de bien subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants..

loans.use: To buy palm nuts to make palm oil

loans.name: Bernice

texts.en: Bernice is 33 years old and married with 3 children. She had no education but has benefited from the 'TEACH' learning sessions of KRABAN in October,2006. She is eager to put the skills acquired at the training to improve her business. She is looking forward to a KIVA loan to achieve this purpose. She wants to sell household items in her community.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.en:
Pascuala is 48 years old, married, and has tour children. Her husband is a bus driver. She sells foodstuffs from her house (cooking oil, salt, sugar). She is part of the “María del Carmen Group 2”. The other member is Neyvi Guadelupe Pérez Villafuerte, who sells women’s accessories from her home. With the loan, each hopes to increase her income. Neyvi will buy more accessories and perfumes to sell to women in the community. Pascuala wants to build a small grocery story, along with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

PASCUALA ES CASADA TIENE 48 AÑOS Y CUATRO HIJOS, SU ESPOSO ES CHOFER DE LOCOMOCION COLECTIVA, ELLA ACTUALMENTE VENDE COMESTIBLES EN SU CASA ( ACEITE , SAL, AZUCAR, ) PERTENECE AL GRUPO MARIA DEL CARMEN 2 SU OTRA INTEGRANTE ES DOÑA NEYVI GUADALUPE PEREZ VILLAFUERTE QUIEN VENDE ADORNOS Y ACCESORIOS PARA LA MUJER EN SU CASAAMBAS ESPERAN CON EL PRESTAMO INCREMENTAR SUS INGRESOS . NEYVI COMPRAR MAS ACCESORIOS Y PERFUMES PARA VENDER A LAS MUJERES DE LA COMUNIDAD, EN CAMBIO PASCUALA QUIERE INSTALAR UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA DE ABARROTES JUNTO A SU ESPOSO..

loans.use: To build a small grocery store; To buy women's accessories for resale

loans.name: Nji Richard

texts.en:
Nji Richard M. is married and a father of five.  He greatly enjoys his family life thanks to the training he got from GHAPE.  Before this training, he suffered from marital misunderstanding due to ignorance and was also unable to provide for his family.  This motivated him to become a member of GHAPE where he was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, he has taken out and repaid loans which have enabled him to pay for school fees for his children and buy food for his family.

Given a loan of $800, he plans to fatten and sell pigs, which are a commonly consumed meat in this area.  While waiting for his pigs to be fattened, he plans to cultivate short cycle crops to sell so that he can start repaying his loan.

He plans to repay his loan in 24 months.  His first loan repayment installment will be made four months from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase of piglets, pig vaccine and seeds as well as to finance the construction of pig sties

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel is 29 years old and lives in Huallparrimachi Street in the Tembladerani neighborhood in the city of La Paz with his parents. Since he was a small boy, he has devoted himself to sewing and works alongside his mother and siblings making skirts. The credit he's requesting is to purchase a machine for weaving blankets; with this he can expand his business and improve his income.

Manuel requested his first loan through IMPRO in January of this year and it is already completely paid off. This credit record qualifies him to accept a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer

Manuel tiene 29 años de edad y vive en la calle Huallparrimachi de la zona de tembladerani de La Ciudad de La paz en casa de sus padres; desde muy pequeño se dedica a la costura y trabaja junto con su mama y sus hermanos en la confección de polleras. El crédito que solicita es para comprar una maquina para tejer mantas y con esto poder ampliar su negocio y poder mejorar sus ingresos.

Manuel solicitó su primer credito con IMPRO en Enero de este año y a la fecha ya está completamente pagado. Este antecedente histórico lo califica para acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of machine for weaving blankets

loans.name: Yenny Gertrudis

texts.es:
Yenny is a hardworking 22-year-old mother who since she had her son has dedicated herself to selling artisan crafts, always with her young baby by her side. Thanks to her dedication and perseverance, the work is helping her save for a new home. The goal of this young and enterprising mother is to improve the quality of her merchandise and with the extra income that will generate, she plans to save enough to purchase some land and build a small home. She is counting on your good heart and is requesting a loan in hopes of fulfilling her plans, and she plans to repay it within eight months. This young mother waits for your support in strengthening her business and helping her offer a better quality of life for her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Yenny, es una joven madre luchadora de 22 años de edad, desde que tuvo a su pequeño hijo se dedicó arduamente a su negocio de venta de productos artesanales acompañada siempre de su querido e inquieto bebé, trabajo que gracias a su dedicación y perseverancia está brindándole la posibilidad de solventar satisfactoriamente los gastos de su nuevo hogar.El deseo de esta joven y emprendedora madre es aumentar la cantidad de su mercadería y con las ganancias que genere la venta de estos productos ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar un terrenito y construir su casita.Para concretar sus planes ella recurre a tu buen corazón y solicita un préstamo que le posibilitará adquirir mayor cantidad de mercadería y con la inversión de este capital obtener mayor beneficio económico.Ella se compromete a reembolsar tu ayuda en un lapso de ocho meses. Esta joven madre espera tu apoyo para fortalecer su negocio y así ofrecerle una mejor condición de vida a su querida familia.

loans.use: Acquire higher quality products to sell so she can improve the quality of life for her beloved infant son.

loans.name: Maman

texts.fr:
Maman N. is 35 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. She has been selling yams at the Adéta market for more than 5 years. She buys the yams from the surrounding villages and resells them at the Adéta market. This activity allows her to be independent and to contribute to her family's needs. Recently, there has been an increased demand for yams and she needs financial assistance to satisfy this need. This is the reason she is requesting the loan.

Maman N. est agée de 35 ans , mariée et mère de 2 enfants.Elle est revendeuse d'ignames au marchéé d'Adéta depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle va dans les villages environnants pour acheter les ignames et les revend au marché d'Adéta. Cette activité lui permet d'être indépendante et de contribuer aux charges de la famille.Depuis queleque temps la demande devient importante et a besoin d'une aide financière pour satisfaire la demande .C'est dans ce cadre qu'elle sollicite l'emprunt

loans.use: Purchase of yams in surrounding villages for resale at the local market in Adéta

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 33, married, and has 2 children (ages 7 and 3). She sells cosmetics to earn a monthly income of about $35. She started this business in 2006 and works daily from 6am to 7pm.

In the past, Sarah took out a loan to increase her stock. She now hopes for a new loan to buy more cosmetics once again. She is a member of a loan group called Baraka ("blessing" in Swahili).

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics inventory

loans.name: Lila

texts.es:
Lila sells beer and soft drinks. Since she provides her clients with great service and hospitality, she has decided to expand and implement her business so that her clients feel at ease. Lila is 57 years old and has 6 children who are all independent and have their own families. Her husband, Melvin, is an independent worker and encourages her to continue with her business and move ahead with her plans. But, for Lila to be able expand and implement her business, she needs capital. With your help, Lila will reach her objective in no time.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lila, se dedica a la venta D. cervezas y gaseosas, ella por su buena atención y acogida, se ha plasmado un propósito, ampliar e implementar su negocio para que sus clientes se sientan a gusto. Lila a sus 57 años D. edad, tiene 06 hijos los mismos que ya se independizaron y poseen sus propias familias. Su esposo el señor Melvin, quien es trabajador independiente, la incentiva a seguir con este negocio y que salga adelante.Sin embargo Lila para ampliar e implementar su negocio necesariamente requiere D. un capital para lograr su propósito. Con tu ayuda la señora Lila logrará su objetivo en corto tiempo.

loans.use: To start her business.

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 34 year-old Mwanahawa M., who is married with three children, aged 5, 11, and 12, and has one other dependent, her nephew. In 2003, Mwanahawa established a stationary and secretarial business, and now requests a loan of $275 to purchase printer cartridges and stationary stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

The striking foresight and insight of people who have never received any training in business management is amply demonstrated in stationary sales; most such entrepreneurs strategically place their shops, stalls, or tables close to post offices, banks, schools and universities, thereby succeeding in their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase printer cartridges and stationary stock in bulk.

loans.name: Andrea Francisca

texts.es:
Andrea, who belongs to the lending group, Mujeres Trabajadoras del Campo Ferial de Huaraz ("Working Women of the Huarez Fair Grounds"), makes a living selling alfalfa and regional foods from the coast in the Goyita market in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash. With the S/.500 loan, to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy alfalfa, rice, cooking oil and pasta.

Andrea, 36, is partnered with 4 children. Her partner is a construction worker who works far away. Both work to educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Andrea, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres Trabajadoras del Campo Ferial de Huaraz, se dedica a la venta de alfalfa y alimentos al costado del mercado Comercial Goyita, en el distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas , comprará alfalfa, y 1 saco de arroz, 18 litros de aceite, 10 kg. de fideos.

Ella tienen 36 años de edad , es conviviente tiene 4 hijos, su esposo es albañil trabaja lejos, ambos trabajan para educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
At her own shop in Managua's "municipio" of Ciudad Sandino, Maribel earns a living selling clothes in all shapes and sizes, for both men and women. She also sells cosmetics but in smaller quantities. She's a strong lady who started the business five years ago to fulfill her dream of improving her life and the lives of her young children.

Now, very wisely, Maribel has approached Ceprodel to get a loan with which she'll be able to buy merchandise from her suppliers. It's important to emphasize that the loan will benefit her children as much as it will benefit Maribel. Her credit record includes 4 loans with the institution, paid on time and in accordance with the loan agreements.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Maribel Z. se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo tamaño y para ambos sexos teniendo su establecimiento donde atiende a sus clientes. También vende productos cosméticos pero en menores cantidades. Es una dama muy esforzada que desde hace cinco años que inició el negocio, lo ha venido surtiendo para cumplir su sueño de mejorar su nivel de vida y el de sus pequeños hijos.

Hoy en día muy sabiamente ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito con el cual poder comprar la mercadería a sus proveedores. Es de importancia destacar que con este crédito se beneficia tanto ella como sus pequeños. Actualmente su record crediticio es de 4 créditos con la institución pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: Buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Maiya A. lives with her husband, Mr. Ram Krishna A., and four children. Her husband is a retired officer. All of her children are studying in higher secondary school.
Mrs. Adhikari opened her small food shop five years ago to improve the economic conditions for her family. She sells a variety of food items in her shop, including Nepali food such as dalbhat (rice). She also sells tea and coffee.  The demand for food is increasing in her area.  Therefore, Mrs. Ahikhari is requesting for her first loan of Rs 20000.00 to buy ingredients to produce more food.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to produce more food

loans.name: Sorie's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of (from left to right): Sorie D., Abu-Bakarr K. and John Sahr F.. These men work for the military and are also engaged in either agriculture or business. They are requesting a loan of Le 2,600,000.00. This will be repaid through their monthly military salaries.

Sorie D., 33, is married with 4 children. He will use his loan to invest in business. Abu-Bakarr will invest his in agriculture. He is age 34, born in Banta-Gbenti. He is married with 2 children. And John will invest his loan in business too. He sells food stuffs and has 5 years of experience in the business. John was born in Kailahun District 32 years ago. He is married with 3 children.

loans.use: To expand existing businesses

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 24 years old, is the father of two children who are his inspiration and motivation to move forward. Ahmad is the owner of a grocery store.

Ahmad needs a loan for the amount of USD 1,200 to purchase a wider variety of merchandise to offer a wider choice to his customers and therefore expand his business. This is the first time Ahmad has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: Purchase a wider variety of merchandise to offer a wider choice

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en: Jemimah E. is married and has 1 child. She has received schooling through junior high school. Jemimah sells fish which she buys from the fishermen for processing, the she makes them attractive to her costumers at Elmina, which she has done since 2003. Her husband is a fisherman. Jemimah uses her income to pay for feeding of the family and the payment of their utility bills. Jemimah will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Jemimah plans to help her husband in the putting up of the family house.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to resell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 47 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, desde hace mucho tiempo, su esposo Roldan es trabajador independiente y la apoya mucho en su negocio. Nelly se levanta muy temprano a preparar todas sus prendas para luego llevar a venderlas por diferentes lugares de su zona. Junto a su esposo  trabajan con mucho esmero para ver felices a sus hijos y que en un mañana sean profesionales y hombres de bien.  El objetivo de Nelly  es crecer con su negocio, motivo por el cual solicita este préstamo, para el alquilar un local para la venta de sus prendas, además de comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería. Con tu ayuda logrará su objetivo en muy corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Nelly, 47 years old, is a mother of 2 children has worked selling clothing and shoes for quite some time. Her husband Roldan is an independent worker and helps her a lot with her business. Nelly rises very early to prepare her garments to later sell them in different places in her area. Together with her husband they work with much diligence to see their children happy and that in the future they be professional, good men. Nelly's objective is to grow her business, which is why she is requesting this loan in order to rent a location to sell her garments, as well as buying a larger quantity of merchandise. With your help she will achieve her goal in very little time.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent a location to sell clothing and shoes and increase her merchandise

loans.name: Katherine Gina

texts.es:
Katherine es socia de Banco Comunal San Gabriel.
Katherine es conviviente, tiene 20 años y 2 hijos de 4 y 1 año, el mayor de sus hijos está en el jardín. 
Katherine tiene su negocio de comida, prepara desayuno, ella  empezó con este negocio  hace 7 años. Catherine reparte desayuno a obras que le hacen pedidos . 
Katherine necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de insumos para la comidas y desayunos que va a repartir. Ella antes vendía pasteles, dulces, pero vio que ganaba mas en las comidas.
Katherine sueña con poner un restaurante, ya que sabe preparar ricos desayunos, comidas y también dulces .
texts.en:
Katherine is a partner in the Saint Gabriel Community Bank. She is 20 years old and lives with her partner. Katherine has two children. Her four year old is in kindergarten, and she also has a one year old. Katherine sells meals, a business which she started seven years ago. She prepares meals and delivers breakfasts by request. She needs a loan of 400 soles which she'll use to buy ingredients for her meals. She used to sell pastries and candies, but saw that she could earn more by selling meals. Katherine dreams of having a restaurant, because she now knows how to prepare delicious breakfasts, meals, and sweets.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Katherine needs a loan of 400 soles, which she'll invest in ingredients for her meals. She used to sell pastries and sweets, but she saw that she could earn more money by selling meals.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia T. is a 32-year-old married woman with two kids. She lives with her family in Teshie in the Greater Accra region of Ghana. To earn a living, she sells eggs in her neighborhood. she makes her sales through 'hawking', a term used to describe door-to-door sales. She balances her goods of eggs on her head and moves to the door steps of her loyal customers. She says that the price of eggs has almost doubled over the last few months and this dwindled her working capital. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of eggs in bulk in order to avoid the constant price hikes. She hopes that the loan would enable her to make more income during this Christmas season, save more money to support her kids in school. Leticia is a member of the group known as the Macedonia Trust Group." In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Jesús Q. Q. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con sus dos hijos ya que su esposa falleció.
El señor Jesús comercializa llamas que compra en la región del altiplano y los vende en una población distante a dos días arreando el ganado.
El crédito es para la compra de una mayor cantidad de llamas pues no cuenta con suficiente capital para que le salga ganancias que le permitan subsistir.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Jesús Q. Q. Lives in his own home in the Pasankeri neighborhood on the west side of the city of La Paz. He is a widower and lives with his two children.

Jesus sells llamas, which he buys in the highlands of western Bolivia. He then shepherds the herd of llamas to a town two days away, where he sells them. This loan will be used to buy more llamas, since Jesus doesn't have enough investment money to earn enough to live on.

This is the third time Jesus has requested a loan from IMPRO. He has received a good credit score following a socioeconomic analysis, so he qualifies to receive this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more llamas

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua K. is forty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to nine children – six boys and three girls.
