She says three of her children have completed junior high school and have yet to pursue senior high school. Two are temporarily working, but the rest are still in the basic school. The three daughters, however, are learning a trade.

Akua’s husband is a maize farmer. She lives with her family in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is a farming and commercial town. The majority of the inhabitants are either farmers or sell in farm produce. Akua is an entrepreneur. She sells mainly maize. She buys bags of maize from the farmers in her community and nearby villages. She says city dwellers come to buy it with big cargo trucks and go to retail to food vendors in the big cities. She also sells in the local market.

Akua has been in business for six years. With the loan, she wants to purchase maize in bulk so she can supply to an increasing number of customers and increase her profit margin. She yearns to help some of her children to climb the academic ladder to enjoy better life opportunities.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize for re-sale

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Cabañas Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of seventeen women who work in the Cabañas neighborhood of the city of Caacupé. The women do a number of different types of work, but this does not affect the high level of coordination within the group. At this time, the women have reached their eleventh loan cycle with the Women Entrepreneurs program at Fundacion Paraguaya, and they maintain a line of credit of 740,000 Guaranís (about US$ 150) per member.

The group was formed during early meetings at the home of Mrs. Ninfa V., who learned about the idea from a cousin who is involved with another group. With this information, the women began to organize themselves and soon afterward, they had the initial fifteen members that are necessary to form a group.

Mrs. Ada A., president of the group, acknowledges that during the committee's first cycles, it was somewhat difficult for the group to come to a consensus as there were always many disparate opinions. Nevertheless, as time passed, the group was strengthened and today it is characterized by harmony and a mutual respect among all the members. The members believe that there is a simple factor that allows a committee to be successful: each member should stay committed to the objectives they set, individually and as a member of the group.

loans.use: purchase of milk, sugar, starch, cheese, drinks, and men's and women's clothing

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Sou N., 43, is married and lives with her husband in Battambang province. To earn a living, she sells grocery products and vegetables in the market and is able to make US$ 4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and makes US$ 3.50 every day. This couple has four children, three of whom are students and one who is employed as a waiter.

Sou N. would like to purchase rice and take off the husks with the intention of re-selling the rice and turning a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice to husk for sale

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
Nicaragua se caracteriza por ser una tierra donde todas las mujeres son muy trabajadoras, tale s el caso de la señora María Luisa M. el cual elabora tortillas y las vende a diario para así mantener a su hijo por ser madre soltera.

Ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de la materia prima como lo es el maíz para elaborar las tortillas y por esta razón es que espera muy confiadamente para así dar lugar a la compra de esta materia primar para la elaboración de las tortillas.
texts.en:
Nicaragua is known as a land where the women are very hardworking, such as María Luisa M. who makes tortillas and sells them daily in order to support her son as she is a single mother. She is looking for Ceprodel's help in the form of a loan to buy basic ingredients such as corn to prepare tortillas and because of this is very confident that she will be able to be in a position to buy this basic ingredient to make her tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare tortillas

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi T. is 42 years old. She is married and has three children who are pursuing education in junior and senior high schools. Esi’s husband is a welder by profession. He farms as well. Esi and the family live at a family house at Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Oda are either farm or trade in farm products. Very few people in this area run different types of businesses. 

Esi trades in second-hand textiles. She buys textile fabrics and all kinds of second-hand clothes including bed spreads, ladies’ wear and men’s wear, etc from Accra, the capital city. She then sells these items in the market square in her community. She says she also treks to nearby markets to sell. Esi has been in this business for barely year now and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy textiles in bales. 

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to purchase better quality stock to serve a larger market and eventually, help to improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called “hwe Nyame” (translated, Look unto the Lord) Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy bales of second hand textiles to sell.

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en:
Titilayo sells grocery provisions in retail to her customers. She hopes to obtain a loan amount of N50,000 to allow her to purchase more provisions to sell. She is 35 years old and married with six children.

Titilayo sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигине Камоловой 43 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж работает в России. Она же занимается земледелием. В этом ей помогают дети. Нигина сеет в основном овощи, а потом продает их на рынке. Этим видом деятельности она занимается более 10 лет. Клиентка просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить минералы и семена. И использовав их собрать благоприятный посев для продажи.
texts.en:
Nigina K. is 43 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is currently working in Russia and she herself grows vegetables for the local market. Her children help her in taking care of the crops. Negina has 10 years of experience growing vegetables and would like to take out this loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds. This will allow her to harvest an abundant crop for sale this season.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Zilda Claudia

texts.es:
Zilda es socia del Banco Comunal Capulí.
Zilda es casada, tiene 58 años y 4 hijos, Zilda es profesora cesante del nivel primaria, y actualmente viene dictando clases particulares D. reforzamiento en su casa o en ocasiones en casa D. sus alumnos. Además Zilda venD. ropa variada y también teje chompas, colchas a pedido.
Zilda necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. polos, pantalones para niños.
Zilda sueña con mejorar su casa, tener una tienda comercial e irse D. viaje D. descanso junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Zilda is a member of the Banco Comunal Capulí [Community Bank of Capulí]. Zilda is married, 58 years old and has four children. Zilda is an unemployed elementary school teacher. Currently, she gives private tutor lessons from her home and sometimes at the home of her students. Additionally, Zilda sells various types of clothes and also sews sweaters and quilts on request. Zilda needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Soles that will be invested in buying shirts and pants for children. Zilda dreams of improving her home, having a storefront and going on a trip with her husband to relax.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shirts and pants for children.

loans.name: Prossy's Group

texts.en:
Prossy N. is the leader of the Gift group in Nazigo. She is 45 years old and a business woman who has dealt in making half cakes from her home in Nazigo for ten years. She is a married with four children and works with her husband to ensure that the best quality and quantity is attained while the children attend their schools.

With her loan, she intends to buy baking flour, sugar, and other ingredients to make more half cakes. Her customers are mainly schools, shops, and supermarkets that buy in plenty, plus individuals that buy as retailers. She is happy that the loans are helping.

loans.use: To buy baking flour, sugar, and other ingredients to make more half cakes

loans.name: Jesus Is Lord Group

texts.en:
Angelina is thirty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. She is a trader and runs a provision store. She has her store on the street in her community. Angelina is the leader of a trust bank group called “Jesus is Lord”. She is first from the left in the group photograph.

Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and or farmers. They work to support their spouses to provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for sometime and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses. It is the hearts’ desire of the group members to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock for her store

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
49-year old Lilia C. is a corn-grower. She has a farm which is 2.2 hectares (5.5 acres) in size. She has two children and she is working so hard to provide all the needs in their home. When her husband died, she learned to be strong for her family. She manages the farm so that she will have enough money to support the education of her children.

Now, Lilia is wondering if there’s a way that she could increase the size of her harvest. She thinks of buying the farm necessities so that the corn will grow healthier and bigger. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to buy two sacks of ammonium sulfate fertilizer and a piglet to start a piggery. 

Lilia chose the services of CEVI because of its credit plus its education. Every time they have a cluster meeting, CEVI teaches women to become leaders by empowering them to preside during the gathering. CEVI also offers training and insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of ammonium sulfate fertilizer and a piglet

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: seynabou N. habite a camberene et est vendeuse de cacahuettes.elle exerce cette activite depuis 1984.elle est parent beneficiaire depuis 19 ans.elle sollicite un pret de cent mille(100 000)pour augmenter son fonds acheter le produit qu'elle commercialise aun prix plus competitif et ainsi maximiser ses profits.son activite lui permet d'assurer la depense quotidienne.
texts.en:
Seynabou N. lives in Camberene and is a retailer of peanuts. She has run this business since 1984. She has been a parent client for 19 years. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 FCFA to increase her capital to buy the products that she sells at a more competitive price, and thereby maximize her profits. Her business allows her to meet her daily expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell goods

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina C. has two children. The eldest is 43 years old and already married.

Cristina’s business is rice farming, and this keeps her busy every day. Currently, she has less than a hectare (2.5 acres) of rice field. The average size of her harvest is ninety sacks, which is helpful enough in buying her needs.

Cristina is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI ). She will use the loan to finance all her farming needs. She will also use some of her loan to raise chickens or start another business that she likes.

Cristina said, she likes the credit policies of CEVI. Aside from the low interest rate of 2% a month, CEVI has good field staff who implement the program.

loans.use: To finance all her farming needs and to raise chickens or start another business

loans.name: Lormilita

texts.en: Lormilita A. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 34 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Lormilita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Lormilita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Lormilita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Kelli Consuelo

texts.es: Kelli Consuelo G. R. de 27 años de edad, reside en Santa Catalina del departamento de Sonsonate. Kelli vive junto a sus padres, con su esposo y sus dos hijos menores de edad. Kelli ayuda a su esposo con los ingresos que obtienen de su negocio, una tienda de granos básicos y productos de consumo, la familia de G. es muy conocida en el pueblo por ser personas honradas y muy trabajadoras. El deseo de Kelli y su esposo es poder comprar su propia casa, pero para ello necesitan de muchos ahorros es por eso que Kelli desea surtir su negocio, para poder aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Kelli Consuelo G. R., 27, lives in Santa Catalina in the Sonsonate department. Kelli lives with her parents, her husband, and their two minor children. Kelli helps her husband with the income they get from her business, a store selling basic grains and consumable products. The Gracía family is very well known in the town for being honorable and very hard working people. Kelli and her husband wish to be able to buy their own house. To do so they need a lot of savings. That is why Kelli wants to stock her business to be able to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie E. is from the village of Barangay 3, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old. Marjorie is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Marjorie sells clothing & shoe products in the local community. Marjorie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marjorie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marjorie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marjorie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and supplement the income for her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Shinehuu

texts.en:
S. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Gobi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her son, 12, attends a local secondary school while her daughter, 2, still stays at home. With the help of her husband, S. operates a grocery business in her town. She began her business in 2000 with a small shop and now her working capital exceeds 10,000,000 tugrug (~7000 USD). She travels to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, twice per month in order to purchase goods for her business. 

Since beginning her business, she has been able to purchase a car and a microbus as well as hire two salespeople for the shop. She has received two loans from Khaan bank in the past and has proven herself to be a trustworthy customer by paying back the loans in full and on time. She is a very hardworking person who wants to keep growing her business in the future. S. is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan in order to purchase a large amount of products for her shop.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of products for her shop.

loans.name: Badamdorj

texts.en:
Badamdorj J. is 54 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Khovd province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His oldest son and daughter, ages 22 and 20, are university students, and his youngest daughter is 16 years old and a high school student.

Badamdorj operates a food cafe with the help of his wife in his town. His cafe specializes in a variety of traditional Mongolian dishes including Buuz (steamed dumplings), Huushuur (fried flour pockets filled with meat) and Lapsha (noodle soup). Badamdorj started his business in 2005 by renting an apartment to open his cafe. He has grown and improved his cafe over the years and today has a consistent operation. His earnings have allowed him to purchase a house for his oldest son and pay the tuition of his youngest two children. For the future, Badamdorj hopes to one day own his own apartment to operate his cafe, and is always looking for other ways to better his business. He says, "I would like to buy a cow and begin producing milk and other dairy products which I can use in my cafe." Badamdorj is requesting a 400,000 tugrug loan to purchase a cow in order to produce dairy products for use in his cafe.

About XacBank:
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva's 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Omina

texts.en:
Omina J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal in a market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Omina is 48 years old and is married with a husband who is a primary teacher. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a charcoal store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en:
Eveline M. is from the village of Alibagu. She is 35 years old. Eveline is married. To make a living, Eveline owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products from Avon in the local community. Eveline earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eveline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eveline is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Eveline from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly comprised of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Hélène M. est âgée de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Son activité consiste à faire du petit commerce d’huile de palme, de balaie et de poisson séchés. Elle voudrait augmenter son capital et avec les revenus générés participer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Hélène M., age 46, is married and the mother of eight children. Her business consists in retailing palm oil, brooms, and dried fish. She would like to increase her working capital and use her income to help with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To retail palm oil, brooms, and dried fish

loans.name: Myrcea Stefhany

texts.es:
Stefhany es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Stefhany es soltera y tiene 21 años, Stefhany tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa variada, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Stefhany necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa.
Los sueños de Stefhany es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Stefhany is a member of the Communal Bank "Las Gaviotas" ["The Seagulls"]. Stefhany is single, and she is 21 years old. Stefhany has a stall in the 12th April market where she sells various items of clothing. She performs this activity daily. Stefhany needs a 2,000 PEN loan to invest in the purchase of clothing. Stefhany's dream is to increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 44-year-old married man with five unemployed children who still go to school.

Ali has been working as a builder since 1990. He takes on home projects upon request of his clients and works through other entrepreneurs. He works hard to satisfy the heavy family needs.

Today, Ali is requesting $1,000 to buy a concrete mixer track to increase his work productivity.

loans.use: To buy a concrete mixer track

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie T. is a bona fide resident of Butuay Jimenez Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Melanie is married and has two children who are now adult-aged. To make a living, Melanie owns and operates a manufacturing venture. Melanie has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Melanie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. Melanie is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the second taken out by Melanie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: For additional capital for her business

loans.name: Tserendolgor

texts.en:
Tserendolgor is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in an apartment which they own. Her son and daughter both attend a local secondary school. 

Tserendolgor operates a second-hand product trading business in her area. She sells a variety of second-hand clothes and blankets. During the summer months, she uses her truck to travel to the surrounding countryside to sell her products. Tserendolgor started selling second-hand goods in 2006 and has steadily grown her business over the years. She is an honest person and has a great communication skills. 

She has many goals for the future and says, “I would like to renovate my summer house into a winter house before my two children become university students. For this reason, I must increase my working capital and profit.” Tserendolgor is requesting a 700,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase a variety of second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 51 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a sus dos menores hijas, a quienes desea dar una mejor vida.

Los hermosos campos del poblado de Villa Visca han sido para María el lugar que la vio crecer y formar su familia. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la chacra y ahora tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivas sus alverjas, papas y choclos, lleva 26 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el lugar donde los vende en el mercado de la ciudad. Con el tiempo, espera tener un pequeño puesto en el mercado, ya que siente que pierde mucho al vender sus productos al por mayor.

Este es el quinto préstamo de María con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Dentro su banco comunal siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de alverja, ya que este producto se está vendiendo muy bien en el mercado.
texts.en:
Maria, 51, is a hardworking and unassuming woman. She lives in her own home with her 2 youngest daughters, for whom she wants to provide a better life. The beautiful countryside of the Villa Visca village has been, for Maria, a good place to start a family and see it grow. From the time she was very small her parents taught her to work on the farm, and now she has her own lands on which she works with a lot of care and sacrifice. What she likes most about her work is to cultivate peas, potatoes and corn. She has been doing this for 26 years, and what she considers most difficult is to transport her products to the place where they are sold in the market in the city. With time, she hopes to have a small stall in the market, since she feels that she loses out a lot by selling her products at wholesale. This is the 5th loan that Maria has taken from MFP. She knows that she has the responsibility to make all of her payments on time, and she is ready to do this. Within her communal bank she is always aware of all of the agreements that they have reached as a group. With the 2,000 Peruvian soles requested she will buy pea seeds, since this product is selling very well in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pea seeds

loans.name: Zoljargal

texts.en: Zoljargal is 22 years old and lives with her mother, sibling and 1-year-old daughter in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Her mother is a cook in a gold mining company. Her 1-year-old daughter stays at home with her sibling. Zoljargal operates a computer gaming center in a rental place at a local trading center. Her customers play games including Xbox and Playstation in her gaming center. She started her business in October, 2009, and her business has been becoming popular in her province. Furthermore, Zoljargal has been planning to operate movie rental business for extra income for her family. She has been working hard to stabilize and expand her business. Zoljargal is an open person and says, “I would like to study in a university and to have a profession. After that I will build financial security for my family.” She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~ 362 USD) loan to purchase movies for a movie rental business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail O. is a 32 year-old married man from Gaza. He lives with his wife and four children.

In 2009, Ismail opened a small shop selling accessories and children's clothes. He hopes that with this loan, he will be able to buy all that he lacks for his shop.  He hopes that this will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy accessories and children's clothes.

loans.name: Sanilyn

texts.en: Sanilyn E. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 39 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Sanilyn owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. In 2007, Sanilyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Sanilyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and seed. This loan will be her eighth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's school fees. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn M. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 38 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Arlyn owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling candies, some food for snacks, noodles, sugar, salt, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Arlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Xynthia

texts.en:
Xynthia E. is from the village of Langcataon, Pangantucan Bukidnon. She is 33 years old. Xynthia is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Xynthia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Xynthia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Xynthia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Xynthia is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Xynthia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda A. is from the village of San Isidro, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Rosalinda is married and has 11 adult children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from planting, harvesting and selling different kinds of flowers in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosalinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used for maintenance and for the  improvement of the business. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a new variety of flower seedlings and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rosalinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new variety of flower seedlings and as working capital

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY YUNGAQUI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Anta de la provincia  Anta y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Luisa; ella tiene 60 años de edad y La socia es natural de Iscuchaka, Ella esa casada y tiene 1 hijo, y su conyugue es agricultor y ella se dedica al comercio minorista y compra y vende granos (maíz diferentes variedades, frejol, habs, pallares); La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio, minorista, la socia vende lo que su esposo produce en sus terrenos, el produce maíz y habas, pero también ella compra otros productos secos de otros proveedores, la socia vende en un stand en el mercado de Iscuchaka en el distrito de Anta. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar al por mayor los productos que su esposo no produce y así continuar con su negocio.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Luisa belongs to the community bank "Señor de Ccoyllority Yungaqui". She lives in the district of Anta in the Anta province in the state of Cusco. Luisa is 60 years old and is a native of Iscuchaka. She is married and has one son. Her spouse is a farmer, and she dedicates herself to the retail business. She buys and sells grains (including different varieties of corn, kidney beans, broad beans, and butter beans). Luisa alternates her home activities with her business tasks. She sells what her husband produces on their land, corn and broad beans. However, Luisa also buys dried products from other providers. She sells her products from a stand in the Iscuchaka market, in the district of Anta. Luisa is requesting this loan so that she can purchase at wholesale the products that her husband doesn't produce and in this way continue her business. Luisa values and is very grateful for the loan granted to her since it allows her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. Likewise, she promises to pay back her installments in the time period stipulated.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale the products that her husband does not produce

loans.name: Mas Que Vencedores Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. OLGA TIENE 36 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE DOS PEQUEÑOS HIJOS. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "MAS QUE VENCEDORES", FORMADO POR SIETE INTEGRANTES TODOS RESIDENTES DE LA ZONA DE LA BALANZA EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS. SUS COMPAÑEROS LA ELIGIERON COMO TESORERA DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
LA SRA. OLGA SE DEDICA DIARIAMENTE A SU TRABAJO COMO SECRETARIA Y EN SUS TIEMPOS LIBRES APOYA A SU MAMÁ EN SU TALLER DE COSTURA Y CONFECCIONES.
HACE DOCE AÑOS, EN LA CASA DE SU MAMÁ INCIÓ ÉSTE TALLER CON EL FIN DE APOYAR A SU MAMÁ ECONÓMICAMENTE, YA QUE COMO TRABAJADORA DEPENDIENTE NO TIENE MUCHOS INGRESOS POR LO TANTO NO LE ALCANZABA EL DINERO PARA SUSTENTAR LOS GASTOS DE SU MADRE.
HOY EN DÍA HA CONSEGUIDO BRINDARLE UNA ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA A SU MAMÁ Y SOBRETODO UNA ACTIVIDAD QUE LA HACE SENTIR BIEN Y ÚTIL, HA PODIDO COMPRAR SUS ARTEFACTOS E IMPLEMENTAR UN POCO MÁS EL TALLER.
UNO DE SUS MAS GRANDES DESEOS ES PODER ADQUIRIR UN TERRENO Y LOGRAR TENER SU CASA PROPIA.
EL PRÉSTAMOS SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES COMO TELA, HILOS, BOTONES PARA SURTIR DE MATERIAL SU TALLER.
texts.en:
Olga is 36 years old and has 2 small children. She is a member of the group "Mas que Vencedores." This group has 7 members who all reside in the La Balanza neighborhood in the Comas district. Her fellow group members elected her to the position of treasurer on the board of directors of the group. Olga works daily at her job as a secretary, and in her free time she supports her mother in her dressmaking workshop. Twelve years ago she set up this workshop in her mother's house with the goal of helping her mother economically, since as a dependent worker she did not have much income and was lacking the money needed to support the expenses of her mother. Today, she has managed to provide a stable economic situation for her mother, and above all, it is an activity that makes her feel good and useful. She has been able to buy her equipment and gradually improve the setup of her workshop. One of Olga's main desires is to be able to acquire some land and manage to have her own home. The loan requested will be invested in materials such as fabric, thread and buttons to supply her workshop with materials.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will buy fabric to support her mother in her sewing workshop

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia B. is from the village of Segatic Daku ClariN Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Cecilia is married and has two grown children. 

To make a living, Cecilia owns and operates a business providing transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle transport "motorcab" services. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2004, Cecilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her vehicles so she can provide better service. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Cecilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her vehicles so she can provide better service.

loans.name: Kyaterekera Development Group-Mpigi

texts.en:
She belongs to Kyaterekera Group-Mpigi.

35-year-old N. Sumayiya has a graceful persona that has endeared her to her retail shop customers for the last five years in Mpigi. Her general merchandise shop has been a melting pot of sorts with a variety customers patronizing her shop for goods. Ugandans are well known for their hospitality and here is a clear example of one. 

Sumayiya has taken it further in applying this to her business. In many ways she has been a benefactor of this. This high-spirited woman, who began with inspiration from a friend, says she makes about $44 a week. With the support of this loan she wants to buy more bags of sugar, maize flour, rice, beans, bars of soap, soft drinks, cups, candles, etc. for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of sugar, maize flour, rice, beans, etc. to resell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine R. is from the village of Pontod, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old. Josephine is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary Y. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, onions and beans and is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes and onions to sell.  Mary is 38 years old and is married to a business man. She has 3 children and 2 of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Nuela

texts.en: Nuela S. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Nuela is 28 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has three children but only one out of her children goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N., a married mother of two children, both students, lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. For the past eight years, working six days a week, Harriet has operated a business selling second-hand shoes at the market. She also generates additional income through roasting sweet potatoes and maize in the evening. Harriet is requesting a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second hand shoes.

Harriet's main business challenge is seasonality. Her business goal is to start importing second-hand shoes. Harriet lives in a home that she rents with access to neither electricity nor piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food for the family

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand shoes

loans.name: Challenge Group

texts.en:
Samson M. is in his early thirties and married, with one child. Samson has been running a secondhand clothing business for the past ten years. He buys his clothes in the market area of Kariakoo and sells them door-to-door in Karume. He works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and earns a low monthly profit. 

This will be Samson's second loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his first loan to increase his stock of clothes and has now successfully repaid this loan. With his second loan, Samson again hopes to refill his stock and ensure that he has enough goods to meet demand for his products. Samson's dream is to one day open his own shop from which he can sell his clothes. 

Samson will share this loan with his loan group Challenge, which consists of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. In the photo, Samson can be seen in the back row in a striped shirt.

loans.use: to increase his stock

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Flor de María tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Pocitos del distrito de Mórrope, una localidad ubicada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo caracterizada por que sus pobladores son personas humildes y trabajadoras.

Ella cuenta con animales menores los cuales cría en su domicilio, alimentándolos de granos y pastos naturales. Cuando sus animales se desarrollan completamente los ofrece en venta en su domicilio al publico en general y a los diferentes negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde reside. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ella se encarga de ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Flor desea adquirir material de construcción para hacer algunas mejoras en su domicilio. Por ello ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Flor de María is 48 years old.  She is married and lives together with her family in the village of Pocitos, in Mórrope district, more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo.  This area is noted for the fact that its residents are modest and hard-working people.

Flor owns young animals which she raises at home, feeding them grains and natural fodder.  When her animals have developed fully she offers them for sale from her home to the general public and the different traders who always visit her district.  She uses the income she makes from this business to help her husband to financially support their family.

Flor would like to acquire building materials so that she can make some improvements to her home.  For this reason, she has decided to request a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa as this will help her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy building material so that she can make some structural improvements to her home

loans.name: Joel Alberto

texts.es: Joel Alberto T. C. de 27 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y una hija, con quienes reside Jiquilisco en el departamento de Usulután. Él es un padre muy responsable el cual desea con todo su corazón brindarles una mejor vida a su hija y a su esposa. Joel posee un taller en el cual se dedica a reparar bicicletas, y así mismo a vender accesorios para estas. Joel es muy conocido en la zona ya que elabora un muy buen trabajo y así mismo a precios bajos por lo que la mayoría de personas lo prefieren. Él solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda comprar todo lo necesario para equipar su taller como herramientas, rines, llantas, espejos, luces y otros accesorios más. Todo esto lo hace con el enorme deseo de salir adelante y contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Joel Alberto T. C. is 27 years old, and lives with his wife and one daughter. They live in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután. He is a very responsible father, and he wishes with all of his heart to offer a better life for his daughter and his wife. Joel has a workshop where he repairs bicycles, and also sells accessories for bikes. Joel is very well-known in the region since he does very good work, and his prices are low, so the majority of the people prefer him.

He is requesting a loan from Integral so that he can buy everything necessary to equip his shop, such as: tools, bicycle rims, bicycle tires, mirrors, lights, and other accessories. He does all of this with a great desire to get ahead and have a better life.

loans.use: To buy tools to repair bicycles

loans.name: Chynar's Group

texts.en:
Chynar B. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Bokonbaevo, a nice village in Isykul region. She is 34 and married to a constructor. Together they bring up a son, 7, who studies at school. In order to earn money to cover family expenses with the initial investment of 15000 soms Chynar started to sell apples a year ago. In this way, she earns 6000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to save money and make house repairs. Chynar hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase one ton of apples in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future she wants to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase apples for resale

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina, tiene 54 años y viven juntos con sus hijos en la ciudad del Cusco. Cristina ha estudiado la carrera técnica de contabilidad y actualmente desempeña su profesión. Ya son varios años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Cristina con el microcrédito aumentara el dinero para la construcción de un edificio. 
 
Cristina pertenece al banco comunal “Kukuli” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal tiene cuatro años de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Cristina is 54 years old; she lives with her children in the city of Cusco. Cristina has a degree in accounting and at present is working in her field. She has worked for several years on her profession and does very well thanks to her hard work.

Cristina with the microloan will increase the money for the construction of a building.

Cristina belongs to the “Kukuli” Communal Bank of the UMF Arariwa Association of the city of Cusco, Perú. The Communal Bank has been in operation for four years and is well managed by its governing board.

loans.use: For the construction of a building.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 44 year-old married man, father of four kids, who is working as an insurance broker for 17 years. He opened his own brokering office 6 years ago,in order to make a good start to a direct insurance provider, then to the dream insurance company.  Mahmoud is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, for the third time, in order to pay for the necessary maintenance to his office. Mahmoud is a good-standing borrower whose previous loans helped in improving his business as well as his social situation. Mahmoud is well known in the region and most of his clients recommend dealing with him. He hopes to open his own insurance company in the future and has his children work with him to expand his business.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance to his office

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en:
Nariman lives in a refugee camp near Ramallah City. Nariman's husband runs a grocery store in the refugee camp. Since refugee camps have large populations, such businesses bring good income to families. Nariman took out a loan from FATEN as her husband wants to enrich the store by adding to the items he sells.

Nariman has five sons and three daughters. Nariman's brother appears in the picture here as she is a conservative woman and refused to post her picture on the web.

loans.use: To purchase a large variety of grocery items

loans.name: Davi

texts.en:
Davi R. is married and has two children. She has not received any form of education. For six years, Davi has been selling corn dough in Takoradi near Effiakuma Estate.

Her husband is a caterer and Davi uses her income to help him with some household expenses. Davi will use the loan to purchase more maize to expand her business. For further growth, she wants to reinvest her profit back into her business.

In this photograph, she is taking out some of the corn dough into a measuring cup to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to expand her business

loans.name: Camino De Victoria 4 Group

texts.en:
Zenaida is the coordinator of her group, Camino D. Victoria 4 (Road to Victory). She makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and two children. She says that her most difficult challenge was to have her own business. In the meantime, she plans to continue to enjoy watching television.

Zenaida is excited to be taking her first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying sandals, slippers and jewels. She will use the profits for savings because the family needs to build a house and her husband's income only provides for basic expenses. Zenaida dreams of having her own home, in a good structure, safe and beautiful, and thanks to her business and to Esperanza loans, she hopes that her dream will become reality.

This associate began with Esperanza because she wanted her business to succeed. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Santiago.

loans.use: to buy sandals, slippers and jewels

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Doña Emilia es habitantante de un lugar llamado Tierra Blanca el cual es mas conocido como la novia del sol, ya que ademas de ser una region ganadera es uno de los lugares donde hace mas calor del estado de Veracruz.  Doña Emilia tiene la edad de 49 años, solo estudio la primaria y se encuentra casada con el señor Bernardo el cual trabaja como albañil, ella tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya estan casados y actualmente solo vive con su esposo .

Doña emilia nos platica que hace mas de 8 años ella y su esposo juntaron sus ahorros para poder poner una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes la cual lleva el nombre de "abarrotes la esquinita".

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, sopa, jabon, pasta dental, refrescos, dulces, cafe, galletas, jugos, veladoras, crema, queso, tomates, chiles, cebolla, papel higienicas y chiles enlatados para resurtir su negocio. 

Ella nos dice "a mi me gusta tener un poquito de todo en mi tienda para no perder clientes y siempre que vengan a comprar encuentren lo que busquen ademas de dar un buen servio"

ella espera tener buenas ganancias ya que desa seguir invirtiendo para que su negocio cresca cada dia
texts.en:
Doña Emilia is a resident of a place called Tierra Blanca, which is also known as “The Bride of the Sun”. In addition to being a livestock region, it is one of the warmest places in the State of Veracruz. Doña Emilia is 49 years old and only has an elementary school education. She is married to Sr. Bernardo, who works as a mason, and has four children who are already married. At the moment, she and her husband live by themselves.

Doña Emilia says that she and her husband used their savings to start a small grocery store called “Abarrotes La Esquinita” (The Corner Grocery). She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of rice, beans, oil, soup, soap, toothpaste, soft drinks, candy, coffee, cookies, juices, candles, cream, cheese, tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, toilet paper, and canned peppers to restock her business.

Emilia says, “I like to have a little bit of everything in my store so that I won’t lose customers. They always come to shop because they can find everything and I provide them good service.” She hopes to generate good revenues so that she can continue investing in her business and grow each day.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Jyldyzkan's Group

texts.en:
Jyldyzkan S. is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Karabalta, a small town near to Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan).  She is 44 and married. Together with her husband she is bringing up four sons. Two older sons study at university and the others are at school. In order to earn money to meet family needs, eight years ago Jyldyzkan started to breed poultry and then sell it on the market with an initial investment of 300 soms. In this way the family earns 20000 soms per month. 

Jyldyzkan applied for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase more chickens for breeding. In the future she wants to give her sons good educations, purchase a vehicle and build a big house for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 29 years old and single. She sells spare parts in her business. Her business is well-organized. She has 1 year's experience in her business and she starts her work from 6am until 10pm every day. Chantal is currently employs one person to help her.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lender via vision finance company in order to purchase more spare parts to sell. With the extra profits, Chantal will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Los Alfa 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Emilio has a wife and 7 children, only 5 of them live together. He belongs to the Los Alfa (The Alpha) 1, 2 & 3 group. The group is based in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town. 

Emilio will use this loan to buy different medical products, especially natural products. He started this business 1 month ago, after he was using these medicines and having great results.  He became a partner to sell them with a catalog.  Now he will buy the most common products for inventory and sale.  He is excited about his first loan with Kiva's partner Esperanza. 

Emilio will use the profits to invest in his business and save, also he would like to help build his community church. He is a pastor and his favorite thing is to serve others.  His dreams are to serve the Lord forever and teach others the Love of God. 

His most important challenges are to help build the church and to help his family to live better.

There are two group pictures to show all of the members of the group.

loans.use: to buy different medical products

loans.name: Duo Mujeres De Negocio Group

texts.es:
Duo Mujeres D. Negocio:
La señora Santa  Lucia  D.  44 años D. edad se dedica a  la venta D.  Cosmeticos y  jugos  D. naranja  desD. hace 15 años,  ella inicio su negocio  con la ayuda D. una amiga  y ahora necesita otro refinanciamiento D. crédito   para comprar más Cosmeticos  y así mismo   tener diferente productos y marcas,  ahora necesita  también para invertir  más en naranjas que por el tiempo  el precio D. las mismas es más alta su deseo ahora es poder comprar una  mesa  D. acero inoxidable  para poder ofrecer  su productos mas a la vista
La señora candelaria   tiene  48 años D. edad   y su negocio es una tortillería  que lo tiene desD. hace  5 años  ella inicio su negocio con el apoyo D. su esposo  tiene 2 hijos menores D. edad que aun están estudiando  y  una mayor D. edad que ya está casada   ella necesita otro  segundo crédito para poder comprar más maíz y leña, y ahora quiere también invertir más en leña y frijol   y así vender en su casa  y incrementar mas sus ingresos   su deseo ahorra es poder comprar    una estufa para   dejar D. utilizar la leña.
texts.en:
'Mujeres D. Negocio' (Businesswomen) group

Santa Lucia is 44 years old.  She has been selling cosmetics and orange juice for 15 years.  She started her business with the help of a friend and she needs this loan in order to buy more cosmetics so that she can have available different products and brands.  She also needs to invest more in oranges as their price is higher at this time of year.  She would like to be able to buy a stainless steel table so that she can put her products clearly on display.

Candelaria is 48 years old and her business is a tortilla bakery which she has owned for five years.  She started her business with the support of her husband.  She has two dependent children who are still in school and one [a daughter] who is grown up and married.  Candelaria needs a loan to buy more corn and firewood.  She also wants to invest in firewood and beans so that she can sell them from her home and thereby further increase her income.  Candelaria would like to be able to buy a stove so that she can stop using firewood.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and to buy firewood and corn for making tortillas

loans.name: Igor

texts.ru:
Игорь женат. Его супругу зовут Ульяна. У них двое замечательных детей. Игорь занимается отопительной техникой: производит, продает, устанавливает. 

Раньше Игорь был обычным рабочим но потом понял, что может работать на себя и начал делать конкретные шаги - открыл свой бизнес. Прошло пять лет. Благодаря его усилиям и предприимчивости сегодня Игорь имеет уже  восемь работников.  Это говорит о том, что Игорь умеет правильно вкладывать деньги. Кроме того, Игорь умный и скромный человек; имеет хорошие взаимоотношения с окружающими.

Игорь  просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен на увеличение количества производимой отопительной техники.  Увеличив доход, Игорь сможет выкупить помещение, которое арендует. Таким образом, вместо того, что бы платить аренду, он будет вкладывать деньги в семью:  улучшение жилищных условий в квартире, будущее образование для детей, которые подрастают.
texts.en:
Igor is married. His wife's name is Ulyana. They have two amazing children. Igor is in the heating equipment business: he produces, sells and installs it.

In the past Igor used to be just a regular worker, but later realized that he can work for himself and started taking specific steps – he opened his own business. Five years have past. Thanks to his efforts and entrepreneurship today Igor already has eight employees. This shows that Igor is able to properly invest money. Besides that Igor is a smart and modest person; he has good relationships with people around him.

Igor is asking to provide him with a loan for 20,000 hrivnas to increase the production volume of heating equipment. By increasing his profits Igor will be able to buy out the premises which he renting. This way instead of paying rent he will invest the money into his family by improving the living conditions in their apartment and the future education of his children who are growing up.

loans.use: to increase the production volume of heating equipment

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells rice porridge in the mornings at Elmina. She serves it with milk, bread and sugar. Mary has received senior high education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer and she supports him to provide her family's basic needs. Her loan will be used to acquire more rice, sugar, milk, etc. to make porridge for sale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits. In this photo, she has some loaves of bread in her hand.

loans.use: to acquire more rice, sugar, milk, etc. to make porridge for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Activas se denomina el excelente grupo D. mujeres conformado en L. ciudad VilL. Elis, gracias a que L. Sra. Anna, contactó con L. asesora en una reunión semanal que L. misma tenía en L. zona, para informarse D. L. forma D. trabajo que tiene el Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras,una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 15 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 4° ciclo,en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro sel programa.
L. Sra Anna se dedica a L. venta D. comidas hace ya varios años. Comenta que todos los dias empieza su jornada desD. muy tempranas horas, prepara todos los alimentos que va a vender. ElL. por medio D. este trabajo ha logrado mantener a su familia. Se siente muy orgullosa D. si misma, ya que gracias a su esfuerzo pudo obtener todo lo que tiene.
ElL. solicita el credito para L. compra D. los insumos que necesita para L. elaboraiocn D. los alimentos, somo ser carnes, huevos, especias, pastas y demas.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Activas" ["Active Women"] is the name of this excellent group of women that formed in the city of VilL. Elis, thanks to Ms. Anna. Anna contacted the adviser at a weekly meeting she had in the area to inform people of how the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program works. Once Anna was educated about the program, she was able to gather 15 women who are now very pleased to be working in their fourth loan cycle. They work with solidarity and in a unified manner within the program.

Ms. Anna has been selling food for many years. She says that every day she starts working at a very early hour, preparing the dishes she will sell. Through this work, she has succeeded in maintaining her family. She feels very proud of this, as she has been able to achieve everything she has thanks to her efforts.

She is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients that she needs for making her dishes, such as meat, eggs, spices, pasta, and others.

loans.use: to buy meat, eggs, spices, pasta, and other ingredients

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean, 56, is married with three adult children. She lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato with her family.

Jean is a farmer and assists her husband in maintaining their rice farm. She helps plant rice crops and in weeding the farm. Two years ago, Jean decided to run a barbecue business. She makes chicken and pork barbecue and sells it to the people in her community. Jean does her best to increase her family income.

Jean has asked for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farming supplies. In the future, she hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Maria Catarina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Catarina es casada, tiene 59 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, estudio los estudios primarios, se dedica al comercio, a la venta de ropa típica, inició este negocio gracias al apoyo de sus hijos, y tiene hasta el momento 3 años de experiencia.

Decide solicitar un préstamo para aumentar su capital de trabajo, compra de ropa típica para reventa, va a comprar cortes, blusas, güipiles, fajas, rebosos, pañuelos, etc. En el futuro quiere ver su negocio prospero.
texts.en:
María Catarina, 59, is married and has two children.  She completed elementary school.  She’s a merchant.  She sells traditional clothing.  She started the business thanks to help from her children and to date has acquired three years of experience.

She decided to request a loan to increase her working capital buying traditional clothing to resell.  She will buy fabric, blouses, skirts, sashes, shawls, handkerchiefs, etc.  She wants to see her business be prosperous in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 26 years old, married and blessed with an eight-month-old child.  He runs a land bureau business to earn a living.  He also distributes cakes to earn extra income.  He was previously employed before he went into business.  Through Faulu Kenya, he was also able to get capital to start a farming business.

Joseph hopes to grow his businesses and employ people.  He has requested 60,000 Kenya shillings to start a motorbike transport business.

loans.use: To start a motorbike transport business.

loans.name: Anu

texts.en:
Anu, a 31-year-old married mother of an eight-year-old, established her tailoring business in 2005. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supoorts her family. Having already received and repaid three loans from Patan BPW, she will use her new one to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, Anu plans to improve the economic condition of her family, and she thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase their production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Tu

texts.en:
Tu is the mother of three children, two sons and one daughter. She is 59 years old and lives with her children in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns a living selling beverages in her community. Tu has run this business in front of her house for five years. 

Tu would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing a greater quantity and range of beverages to sell from her shop. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity and range of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Denge

texts.en:
Denge is married to a housewife. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past four years, Denge has operated a boda boda(motorcycle) business. His potential customers are neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge in the  high cost of purchasing fuel. Denge dreams of purchasing another motorcycle in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 Denge wants to add on his savings to purchase another motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To add to his savings to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Hekmat

texts.en:
Hekmat is a 59-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan with four children. She has an accessories and perfume shop and she is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to finance the purchasing of more products for her shop.

Hekmat is looking to expand her business and increase her living income.

loans.use: To expand her perfumes and accessories shop by purchasing more products.

loans.name: Arnoldo Segundo

texts.es:
Arnoldo, vive con sus padres y hermanos, es soltero, se dedica a la agricultura de granos básicos, este negocio se dio por su propia iniciativa y la ayuda de su familia, trabaja todos los días a tiempo completo.
El está solicitando un préstamo para el mantenimiento y la reparación de un tractor de trabajo, ello le ayudara a mantener en buen estado esta herramienta para darle cuidados a las siembras y a mejorar su cosecha para recibir mayores ingresos.
Su mayor sueño es mantenerse en el negocio  trabajar fuerte para mantenerse y salir adelante el y su familia.
texts.en:
Arnoldo lives with his parents and brothers. He is single and engaged in farming, growing basic grains. He got into this business through his own initiative and with help from his family. He works every day, full time.

He is applying for a loan in order to maintain and repair a tractor. The loan will help him maintain this tool in good working order so that it can help him with planting and improve his harvest so that he receives a bigger income. His biggest dream is to continue with his business, working hard in order to support himself and help him and his family progress.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance and repair of a tractor.

loans.name: Mikhael

texts.en: Mikhael is a 56-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children. He has 25 years experience working in the shoe business. He finally decided to have his own shoe factory almost four years ago. He cooperates with his wife who works in a locA. company to gather enough money and be able to pay the high costs of living.  Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase more shoes to sell. In the future, he’s looking to target wider markets.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Jhony Manuel

texts.es:
Jhony tiene 37 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa propia, la cual está terminando de construir.  La casa está ubicada en el Caserío San Eduardo Bajo Distrito de Tambogrande ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque. Jhony vive en la parte rural de este distrito y sólo cuenta con servicio básico de luz.

Jhony se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral, teniendo 20 cabezas y 15 pavos, los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en mercado local, además cuenta con 0.50 has de terreno agrícola que su padre le ha dado como herencia donde tiene limón en producción, generándole ingresos semanales para cubrir sus obligaciones crediticias.

Jhony desea comprar alimento balanceado para el engorde de ovinos y aves de corral, esto para alimentarlos y alcanzar rápidamente un nivel de desarrollo aceptable para su ganado y posteriormente venderlo. Es por ello que ha considerado conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa. Esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jhony, 37, is single with no children.  He lives in his own home, which he is finishing building.
