The house is located in the San Eduardo Bajo community in the district of Tambogrande, located four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the department of Lambayeque.  Jhony lives in the rural part of this district and only has basic electric service.

Jhony works raising sheep and poultry, having 20 head and 15 turkeys, which he raises and fattens to sell later in the local market.  He also has 0.5 hectares of land that his father handed down to him, where he grows lemons, generating weekly income to cover his loan obligations.

Jhony wants to buy balanced feed to fatten sheep and poultry, to feed them so they quickly reach an acceptable level of growth for his livestock, to later sell.  This is why he has considered it advisable to get a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.  This loan will allow him to continue growing and so improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten his livestock.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 30 years old and still single. She live with her parents at Caritan Norte, Tuguegarao, City. Ana Marie finished her vocational school. She involved herself in direct selling of beauty products such as cosmetics, perfumes and make up. She sells AVON, SARA LEE and NATASHA products. 

She is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy more quantity of cosmetics, perfumes, and make up to sell in the village where she lives.

In the future, Ana Marie would like to keep generating good income from her business and continue growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy more quantity of cosmetics, perfumes and make up to sell

loans.name: Marleny De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Marleny a sus 65 años de edad es madre de cuatro hijos, se dedica la confección de prendas de vestir especialmente trajes de novia, disfraces y uniformes. La señora Marleny desde los 12 años aprendió este oficio puesto que su madre tenia muy pocos recursos y era viuda, por lo que a la señora Marleny le tocaba confeccionar a mano su ropa y la de sus siete hermanos. Actualmente, la señora Marleny trabaja sola desde su propia casa. La señora Marleny requiere de la compra de materiales e insumos para realizar su trabajo tales como telas, hilos, tijeras y moldes. Con lo anterior, La señora Marleny podrá cubrir la demanda que tiene para la temporada de fin de año, aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella, sus hijos y nietos.
texts.en: Mrs. Marleny is 65 years old and a mother of four. She makes garments such as bridal dresses, costumes, and uniforms. Mrs. Marleny was taught at 12 years of age by her widowed mother with little resources and was in charge of hand sewing her own and her seven siblings' clothes. At the moment, Marleny works alone from her home. Mrs. Marleny needs to buy materials and supplies to make garments such as fabrics, thread, scissors, and patterns. Mrs. Marleny will be able to satisfy her demand that comes at the end of the year, increase her profits, and improve her quality of life as well as her childen's and grandchildren's.

loans.use: buy materials and supplies.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is applying for another loan to expand her existing business.  She will use this 50,000 Kes loan to purchase more cereals for resale.  In the future, Bahati aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Bahati has greatly improved her family’s standard of living.  She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cereals for resale.

loans.name: Sokny

texts.en:
Originally from a village located in the Ponhea Krek district, Sokny is a 40-year-old mother of five dependent children. Three of them are still in primary school. She has been working on paddy farming and planting cassava for 20 years to make a living while her husband is a homebuilder in the village. She earns more than $5 per day.

This is Sokny's first loan with VisionFund. Now requesting a loan, she will use this loan to buy cassava seedlings and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more cassava so as to earn more income and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy cassava seedlings and fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Edita Del Socorro

texts.es:
Edita, una sencilla y humilde costurera, de 54 años de edad, originaria de Granada. Inicio con su negocio pues quería independizarse y dejar de trabajar como domestica, tener mas tiempo con sus hijos para verlos crecer y al mismo tiempo desarrollarse como microempresaria. Ella cose trajes para niños, adultos, también elabora ropa para bebes tale como batitas, juegos de sabanitas.
Ella realizo el crédito para compra de tela, hilo y accesorios para elaborar sus productos. Actualmente ella trabaja en su humilde taller en casa y vende sus creaciones en el mercado municipal y a domicilio. Una de sus expectativas  es ampliar su negocio y hacer clientes nuevos en Masaya para dar a conocer sus productos fuera de Granada.
texts.en:
Edita, age 54, is a very unpretentious and humble seamstress from Granada.  She started her business because she wanted to become independent.  She wanted to leave her job as a maid and have more time with her children to see them grow.  At the same time she wanted to develop herself as a small businesswoman.   

She makes clothes for children and adults.  She also makes baby clothes like robes and matching sheets.

She got the loan to buy fabric, thread, and accessories to make her products.  She currently works in her humble workshop at her house.  She sells her creations at the municipal market and door-to-door.  One of her expectations is to expand her business.   She also expects to get new customers in Masaya in order for her products to be known outside of Granada.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and accessories to make her products.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Sergio is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol.  He is married and has five children between the ages of 2 and 14 years.

Sergio has been growing and selling rice for five years.  He tills his own land and makes sure his crops grow healthy.  Sergio earns about PHP 5000 per month doing this farming.  He has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides.  Sergio hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Massa

texts.fr: Massa est une femme mariée résidant à Adidogomé avec trois enfants à charge. Massa est une revendeuse de charbon de bois et de maïs qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Massa nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois et des bassines de maïs afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation à leurs enfants.

loans.use: Acheter 20 sacs de charbon de bois et 17 bassines de maïs.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila M. is married with two grown children. Her son is in college and her daughter helps her with her business. Ludmila’s husband is disabled and is not able to work. She is the only breadwinner in the family. Ludmila used some of her savings to start a small business selling women’s lingerie. She was able to purchase a small kiosk located in one of the local markets in busy downtown. Her polite manner and rich experience have helped her operate her business successfully. Over time she has gotten to know the preferences and tastes of her customers making her kiosk a popular stop when they visit the market. Her daughter’s active participation in the business has also added greatly to its success. To meet growing demand from her customers, Ludmila is requesting a loan for $1000 which will allow her to purchase more underwear at wholesale prices. Increased selling capacity will not only meet the needs of her clients, but the additional profits generated will meet another of Ludmilla’s goals – to help pay for her son’s college tuition. This loan will allow her to increase her income and provide the necessary funds to pay for her son’s education which she considers her most valuable investment.

Людмила Василівна – одружена, в неї двоє дорослих дітей. Її син навчається в університеті, дочка допомагає в бізнесі. Чоловік Людмили Василівни – інвалід, працювати не може. Людмила Василівна одна забезпечує родину. Для того, щоб почати власний бізнес з продажу жіночої білизни, Людмила Василівна використала деякі заощадження. Вона викупила маленький кіоск, розташований на одному з місцевих ринків в центрі міста. Її ввічливість та багатий досвід допомогли їй успішно керувати бізнесом. З часом вона навчилася відчувати смаки та побажання покупців, і саме це знову й знову приваблює клієнтів до її кіоску. Активна участь дочки в торгівлі також сприяла успішному зростанню бізнесу. Для того щоб задовольнити зростаючий попит, Людмила просить про позику в 1000 доларів, яка надасть їй можливість купити білизну за оптовими цінами. Зростання торгівлі не тільки задовольнить потреби клієнтів Людмили, але й допоможе їй отримати додатковий прибуток та заплатити за навчання сина в університеті. Позика допоможе їй збільшити прибутки та забезпечить необхідні кошти для навчання сина, яке Людмила вважає найціннішою інвестицією.

loans.use: To generate more profits to pay her son’s college fees
